column2:
>Welcome to the real Ladakh, which lives in its villages! 

So far that was an often desired but generally unavailable option, except on long treks!
column3:
>But now thanks to FarmStays Ladakh, you get to see Ladakh in its original splendour and glory and at the same time contribute to strengthening the people and the place...!  Like a true best friend.  Hows that!

But yes, this is an experience meant for the discerning TRAVELLERS, who want to explore, learn and share! 

We do understand that your holidays are important to you... So feel free to ask questions. We are just a call away +91 9622224947 or write to farmstaysladakh@gmail.com .
But do please read the FAQs at the end of this story first.
column8: >Hi!  I am Sonam Wangchuk,
column9: >I was born in a tiny village in Ladakh with just 5 households, I am a mechanical engineer by training, but have mostly worked with education reforms in Ladakh. This included setting up the SECMOL Alternative School
column10:
>well known for its many innovative solutions to the region's unique problems. I won’t write more about myself, you can Google my name (a not so usual name helps). 
Or watch this TEDx Talk: https://goo.gl/lFG11G

column1: Solar powered campus of the SECMOL Alternative School

THE ICE STUPA ARTIFICIAL GLACIER PROJECT

This is our latest invention…  a very simple technique of freezing the unused stream water in winter into huge cones (stupas) of ice that then melt slowly into late spring providing water for trees and farms.

Some of you might remember that to make the pilot Ice stupas in Phyang we ran a successful crowdfunding campaign on Indiegogo. We are truly grateful to the thousands of you who supported us with contributions or helped spread the message globally.


Thanks to your support we were able to build several pilot Ice stupas at different altitudes in Phyang valley.   5,000 trees were planted by the villagers on a total desert where the first ice stupa was built. The trees have been blooming for the 2nd summer with 97% survival rate.

FARMSTAYS LADAKH 

While working on water issues in the Phyang valley we noticed that perhaps water was not the only problem the village was facing.  In several parts of the village there was no shortage of water and yet farms were left uncultivated. Then one day we happened to meet 83 years old Abi Disket in Murudok the highest village in Phyang valley at 4,000m altitude.
column3:
/>  In a sad voice she recounted her life and that’s when we realized that she and several others of her age were living a lonely life looking after much of the farm work as the younger folk had left for Leh city.

She was our inspiration for doing something beyond just water solutions… knowing that more water might only mean more work for the octogenarian at a time when she should be retiring and telling stories to her grand-children... (one of the highlights of a Ladakhi childhood).  We realized that due to this urban migration, not only the grannies live a lonely life… the children also miss a very beautiful part of Ladakhi upbringing!

That was a year ago. We then started exploring possibilities to improve the village economy and make life here more attractive for the youngsters. Tourism, or rather its concentration in Leh city... we saw was a big culprit for her woes…and we thought TOURISM should also be the solution. Like they say diamond cuts diamond or loha lohe ko kaatti hai in Hindi…  So we thought of bringing sensitive meaningful tourism to the village itself, so that village life becomes attractive and lucrative.


Thus in July last 2015, together with the Amalays (mothers) in Phyang village we came up with the concept of FarmStays Ladakh so as to turn tourism into an opportunity rather than a problem for the rural areas. 

But before scaling it up to all the regions in Ladakh we wanted to test the concept in one or two villages. We started with 3 families in Phyang last year to test the concept and got very encouraging reviews. Most visitors wanted to either comeback or send their friends and relatives or both.

Then in 2016 we did it a bit more systematically. Together with the Gobas (headmen) of Phyang and Phey and other village leaders 12 families were selected based on their interest, active farming, availability of rooms and completeness of the family. A team of experts then trained the Amalays to prepare and present their houses as a farm stay.  This included the topics ranging from hygiene to cultural differences and a little bit of English language.

Finally on  18th June 2016 the FarmStays Ladakh was formally inaugurated by HH Chetsang Rinpochey and Dr. Sonam Dawa the Chairman of the Hill Council Government in Ladakh along with Mr. Sangdup the Tourism Minister of the Hill Council.  

In order to help this project in the initial stages I personally donated USD 2,200 (Rs. 1.5 lakh) for the initial overhead costs and now we hope we will get global support through this campaign so that we can prepare many more homes for the next season.
column4:
>SO FAR SO GOOD!

Today the families themselves are very happy that their own house brings employment for them and their children. The young are happy that they get to meet interesting people from around the world and get to learn languages and other skills while they share their own.
column6: /> Ama Angmo who used to fear that it would soon be her turn to be lonely after Abi Disket, is now happy that her home is lively and her village might become more interesting for her children.
column8:
/> Ama  Rigzin says her children hopefully won’t need to go as tourist guides to other places...  Meanwhile neighbours are already talking about bringing their own children back from the city, since FarmStays Ladakh does not accept families that are not complete.

With their farm income supplemented through tourism we were able to take up another important issue facing agriculture in Ladakh… the trend of going for chemical inputs like fertilizers and pesticides. We talked to the Amalays about making their farms fully organic even if the yields are lower in the first few years, as now they have more income from the farm stay guests. They all readily agreed and recently the families adopted a charter to that effect in the holy presence of HH Chetsang Rinpochey.

His Holiness Chetsang Rinpochey and the Dr. Sonam Dawa, Chairman of the Ladakh Hill Council at the formal launch of FarmStays Ladakh.

WAY AHEAD…

column1: Already these women have done business of over 150,000 rupees in
just three months with very little promotion.  Now that we are confident
about the model and the happiness levels of the guests, we are ready to scale
it up through this crowdfunding campaign.  The advance bookings will help us help new families with the investment needed to repair and prepare their homes to host guests.
With your support we will also be able to expand this into other
regions like Nubra, Pangong, Sham, Kargil and Zanskar. This way visitors can
make a whole circuit of visiting all parts of Ladakh while staying at
FarmStays.

1.  Your general support to the Farmstay project will help promote the project and help us also with costs of identifying suitable families and training them to start farm stays at their home.  Your support will also help us develop alternative income sources for the women especially for winter months, for example production of handicrafts and home-processed farm foods.
column2: >2. Your bookings through this crowdfunding campaign will pre-sell the farm stay rooms for this

column1: year and next year.  This will enable us
to give advance funds to new families to repair and prepare their homes to
receive guests in next season.  This advance fund is what stops many cash-poor families with beautiful old houses from coming forward to benefit from this programme.

column1:
• Q: How to prepare for Ladakh physically? AMS?
    A
column2: Ladakh being at altitudes above 3,000 m you have to be careful not to get Acute Mountain Sickness (AMS). You are advised to take total rest for 24 hours upon arrival, drink lots of water and in case of nausea visit a doctor.

Sinagua Malt: Market Based River Conservation
Sinagua Malt is a unique opportunity to create a source of locally grown and processed malt barley while improving flows in the Verde River.  Why?

There is not a malting facility in Arizona – therefore malt for local beer all comes from out of state – not local.  Barley is a low water use crop – growing it in the Verde Valley can improve streamflow.  Sinagua Malt provides benefits to beer drinkers, farmers and river lovers!
What We Need &

Sinagua Malt has worked to secure private investment to purchase malting equipment and secure a location in Camp Verde Arizona.  Through this campaign we are seeking to secure 2017 operating costs – this include initial purchase of grain, hiring a malt master and getting the doors open.
Help us raise this last $100,000 to ensure that malt is ready for beer by October this year!  Check out our great perks - or just contribute what you can!
The Impact

Sinagua Malt is one of many projects that are taking place to restore and protect the Verde River and to protecting local agriculture.  This is a unique opportunity for you to engage in these important issues that affect Arizona.  But this concept is not just limited to Arizona – once successful this type of work can be implemented in other areas where development of a local market can drive conservation and support the local economy.
Sinagua Malt has partnered with Hauser and Hauser Farms and The Nature Conservancy to develop this collaborative solution.
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:
<ul>
• Learn more about the Verde River and ways to protect it:  https://www.nature.org/ourinitiatives/regions/northamerica/unitedstates/arizona/placesweprotect/verde-river.xml
• Share this campaign with your friends!

We each have the power to shape the world we live in.

The food we eat impacts all facets of life. It plays a major role in personal health and wellbeing and also shapes the world we live in.

Today, our food choices have become more consequential than ever. Meat production in particular has taken on more significance in recent years and is now a major contributor to climate change, producing more greenhouse gas emissions than every car, truck, plane, train and ship combined. It is also responsible for environmental degradation including deforestation, mass species extinction, water shortages and water pollution. When it comes to personal health, excessive meat consumption has been linked with heart disease, diabetes and cancer, amongst other illnesses. 

The challenge however, is that meat based meals are everywhere we go. Trying to reduce our consumption is usually inconvenient and difficult. Sustainly hopes to change this, by using technology to transform the world around us into a giant sustainable food map, which pin-points every healthy and sustainable meal around you, anywhere you are.  The goal behind the project, is to make it easy and convenient for anyone to find delicious food that is good for you and good for the planet too. By doing this, we hope to give people a powerful tool, that helps each of us shape the world we live in through small actions everyday. 

How it works.

Sustainly is driven by a primary mission: To catalogue the worlds food and make access to healthy and sustainable food easy and convenient. Every meal, at every venue, everywhere. To do this, we’re building a crowdsourced platform that allows each of us to contribute. We take pictures of our food all the time and Sustainly lets us transform these pictures into a powerful health and environmental tool. The app then uses these pictures, to build sustainable food maps, which shows every delicious, healthy and sustainable meal around you, whether you're relaxing at home, walking on the street or even sitting in a restaurant. With Sustainly, picking something tasty to eat that’s healthy and sustainable has never been easier.

Our key ingredients:

Convenience

Whenever you're hungry, just open Sustainly to find a selection of tasty meat-free meals from places nearby. You can browse through gorgeous pictures, read in-depth reviews and see ratings for each meal and can also search for meals by price, cuisine, restaurant, distance and even ingredient.


We call this the 'Living Menu'. Instead of spending time trying to figure out where to find a delicious meat-free meal, sustainly puts all your options in one place. This way, you can cut out the clutter and focus on what really matters - the food.
column2:
>

Habit

Sustainly let's you log your meals, which helps you keep track of your meat consumption. It's a pro-active system, which works in a simple way.

Before breakfast, lunch and dinner, Sustainly will send you a notification asking you what you are going to eat. To log a meal, you simply tap one of two squares: Green if you are having a meal without meat and Orange if you are having a meal with meat. If you tap the Green square, you are immediately served a list of delicious meat free meals around you.

By being pro-active, Sustainly helps you make better food choices without needing to think about it.
column3:
>

Impact

Sustainly takes the data collected from your meal logs and uses it to show you how your eating habits compare with the average meat eater in your demographic. 

This can serve as a motivational tool, as you get to see how your choices can make a difference. You can also connect to social networks to keep track of how friends are doing. 

With impact visualization, not only can Sustainly help you make healthier choices, but it lets you feel good about them too.
column4:
>

Contribution 

Sustainly is crowdsourced environmentalism. We all contribute to its usefulness and success because each meal on the app is added and edited by its users.

One day, Sustainly could become the largest food database on the planet. This could make it a powerful health resource in addition to being a positive tool in the fight against climate change.

By helping each other change our eating habits, we're also changing the world together.
column5:
>

Intelligence

Incredible things can happen when people come together to solve big problems. By combining the power of crowdsourced data, with technologies like machine learning and artificial intelligence, Sustainly can change the way we choose food.

Imagine being able to find meals based on health requirements, “Show me food nearby that is safe for diabetics,” or cravings, “Find meals around me with mushrooms and artichokes under $10”, or dietary preferences, “Show me meals in this restaurant that are gluten free and high in fibre,” or fitness goals, “Create a monthly meal plan based on my fitness goals from the Fitbit app,” or even finding food for your family, “What’s good in this market for a 5 year old boy.”

The potential is limitless.
column6:
>

What we hope to raise.

We don't only want to build an incredible tool to help encourage sustainable eating habits. We want to build the best food app ever made. That's why we have an open funding goal. Ultimately, what we are able to achieve with Sustainly comes down to you and the community at large. We have some great ideas about how we can innovate to make Sustainly the only tool you need to find healthy and sustainable food for you and your family. Have a look at our targets below to see what we have planned for now and the future. 

$50,000

The launchpad. The first beta of Sustainly is built and we start limited testing with users in a small number of locations. Beta features will include the ability to add meals to the catalogue and the ability to see meals around you.

$100,000

We have Lift-Off. A full version 1.0 is built and will be open to all users in a select number of cities. Besides the features in the beta, this version will include individual account and profile creation and the ability to search for meals by food type. 

$200,000 

Sustainly goes global. In version 1.5 we open up Sustainly to users around the world and include all the features of version 1.0 and add the ability to include ingredients and ratings for meals as well as the ability to get quick directions to meal locations. We'll also add the ability for users to link social media accounts like Instagram and Facebook so that you can add pictures to the Sustainly catalogue by simply adding #sustainly to the pictures of food you share on social media. 

$500,000 

Impact reporting. Version 2.0 - We begin marketing sustainly to a wider audience to help grow it and make it more useful to more people around the world. Version 2.0 will also include the ability to log your meals, which in turn can show you how your eating habits impact the environment. We’ll also build Apple Watch and Google Wear integration to make it even easier to find healthy and sustainable food nearby. This version adds special restaurant accounts, which allow venue owners and managers to add and manage meals served at their establishments. This will help make the app more useful in more places faster.

$1,000,000 

The best and most powerful food app in the world. If we raise $1,000,000, it will give us the resources to begin work on the full vision of sustainly. This includes crowdsourced recipes, so that the food you cook at home can be just as impactful as the food you get on the go. We’ll also be able to invest in creating a smarter search which allows you to say things like ‘Show me meals nearby with mushrooms and artichokes under $10’, or ‘What can I cook that includes olive oil, broccoli and zucchinis’. We’ll also add social features like the ability to share your impact reports with friends, so you can motivate each other to keep up the good work. 

$2,000,000+ 

Change the way we choose food. We grow sustainly, add innovative new features and market it on a wide scale and accelerate the impact of the platform. By this stage we’ll be armed with a great product and the additional resources will allow us to get the product out to more people in order to help change the way we choose food. We also hope to make sustainly smarter using machine learning and artificial intelligence, as well as integrating with third-party health and fitness apps. Imagine a future where you can tell sustainly to suggest meals based on dietary restrictions, ‘Show me food in this restaurant that’s gluten free’, or health considerations, 'Show me meals nearby that are safe for diabetics,' or fitness goals ,‘Set up a meal plan for 4 weeks based on the latest fitness goals in my Fitbit app' and even make choosing food for your family easy, 'Set up a monthly meal plan for Alex who is a 5 year old boy'. We're planning on innovating to create a convenience never seen before with food discovery.

Who we are:
column8:
>

I am a product designer who loves finding solutions to problems using creativity and innovative technology. As a meat eater who also cares about the environment, I sought to try and create a tool that would help people make better food choices by focussing on making it easy and convenient for them to do so. I hope that sustainly speaks to the imagination of those who care about food and the environment, as well as anyone else who would like to live a healthier and more sustainable life. I truly believe that we are able to influence major issues in numbers and hopefully sustainly can help bring people together in a way that lets us help each other become healthier inhabitants of a healthier planet. 

","We each have the power to shape the world we live in.The food we eat impacts all facets of life. It plays a major role in personal health and wellbeing and also shapes the world we live in.Today, our food choices have become more consequential than ever. Meat production in particular has taken on more significance in recent years and is now a major contributor to climate change, producing more greenhouse gas emissions than every car, truck, plane, train and ship combined. It is also responsible for environmental degradation including deforestation, mass species extinction, water shortages and water pollution. When it comes to personal health, excessive meat consumption has been linked with heart disease, diabetes and cancer, amongst other illnesses. The challenge however, is that meat based meals are everywhere we go. Trying to reduce our consumption is usually inconvenient and difficult. Sustainly hopes to change this, by using technology to transform the world around us into a giant sustainable food map, which pin-points every healthy and sustainable meal around you, anywhere you are.  The goal behind the project, is to make it easy and convenient for anyone to find delicious food that is good for you and good for the planet too. By doing this, we hope to give people a powerful tool, that helps each of us shape the world we live in through small actions everyday. How it works.Sustainly is driven by a primary mission: To catalogue the worlds food and make access to healthy and sustainable food easy and convenient. Every meal, at every venue, everywhere. To do this, we’re building a crowdsourced platform that allows each of us to contribute. We take pictures of our food all the time and Sustainly lets us transform these pictures into a powerful health and environmental tool. The app then uses these pictures, to build sustainable food maps, which shows every delicious, healthy and sustainable meal around you, whether you're relaxing at home, walking on the street or even sitting in a restaurant. With Sustainly, picking something tasty to eat that’s healthy and sustainable has never been easier.Our key ingredients:ConvenienceWhenever you're hungry, just open Sustainly to find a selection of tasty meat-free meals from places nearby. You can browse through gorgeous pictures, read in-depth reviews and see ratings for each meal and can also search for meals by price, cuisine, restaurant, distance and even ingredient.We call this the 'Living Menu'. About the Company 

Shayna EcoUnified India Pvt. Ltd. is a team of young entrepreneurs with significant knowledge in the field of plastic waste management. We are committed to developing new waste management solutions that can help in achieving its green goals. We are strongly committed to promoting recycle and reuse. We aim at providing solutions that go far beyond simply taking the rubbish away. We have a clear understanding of the importance of our role in managing the waste we all generate. We are looking at the future of waste management, and we have a plan.

We are the first holder of Council of Scientific &
column2: Industrial Research (CSIR)-National Physical Laboratory’s (NPL) technology and registered under Ministry of Commerce &amp
column3:
Industry in its continuous efforts has unified its conventional techniques and resources to reduce environmental pollution. Shayna EcoUnified, developed as part of the fast-track translational project has incorporated useful waste plastic matrix in its process which is further transformed into structural tiles.

EcoUnifying Value

Plastic bags and bottles are the most widespread forms of litter. It is safe to assume that plastic bags are somewhere necessitating a mindfulness of ecological sustainability. With numerous measures being adopted by several nations, plastic bags continue to be a part of our ecosystem further forcing us to reconsider the measures adopted to stop the plastic bags transaction. Recycling is an old norm pursued by many companies but an intelligent conversion of the latter is still far from being achieved or even thought upon.

Recycling is an approach which is decided and applied on a community by a community. At present many companies are working towards a “single stream” recycling cycle which means that the hard plastic items are being considered and softer plastic materials like plastic bags never experience the recycle process. Plastic bags, created in infinite numbers, used by nearly every individual are responsible for generating 50% of water pollution and 70% of air pollution.

Shanya Ecounified, a company driven with an achievable, intelligent and sustainable goal has recognized the disconnect in the present recycling scenario. Working towards a goal of creating a greener footprint, Shanya has created a much required and logical wealth from waste.

Uniqueness of our product

It has several advantages over cement &
column4:
cermaic tiles and to be ready to use without drying is one of them. 

Application of the tiles:

We have drawn importance from waste which continues to corrupt the natural habitat of the planet further fracturing the health of many. Here’s a look at the optimum applications of floor tiles created out of plastic waste:

• Roof tiles • Interlocking tiles • Floor tiles • Pavement tiles • Wall tiles • Building Structures  like public toilets, shelter homes, health centres &
column5:
dispensaries, park benches etc.  

Remarkably, the tiles can also be further recycled and reused for other structural designs.

The Technology 

(CSIR-NPL) has developed a technology that provides a solution to solid waste management and promotes a waste to energy program, which is urgently required in our country’s recycling industry. Plastic recycling is the process of recovering scrap or waste plastic and reprocessing the material into useful products. We are aiming to recycle plastic waste into plastic tiles to use for the development of our society. Making tiles from plastic takes less time for processing than cement tiles. Their weight is also less, making them easy to handle.

The Process

Support

The team is currently seeking funding to set up a full- fledged production unit and to generate pre-orders for the plastic waste tiles. We have invested a significant amount in buying the license from CSIR for using the technology and now looking for support which can be helpful in further funding this unique “Clean and Green” initiative of ours where we are not only going to put plastic waste to good use but also employ solar power to manufacture the tiles instead of using electricity. 

Our team is in need of financial support in setting up the plastic tile manufacturing unit. We have worked out on a budget of approx $ 1,94,766 to buy equipment and start the manufacturing process. To secure funds, we have applied under several Start Up schemes announced by the Indian government and are awaiting response.

Cost breakdown

column9: >picture: visiting a rural school in Argentina with the project 'Eco Bus America'
column11:
>Will you help me inspire the world? 

Thanks for taking time to read and watch my campaign! I am Jorien Timmers (26) from Holland, graduated psychologist and currently living and traveling around the world. I am excited to tell you something about how this whole project started.

Environmental issues and climate change have always been a worrying factor to me. However, I also felt that the problems seemed so overwhelming big that I thought that I as an individual couldn’t really do anything about it. I think a lot of people feel the same impotence when we talk about environmental issues. We know about the general problem and we rather get upset with big contaminating companies than that we change something to our own daily habits. I have realised that change really does start by ourselves and that’s why I want to inspire as much people around the world as possible and let them feel that change is needed and that it all starts with changing our own habits. I want to do this by crossing Latin America in a sustainable vehicle. I will visit schools along the way to do my project and explain them why this is so important. I already started giving workshops and talks at schools in South America accompanied by movies about environmental subjects and I see the big impact this has on those kids. I think that even though nowadays where we live in a society where obtaining information became very easy for everybody it is still very important or even more important to physically visit people and bring the information to them. I think this way you can have a real impact on them showing what's happening with our planet and teach them the existing alternatives to live a more sustainable life. The sustainable vehicle with all the products and objects I use to be able to live on zero waste, is a great live example and will make it easier to teach them how to apply this on their own lives.
column12:
>What I need and how I thank you for your support

To make this project successful I will need to make a fully sustainable vehicle. this will cost me around 20.000 euro's. Apart from that I want to show movies with a mobile cinema. Therefore I will need equipment, which will cost me around 2.000 euros. To make the documentary about the whole trip and to keep you all updated with videos and tutorials I will need to buy film equipment like cameras lenses and hard disks this will cost me around 3.000 euro's. In total I will need 25.000 euro’s to be able to start the project.

How will I thank you for your support? First of all I think it is important to say that the main goal of this project is to spread the word about environmental issues with a real life example of the sustainable driving bus (with sustainable working products in it) and the mobile cinema in combination with the workshops and talks. Helping me with this project means that you are helping the world a step forward to make of it a better one! You can donate whatever amount you want and you can choose to get a CD with songs sung by me especially made for this project where you can listen to songs from countries that I will be visiting during my trip. If you sell or produce a product that has to do with sustainable living and you are interested in promotion of it, there is also the possibility to donate a product and I will make promotion for it during my trip by showing it and by sticking the name of the brand on the back of my vehicle.

€​15>
column13:
Digital Thank You! To show my thanks, I will send you a special thank you note and you get a colouring picture of the project. (download file)

€​30>
column14:
I will send you a digital song sung by me with ‘Dúo Tódo’ 

€​50>
column15:
I sent you my CD with music from countries I will be visiting during the project in Latin-America. sung by me especially made for this project.

€​100>
column16:
Get free access to watch the documentary that I will make about the whole trip. (available after the whole project is finished)

€​1000>
column17: This is such a big help to my project! If time and place coincide I will perform live for you and sing you some songs! We can also have contact to see if there is other ways how I can thank you for such a big help!
column18:
>When is my donation going to be used?

Before this whole project starts I will be in brasil, Holland and Spain for a while. I start to build the vehicle from September/October 2018 in California and when it’s ready I start driving. The exact date I start driving is difficult to tell because it will depend a lot on how easy it is to convert the vehicle into a totally sustainable one.
column19:
>What if I don't reach the entire amount of financial support?

If I don’t reach my entire goal with this crowdfunding campaign it doesn’t mean that this project is not going to happen. I will definitely do everything to make this project a success so I will keep searching for funding and apart from that I will work as much as possible to be able to start in September/October 2018.
column20:
>The impact

Your contribution whether it’s big or small will help me and the planet enormously. In the direct form it will help me to get everything ready to start the project but indirectly your contribution will help even more because it will help the thousands of people I will visit with the project to get inspired to help the planet! This means that YOU can have a tremendous impact on saving this planet just by helping my project with your contribution. 

I already started in Argentina with teaching about environmental issues by projecting movies, giving workshops and talks and making music in primary and secondary schools. In one word a big success! I have been invited to talk on several local radio stations to come and talk about the project and several newspapers wrote about the success of my visits.
column22:
Challenges

There are a few things that might be challenging during this whole project. The first thing is that I am running this project alone. Even though that’s my choice I should be aware of the fact that sometimes things can go slower or that I really need help sometimes to get things done. I think this is a challenge but the enormous drive I feel inside about making a success of this project will help me to move on!

To make a vehicle 100% sustainable there is technology needed and people who are willing to help me building it. A risk would be that I don’t find the way to make a 100% sustainable vehicle. I think all the contacts I made the past 2 years will definitely help me with this challenge. In that case I will not be able to make it 100% sustainable I will make the vehicle partial sustainable with the possibility that during the trip the vehicle will become more sustainableevery time.
column23:
>Other ways you can help me

There are a bunch of other ways to help me and they are as valuable as money! If you sell sustainable products from whatever kind that I can promote during my trip, donating those products would be a great way of helping me. I can promote those products by showing people how I use them and by sticking your name on my vehicle! Or just help me to spread the word and share my story and campaign, talk with people about it and share it on your Facebook, twitter or Instagram with the Indiegogo share tools.
column24: >Picture: Workshop making natural toothpaste
column25: >picture: giving a talk about plastic pollution on a rural school
column27:
>Help jij mij de wereld te inspireren? 

Wat fijn dat je even de tijd neemt om mijn campagne te bekijken! Ik ben Jorien Timmers (26), afgestudeerd psychologe en sinds twee jaar reizende door verschillende landen.

Ik heb me eigenlijk van kleins af aan al bezig gehouden met milieukwesties. Ik heb me er ook op verschillende manieren voor ingezet. Ondanks de zorgen die ik me er soms over maakte, overheerste echter vaak een gevoel van onmacht, omdat de problemen zo ontzettend groot bleken te zijn, dat ik dacht: Wat kan ík hier nou eigenlijk echt aan doen? Ik denk dat veel mensen dit gevoel van onmacht wel kennen als het gaat om het oplossen van milieukwesties. We kennen het probleem, maar worden vaak boos op de grote milieuvervuilende bedrijven, zonder dat we echt eens goed bekijken wat we er zelf allemaal aan kunnen doen. Ik heb me gerealiseerd, dat verandering toch echt bij onszelf begint en dat is de aanleiding geweest voor mijn project. Ik wil zoveel mogelijk mensen over de hele wereld inspireren en laten zien, dat verandering nodig is en dat deze verandering begint bij het veranderen van onze eigen dagelijkse gewoonten. Ik ga dit doen door met een milieuvriendelijke bus en een mobiele bioscoop van Californië naar het zuiden van Argentinië te reizen. Tijdens deze reis zal ik zo min mogelijk afval produceren. Ik wil scholen, culturele centra e.d gaan bezoeken met het doel bewustzijn te creëren door middel van het tonen van films over milieu thema’s zoals het gebruik van plastic en aan de hand hiervan wil ik lezingen en workshops geven. Hierbij zal het levende voorbeeld van mijn leven met zo min mogelijk afval de milieuvriendelijke bus zijn, waarin ik producten gebruik, die zoveel mogelijk milieuvriendelijk zijn. Ik wil hiermee de mensen inspireren en vooral ook laten voelen, dat verandering nodig is en ook de mogelijkheden laten zien hoe we deze verandering kunnen aanpakken. Het feit dat er vandaag de dag zoveel informatie beschikbaar is op elk gebied, zo ook op dit gebied, wil niet zeggen, dat het ook aankomt bij mensen. Ik denk dat een fysiek persoon met een fysiek voorbeeld echt een indruk kan maken en iemand kan inspireren ook zelf aan de slag te gaan door het zien van voorbeelden over hoe te kunnen leven met minder afval.
column28:
>Wat ik nodig heb voor dit project en hoe ik jou bedank?

Om van dit project een succes te maken, zal ik een bus moeten kopen en ombouwen tot een milieuvriendelijke bus. Dit zal me rond de 20.000 euro gaan kosten. Daarnaast wil ik films laten zien met een mobiele milieuvriendelijke bioscoop. Hiervoor zal ik rond de 2.000 euro nodig hebben. En om van dit hele project een documentaire te maken zal ik materiaal nodig hebben zoals camera’s, lenzen en hard disks. Dit alles zal rond de 3.000 euro’s gaan kosten. In totaal zal ik dus rond de 25.000 euro nodig hebben om te kunnen starten met dit project.

Wat krijg jij? Ten eerste is het belangrijk te weten dat het hoofddoel van dit project het verspreiden van bewustwording is op het gebied van milieukwesties aan de hand van het levende voorbeeld, namelijk de milieuvriendelijke bus, die volledig milieuvriendelijk functioneert. En daarnaast met de mobiele bioscoop die mee gaat en de workshops en talks die gegeven worden. Het doneren aan mijn project betekent eigenlijk het mee helpen redden van deze planeet. Je kunt elk bedrag doneren en daarvoor ontvang je een persoonlijk bedankje in de vorm van een in eigen beheer opgenomen cd met liedjes door mijzelf gezongen van de landen die ik zal aandoen op mijn reis. Als je een verkoper of maker bent van een product, dat te maken heeft met milieuvriendelijk leven, dan is er ook de mogelijkheid een product te doneren, zodat ik dit product tijdens mijn reis promoot doormiddel van het demonstreren ervan en daarnaast door uw logo/merk op de achterkant van mijn busje te plakken.

€ 15,00>
column29:
Digitaal bedankje met bijgevoegd een kleurplaat van het project (pdf)

€ 30,00>
column30:
Ik stuur je een online liedje van ‘Dúo Tódo’

€ 50,00 >
column31:
Ontvang mijn cd met liederen gezongen door mij zelf van de landen, die ik tijdens mijn reis ga bezoeken in Latijns-America.

€1000 >
column32: Dit is echt een geweldige bijdrage aan mijn project. Als tijd en plaats samenvallen kom ik live voor je zingen! We kunnen ook even contact opnemen over andere manieren hoe ik je zou kunnen bedanken voor deze grote bijdrage aan mijn project!
column33:
>Wanneer zal mijn donatie gebruikt worden?

Voordat dit hele project begint, zal ik nog een tijdje in Brazilië, Spanje en Nederland zijn. Het plan is, dat ik ga beginnen met het bouwen van het busje in september/oktober 2018 in Californië en als dat klaar is begint de reis. De exacte datum is moeilijk in te schatten, want dat zal afhangen van hoe snel het ombouwen van het busje zal gaan.
column34:
>Wat als ik mijn gehele doelbedrag niet haal?

Als ik mijn gehele doelbedrag niet bij elkaar krijg via de crowdfunding-actie, zal dit niet betekenen dat het niet doorgaat. Ik ga er alles aan doen om van dit project een succes te maken en ik zal daarom door blijven gaan met financiële steun zoeken en daarnaast zal ik zo veel mogelijk gaan werken, zodat ik weg kan gaan op de streefdatum, namelijk september 2018.
column35:
>Impact

Jouw bijdrage, al is het klein of groot, kan dit project en deze planeet een hele grote stap vooruit helpen. Direct zal het mij helpen om alles voor te bereiden en in orde te maken en te vertrekken, maar indirect zal jou bijdrage nog veel meer invloed hebben. Het zal het namelijk mogelijk maken alle mensen die ik op mijn reis tegenkom te inspireren bewuster met deze planeet om te gaan door hun gewoonten te veranderen. Dit betekent dat JIJ een enorme impact kan hebben op het redden van deze planeet alleen al door het doneren van geld.

Ik ben in Argentinië al gestart met lesgeven over milieu-issues door middel van films en presentaties en door het geven van workshops en het maken van muziek op scholen. In één woord een groot succes. Ik ben daarnaast gevraagd op verschillende lokale radiostations om mijn verhaal te doen en verschillende kranten hebben artikelen geschreven, over het succes van mijn project op scholen.
column36:
>Risico’s en uitdagingen

Er zijn een aantal uitdagingen aan dit project. De eerste is het feit dat ik dit project zelf run. Ook al is dit mijn bewuste keuze, het zal niet altijd makkelijk zijn en sommige dingen zullen daardoor langzamer gaan dan gewild en ik zal soms hulp moeten vragen aan derden. Dit is een echte uitdaging, maar ik denk dat de enorme drive die ik voel om door te zetten met dit project, me hierin enorm zal helpen!

Om het busje 100% milieuvriendelijk te maken is er technologie nodig en zijn er mensen nodig die bereid zijn te helpen het busje zo milieuvriendelijk mogelijk om te bouwen. Een risico is, dat ik niet de perfecte manier vind om het busje totaal milieuvriendelijk te krijgen. Ik denk dat de contacten, die ik de afgelopen 2 jaar gemaakt heb, zeker helpen bij deze uitdaging. Indien het toch lastig wordt het busje volledig milieuvriendelijk te maken, zal hij gedeeltelijk milieuvriendelijk gemaakt worden met de mogelijkheid hem onderweg steeds milieuvriendelijker te laten rijden.
column37:
>Andere manieren waarop je me kunt helpen?

Er zijn vele manieren waarop je me zou kunnen helpen en deze zijn net zo waardevol als geld! Als je milieubewuste/vriendelijke producten verkoopt of maakt van wat voor soort dan ook, dan kan ik daar reclame voor maken tijdens mijn reis. Het doneren van deze producten geeft mij de mogelijkheid deze producten te gebruiken in mijn busje en te laten zien aan anderen hoe ze werken. Daarnaast kan ik een sticker van het merk achter op de bus plakken. Of je kunt helpen mijn campagne te delen op Facebook, twitter en Instagram met de Indiegogo share tool. Of gewoon van mond op mond.
column38: >picture: giving a talk about plastic pollution on a secondary school, Argentina
column40: >picture: Visiting a school in rural village in Argentina showing movies about environmental problems
column42:
>¿Me ayudas a inspirar al mundo?

¡Gracias por tomar tu tiempo para leer y seguir mi campaña! Soy Jorien Timmers (26) de Holanda, psicóloga recibida y actualmente vivo viajando por el mundo. Con mucho gusto les cuento cómo empezó todo este proyecto.

El cambio climático y los problemas ambientales siempre han sido un factor preocupante para mí. Sin embargo, me parecían tan grandes que sentí que yo, como individuo, no podía hacer tanto al respecto. Creo que nos pasa a muchos de nosotros el sentimiento de impotencia cuando hablamos de temas medio ambientales. Conocemos el problema general y preferimos quejarnos sobre las grandes empresas contaminantes, en vez de enfocarnos en lo que nosotros mismos diariamente podemos hacer al respecto por ejemplo al cambiar nuestros hábitos. Me di cuenta que el cambio realmente comienza por nosotros mismos y es por eso que quiero inspirar a las personas de todo el mundo y hacerles sentir que se necesita un cambio y que ellos mismos pueden tener mucha influencia en ese cambio.

El proyecto que quiero comenzar es el siguiente: Quiero cruzar América Latina en un vehículo sustentable. Llevando un cine móvil y dando talleres y charlas sobre temas medio ambientales. Durante el viaje vivo sin producir basura. Visitaré entre ellas, escuelas y centros culturales. Ya empecé a dar talleres y charlas en escuelas en Latino América, y veo el gran impacto que tiene en los niños y adultos. Creo que a pesar de que hoy en día vivimos en una época en la que obtener información resulta muy fácil para todos, no es de menor importancia visitar físicamente a las personas para acercarles la información, y de esta manera, puede tener un impacto real en ellos, mostrando lo que está sucediendo con nuestro planeta y brindando alternativas diversas para vivir una vida con mayor conciencia. El vehículo sustentable en el que me trasladaré por Latino América, será de gran ejemplo vivo, ya que uno de objetivos primordiales del viaje será vivir sin generar basura y hará que sea más fácil enseñar cómo aplicar esto en la vida de las personas que sean atravesadas por este viaje.
column43:
>Que necesito y como te agradezco la ayuda?

Para dar el punta pie inicial a este proyecto, tendré que adaptar un vehículo para convertirlo completamente a sustentable. Esto me costará alrededor de 20000 euros. Aparte de eso, quiero mostrar películas a través de un cine móvil y necesitaré equipamiento, que me costará aproximadamente 2000 euros.

Para hacer ‘El documental’ de todo el viaje, necesitaré comprar equipos, como lentes, cámaras y discos duros, esto me costará alrededor de 3000 euros. En total, necesitaré 25,000 euros para poder comenzar el proyecto.

¿Cómo le agradezco? En primer lugar, creo que es importante decir que el objetivo principal de este proyecto es difundir información sobre los problemas medio ambientales que afectan nuestro planeta para generar consciencia. Ayudarme con este proyecto significa que estás ayudando al mundo y en la concientización para que las personas comiencen a cuidarlo. A cambio de tu donación, del cual tú puedes elegir la cantidad de dinero que colaboras, les envío un CD en el cual canto canciones de países de Latino America los cuales voy a visitar con mi proyecto ‘Eco Bus América’. Además, si vendes o produces un producto que tiene que ver con vivir de manera sustentable y estas interesado en promocionarlo, existe la posibilidad de donar tu producto y lo mencionaré durante mi viaje mostrándolo a la gente y pondré su logo/marca atrás en mi vehículo.

€ 15,00 >
column44:
Para mostrarle mi agradecimiento, le enviaré un agradecimiento especial digitalmente. Te mando también una imagen para colorear del proyecto.

€ 30,00 >
column45:
Te enviaré una canción digital cantada por mí con 'Dúo Tódo'

€ 50,00 >
column46:
te envío mi CD con música de los países que visitaré durante el proyecto en América Latina.

€ 1000 >
column47: Iré a visitarte para brindarle un concierto en vivo antes, durante o después de mi viaje. Voy a tocar en vivo para ti en una fiesta que des / en un evento que tengas o en otras ocasiones. Dependiendo de la hora y el lugar, ire con o sin mi dúo  musical Guillermo Zocca. (tendremos contacto para definir las posibilidades de donde y cuando se realizara el encuentro. (Antes que comience el proyecto Eco Bus América, estaré en España, Holanda y durante mi viaje visitaré países entre California y el sur de Argentina)
column48:
>¿Cuándo se va a usar tu donación?

Antes de que todo este proyecto comience, estaré en Brasil, Holanda y España por un tiempo. Empiezo a construir el vehículo desde Septiembre/Octubre 2018 en California y cuando está listo, comienzo el viaje hacia la Patagonia. La fecha exacta en que inicio el viaje es difícil de determinar porque dependerá mucho del proceso de convertir el vehículo en uno sustentable.
column49:
>¿Qué sucede si no llego a recibir suficiente financiamiento con este crowdfunding?

Si no alcanzo a recibir todo el dinero que necesitaría con esta campaña de crowdfunding, no significa que este proyecto no vaya a suceder. Haré todo para que este proyecto sea un éxito, así que seguiré buscando fondos y aparte de eso trabajaré hasta el momento de partir que será septiembre/octubre de 2018.
column50:
>El impacto

Tu contribución, ya sea grande o pequeña, ayudará muchísimo al proyecto y al planeta. En la forma directa, me ayudará a preparar todo para iniciar el proyecto, pero indirectamente, su contribución ayudará aún más porque le permitirá  a miles de personas a  inspirarse para ayudar al planeta. Esto significa que TU vas a ser parte del impacto que generará el proyecto simplemente colaborando con mi proyecto.

En Argentina ya empecé a visitar escuelas dando charlas y mostrando películas sobre temas ambientales. ¡En una palabra, un éxito! Fui invitada a hablar en varias radios de diferentes localidades para hablar sobre el proyecto y varios diarios escribieron sobre el impacto de mis visitas.
column51:
>Riesgos y desafíos

Hay algunas cosas que pueden ser desafiantes durante este proyecto. Primero de todo estoy haciendo este proyecto sola. A pesar de que esa es mi elección, debo ser consciente del hecho que de esa forma las cosas pueden tomar mas tiempo y pueden ser mas difíciles a veces. Esto es un desafío, pero estoy segura que la enorme motivación que siento a cerca del proyecto me ayudara siempre para seguir adelante! Además, sé que cuando uno hace un proyecto solo, nunca esta totalmente solo y siempre se puede pedir ayuda.

Para hacer que un vehículo sea sustentable, se necesita tecnología y personas dispuestas a ayudar para construirlo. Un riesgo sería que no encuentre la forma de hacer un vehículo 100% sustentable. Creo que todos los contactos que hice los últimos dos años me ayudaran mucho con este desafío. En caso de no lograr convertir el vehículo totalmente sustentable, lo haré parcialmente. Con la posibilidad que durante el viaje, el vehículo se vaya transformando cada vez mas sustentable.
column52:
>Otras maneras en que me puedes ayudar

¡Hay muchas otras formas para ayudarme y son igual de valiosas como el dinero! Si produces o vendes productos que me ayudaran a vivir la vida sustentable, pueden ser productos de cualquier tipo, los puedo promocionar durante mi viaje. Al donarme estos productos sería una forma excelente para ayudarme y ayudarte. ¡Puedo promocionar estos productos mostrándolos a personas cómo los uso y puedo poner su marca/logo atrás del vehículo! También me puedas ayudar simplemente a correr la voz y compartir mi campaña con la gente en tu Facebook, Twitter o Instagram.
column53:
>

Logo of my project, you can find me on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter

 

Thanks a lot! Heel erg bedankt! Muchísimas gracias!

Mándame un mensaje y lo resolvemos: jorientimmers@gmail.comNederlands  > Scroll naar beneden op deze paginaEspañol> Desplácese hacia abajo de la páginaFOLLOW ME ON:   FACEBOOK   INSTAGRAM   TWITTERpicture: visiting a rural school in Argentina with the project 'Eco Bus America' Will you help me inspire the world? Thanks for taking time to read and watch my campaign! I am Jorien Timmers (26) from Holland, graduated psychologist and currently living and traveling around the world. I am excited to tell you something about how this whole project started.Environmental issues and climate change have always been a worrying factor to me. However, I also felt that the problems seemed so overwhelming big that I thought that I as an individual couldn’t really do anything about it. I think a lot of people feel the same impotence when we talk about environmental issues. We know about the general problem and we rather get upset with big contaminating companies than that we change something to our own daily habits. I have realised that change really does start by ourselves and that’s why I want to inspire as much people around the world as possible and let them feel that change is needed and that it all starts with changing our own habits. I want to do this by crossing Latin America in a sustainable vehicle. I will visit schools along the way to do my project and explain them why this is so important. I already started giving workshops and talks at schools in South America accompanied by movies about environmental subjects and I see the big impact this has on those kids. I think that even though nowadays where we live in a society where obtaining information became very easy for everybody it is still very important or even more important to physically visit people and bring the information to them. I think this way you can have a real impact on them showing what's happening with our planet and teach them the existing alternatives to live a more sustainable life. The sustainable vehicle with all the products and objects I use to be able to live on zero waste, is a great live example and will make it easier to teach them how to apply this on their own lives. What I need and how I thank you for your supportTo make this project successful I will need to make a fully sustainable vehicle. this will cost me around 20.000 euro's. Apart from that I want to show movies with a mobile cinema. Therefore I will need equipment, which will cost me around 2.000 euros. To make the documentary about the whole trip and to keep you all updated with videos and tutorials I will need to buy film equipment like cameras lenses and hard disks this will cost me around 3.000 euro's. In total I will need 25.000 euro’s to be able to start the project.How will I thank you for your support? First of all I think it is important to say that the main goal of this project is to spread the word about environmental issues with a real life example of the sustainable driving bus (with sustainable working products in it) and the mobile cinema in combination with the workshops and talks. Helping me with this project means that you are helping the world a step forward to make of it a better one! You can donate whatever amount you want and you can choose to get a CD with songs sung by me especially made for this project where you can listen to songs from countries that I will be visiting during my trip. If you sell or produce a product that has to do with sustainable living and you are interested in promotion of it, there is also the possibility to donate a product and I will make promotion for it during my trip by showing it and by sticking the name of the brand on the back of my vehicle.€​15> Digital Thank You! To show my thanks, I will send you a special thank you note and you get a colouring picture of the project. (download file)€​30> I will send you a digital song sung by me with ‘Dúo Tódo’ €​50>  I sent you my CD with music from countries I will be visiting during the project in Latin-America. sung by me especially made for this project.€​100> Get free access to watch the documentary that I will make about the whole trip. (available after the whole project is finished)€​1000> This is such a big help to my project! If time and place coincide I will perform live for you and sing you some songs! We can also have contact to see if there is other ways how I can thank you for such a big help! When is my donation going to be used?Before this whole project starts I will be in brasil, Holland and Spain for a while. I start to build the vehicle from September/October 2018 in California and when it’s ready I start driving. The exact date I start driving is difficult to tell because it will depend a lot on how easy it is to convert the vehicle into a totally sustainable one.What if I don't reach the entire amount of financial support?If I don’t reach my entire goal with this crowdfunding campaign it doesn’t mean that this project is not going to happen. I will definitely do everything to make this project a success so I will keep searching for funding and apart from that I will work as much as possible to be able to start in September/October 2018.The impactYour contribution whether it’s big or small will help me and the planet enormously. In the direct form it will help me to get everything ready to start the project but indirectly your contribution will help even more because it will help the thousands of people I will visit with the project to get inspired to help the planet! This means that YOU can have a tremendous impact on saving this planet just by helping my project with your contribution. I already started in Argentina with teaching about environmental issues by projecting movies, giving workshops and talks and making music in primary and secondary schools. In one word a big success! I have been invited to talk on several local radio stations to come and talk about the project and several newspapers wrote about the success of my visits.Risks & ChallengesThere are a few things that might be challenging during this whole project. The first thing is that I am running this project alone. If you sell sustainable products from whatever kind that I can promote during my trip, donating those products would be a great way of helping me. En om van dit hele project een documentaire te maken zal ik materiaal nodig hebben zoals camera’s, lenzen en hard disks. Dit alles zal rond de 3.000 euro’s gaan kosten. In totaal zal ik dus rond de 25.000 euro nodig hebben om te kunnen starten met dit project.Wat krijg jij? Ten eerste is het belangrijk te weten dat het hoofddoel van dit project het verspreiden van bewustwording is op het gebied van milieukwesties aan de hand van het levende voorbeeld, namelijk de milieuvriendelijke bus, die volledig milieuvriendelijk functioneert. En daarnaast met de mobiele bioscoop die mee gaat en de workshops en talks die gegeven worden. Het doneren aan mijn project betekent eigenlijk het mee helpen redden van deze planeet. Je kunt elk bedrag doneren en daarvoor ontvang je een persoonlijk bedankje in de vorm van een in eigen beheer opgenomen cd met liedjes door mijzelf gezongen van de landen die ik zal aandoen op mijn reis. Als je een verkoper of maker bent van een product, dat te maken heeft met milieuvriendelijk leven, dan is er ook de mogelijkheid een product te doneren, zodat ik dit product tijdens mijn reis promoot doormiddel van het demonstreren ervan en daarnaast door uw logo/merk op de achterkant van mijn busje te plakken.€ 15,00> Digitaal bedankje met bijgevoegd een kleurplaat van het project (pdf)€ 30,00> Ik stuur je een online liedje van ‘Dúo Tódo’€ 50,00 > Ontvang mijn cd met liederen gezongen door mij zelf van de landen, die ik tijdens mijn reis ga bezoeken in Latijns-America.€1000 > Dit is echt een geweldige bijdrage aan mijn project. Als tijd en plaats samenvallen kom ik live voor je zingen! We kunnen ook even contact opnemen over andere manieren hoe ik je zou kunnen bedanken voor deze grote bijdrage aan mijn project!Wanneer zal mijn donatie gebruikt worden?Voordat dit hele project begint, zal ik nog een tijdje in Brazilië, Spanje en Nederland zijn. Het plan is, dat ik ga beginnen met het bouwen van het busje in september/oktober 2018 in Californië en als dat klaar is begint de reis. De exacte datum is moeilijk in te schatten, want dat zal afhangen van hoe snel het ombouwen van het busje zal gaan.Wat als ik mijn gehele doelbedrag niet haal?Als ik mijn gehele doelbedrag niet bij elkaar krijg via de crowdfunding-actie, zal dit niet betekenen dat het niet doorgaat. Ik ga er alles aan doen om van dit project een succes te maken en ik zal daarom door blijven gaan met financiële steun zoeken en daarnaast zal ik zo veel mogelijk gaan werken, zodat ik weg kan gaan op de streefdatum, namelijk september 2018.Impact Jouw bijdrage, al is het klein of groot, kan dit project en deze planeet een hele grote stap vooruit helpen. Direct zal het mij helpen om alles voor te bereiden en in orde te maken en te vertrekken, maar indirect zal jou bijdrage nog veel meer invloed hebben. Het zal het namelijk mogelijk maken alle mensen die ik op mijn reis tegenkom te inspireren bewuster met deze planeet om te gaan door hun gewoonten te veranderen. Dit betekent dat JIJ een enorme impact kan hebben op het redden van deze planeet alleen al door het doneren van geld.Ik ben in Argentinië al gestart met lesgeven over milieu-issues door middel van films en presentaties en door het geven van workshops en het maken van muziek op scholen. In één woord een groot succes. Ik ben daarnaast gevraagd op verschillende lokale radiostations om mijn verhaal te doen en verschillende kranten hebben artikelen geschreven, over het succes van mijn project op scholen.Risico’s en uitdagingenEr zijn een aantal uitdagingen aan dit project. De eerste is het feit dat ik dit project zelf run. Ook al is dit mijn bewuste keuze, het zal niet altijd makkelijk zijn en sommige dingen zullen daardoor langzamer gaan dan gewild en ik zal soms hulp moeten vragen aan derden. Dit is een echte uitdaging, maar ik denk dat de enorme drive die ik voel om door te zetten met dit project, me hierin enorm zal helpen!Om het busje 100% milieuvriendelijk te maken is er technologie nodig en zijn er mensen nodig die bereid zijn te helpen het busje zo milieuvriendelijk mogelijk om te bouwen. Een risico is, dat ik niet de perfecte manier vind om het busje totaal milieuvriendelijk te krijgen. Ik denk dat de contacten, die ik de afgelopen 2 jaar gemaakt heb, zeker helpen bij deze uitdaging. Indien het toch lastig wordt het busje volledig milieuvriendelijk te maken, zal hij gedeeltelijk milieuvriendelijk gemaakt worden met de mogelijkheid hem onderweg steeds milieuvriendelijker te laten rijden.Andere manieren waarop je me kunt helpen?Er zijn vele manieren waarop je me zou kunnen helpen en deze zijn net zo waardevol als geld! Als je milieubewuste/vriendelijke producten verkoopt of maakt van wat voor soort dan ook, dan kan ik daar reclame voor maken tijdens mijn reis. Het doneren van deze producten geeft mij de mogelijkheid deze producten te gebruiken in mijn busje en te laten zien aan anderen hoe ze werken. Daarnaast kan ik een sticker van het merk achter op de bus plakken. Of je kunt helpen mijn campagne te delen op Facebook, twitter en Instagram met de Indiegogo share tool. Of gewoon van mond op mond.picture: giving a talk about plastic pollution on a secondary school, Argentinapicture: Visiting a school in rural village in Argentina showing movies about environmental problems ¿Me ayudas a inspirar al mundo?¡Gracias por tomar tu tiempo para leer y seguir mi campaña! Soy Jorien Timmers (26) de Holanda, psicóloga recibida y actualmente vivo viajando por el mundo. Con mucho gusto les cuento cómo empezó todo este proyecto.El cambio climático y los problemas ambientales siempre han sido un factor preocupante para mí. Sin embargo, me parecían tan grandes que sentí que yo, como individuo, no podía hacer tanto al respecto. Creo que nos pasa a muchos de nosotros el sentimiento de impotencia cuando hablamos de temas medio ambientales. Conocemos el problema general y preferimos quejarnos sobre las grandes empresas contaminantes, en vez de enfocarnos en lo que nosotros mismos diariamente podemos hacer al respecto por ejemplo al cambiar nuestros hábitos. Me di cuenta que el cambio realmente comienza por nosotros mismos y es por eso que quiero inspirar a las personas de todo el mundo y hacerles sentir que se necesita un cambio y que ellos mismos pueden tener mucha influencia en ese cambio.El proyecto que quiero comenzar es el siguiente: Quiero cruzar América Latina en un vehículo sustentable. Llevando un cine móvil y dando talleres y charlas sobre temas medio ambientales. Durante el viaje vivo sin producir basura. Visitaré entre ellas, escuelas y centros culturales. Ya empecé a dar talleres y charlas en escuelas en Latino América, y veo el gran impacto que tiene en los niños y adultos. Creo que a pesar de que hoy en día vivimos en una época en la que obtener información resulta muy fácil para todos, no es de menor importancia visitar físicamente a las personas para acercarles la información, y de esta manera, puede tener un impacto real en ellos, mostrando lo que está sucediendo con nuestro planeta y brindando alternativas diversas para vivir una vida con mayor conciencia. El vehículo sustentable en el que me trasladaré por Latino América, será de gran ejemplo vivo, ya que uno de objetivos primordiales del viaje será vivir sin generar basura y hará que sea más fácil enseñar cómo aplicar esto en la vida de las personas que sean atravesadas por este viaje.Que necesito y como te agradezco la ayuda?Para dar el punta pie inicial a este proyecto, tendré que adaptar un vehículo para convertirlo completamente a sustentable. Esto me costará alrededor de 20000 euros. Aparte de eso, quiero mostrar películas a través de un cine móvil y necesitaré equipamiento, que me costará aproximadamente 2000 euros.Para hacer ‘El documental’ de todo el viaje, necesitaré comprar equipos, como lentes, cámaras y discos duros, esto me costará alrededor de 3000 euros. En total, necesitaré 25,000 euros para poder comenzar el proyecto.¿Cómo le agradezco? En primer lugar, creo que es importante decir que el objetivo principal de este proyecto es difundir información sobre los problemas medio ambientales que afectan nuestro planeta para generar consciencia. Ayudarme con este proyecto significa que estás ayudando al mundo y en la concientización para que las personas comiencen a cuidarlo. A cambio de tu donación, del cual tú puedes elegir la cantidad de dinero que colaboras, les envío un CD en el cual canto canciones de países de Latino America los cuales voy a visitar con mi proyecto ‘Eco Bus América’. Además, si vendes o produces un producto que tiene que ver con vivir de manera sustentable y estas interesado en promocionarlo, existe la posibilidad de donar tu producto y lo mencionaré durante mi viaje mostrándolo a la gente y pondré su logo/marca atrás en mi vehículo.€ 15,00 > Para mostrarle mi agradecimiento, le enviaré un agradecimiento especial digitalmente. Te mando también una imagen para colorear del proyecto.€ 30,00 > Te enviaré una canción digital cantada por mí con 'Dúo Tódo'€ 50,00 > te envío mi CD con música de los países que visitaré durante el proyecto en América Latina.€ 1000 > Iré a visitarte para brindarle un concierto en vivo antes, durante o después de mi viaje. Voy a tocar en vivo para ti en una fiesta que des / en un evento que tengas o en otras ocasiones. Dependiendo de la hora y el lugar, ire con o sin mi dúo  musical Guillermo Zocca. (tendremos contacto para definir las posibilidades de donde y cuando se realizara el encuentro. (Antes que comience el proyecto Eco Bus América, estaré en España, Holanda y durante mi viaje visitaré países entre California y el sur de Argentina)¿Cuándo se va a usar tu donación?Antes de que todo este proyecto comience, estaré en Brasil, Holanda y España por un tiempo. Empiezo a construir el vehículo desde Septiembre/Octubre 2018 en California y cuando está listo, comienzo el viaje hacia la Patagonia. La fecha exacta en que inicio el viaje es difícil de determinar porque dependerá mucho del proceso de convertir el vehículo en uno sustentable.¿Qué sucede si no llego a recibir suficiente financiamiento con este crowdfunding?Si no alcanzo a recibir todo el dinero que necesitaría con esta campaña de crowdfunding, no significa que este proyecto no vaya a suceder. Haré todo para que este proyecto sea un éxito, así que seguiré buscando fondos y aparte de eso trabajaré hasta el momento de partir que será septiembre/octubre de 2018.El impactoTu contribución, ya sea grande o pequeña, ayudará muchísimo al proyecto y al planeta. En la forma directa, me ayudará a preparar todo para iniciar el proyecto, pero indirectamente, su contribución ayudará aún más porque le permitirá  a miles de personas a  inspirarse para ayudar al planeta. Esto significa que TU vas a ser parte del impacto que generará el proyecto simplemente colaborando con mi proyecto.En Argentina ya empecé a visitar escuelas dando charlas y mostrando películas sobre temas ambientales. ¡En una palabra, un éxito! Fui invitada a hablar en varias radios de diferentes localidades para hablar sobre el proyecto y varios diarios escribieron sobre el impacto de mis visitas.Riesgos y desafíosHay algunas cosas que pueden ser desafiantes durante este proyecto. Primero de todo estoy haciendo este proyecto sola. A pesar de que esa es mi elección, debo ser consciente del hecho que de esa forma las cosas pueden tomar mas tiempo y pueden ser mas difíciles a veces. Esto es un desafío, pero estoy segura que la enorme motivación que siento a cerca del proyecto me ayudara siempre para seguir adelante! Además, sé que cuando uno hace un proyecto solo, nunca esta totalmente solo y siempre se puede pedir ayuda.Para hacer que un vehículo sea sustentable, se necesita tecnología y personas dispuestas a ayudar para construirlo. Un riesgo sería que no encuentre la forma de hacer un vehículo 100% sustentable. Creo que todos los contactos que hice los últimos dos años me ayudaran mucho con este desafío. En caso de no lograr convertir el vehículo totalmente sustentable, lo haré parcialmente. Con la posibilidad que durante el viaje, el vehículo se vaya transformando cada vez mas sustentable.Otras maneras en que me puedes ayudar ¡Hay muchas otras formas para ayudarme y son igual de valiosas como el dinero! Si produces o vendes productos que me ayudaran a vivir la vida sustentable, pueden ser productos de cualquier tipo, los puedo promocionar durante mi viaje. Al donarme estos productos sería una forma excelente para ayudarme y ayudarte. ¡Puedo promocionar estos productos mostrándolos a personas cómo los uso y puedo poner su marca/logo atrás del vehículo! También me puedas ayudar simplemente a correr la voz y compartir mi campaña con la gente en tu Facebook, Twitter o Instagram.Logo of my project, you can find me on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter Thanks a lot! Heel erg bedankt! Muchísimas gracias!",6.0,0,"1 Campaign

We are on a mission to finish building the first low-cost, fully self-sufficient home in the Middle East before expanding to the rest of the world.
[Read about us on Forbes here]
[Read about us on StepFeed here]
[Read about us on Inhabitat here]

The Lifehaus project will allow its inhabitants to live in harmony with nature, harvesting and recycling their own water, producing their own electricity, and growing their own food. Using a technique called 'Passive Annual Heat Storage' the home is designed to heat and cool itself naturally without the use of electricity or fuel - a feature that will considerably reduce the carbon footprint.
Allow us to tell you more in this promotional video:
The Lifehaus project is all about ethical, off-grid living. It will help people reconnect with nature and help preserve precious natural resources.
To build the Lifehaus we are mainly using recycled material, like tires, glass bottles, tin cans, and more. We have also been using scavenged material found on-site, like earth, clay, hay, and rock.

To turn the home into a sustainable bio-machine, we will be integrating several systems that include a rain harvesting station for water, photovoltaic panels and windmills for power, and a greenhouse for food.
How it is being built:
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/OhODvO-0HTA?autohide=1&amp
This home will help us create a paradigm shift. Once constructed, it will serve as a gallery for all people who would like to learn about sustainable architecture and off-the-grid living.
Our Earth needs it now more than ever, and where better to start than from a region plagued by environmental crises?
But, we can't do it without you! Help us promote sustainable, ecological living for a better collective, humanitarian future!
Thank you!
Endorsements:
-Michael Reynolds - Earthship Biotechture
-John Higson - CEO of EcoRegions Indonesia
-Jacque Liger Belair - Pioneer Bioclimatic Architect

column2:
E-Store on October 12th live from Arizona!!

 

Enter your e-mail for discounts &
column3:
bookmark our homepage so you don't miss it www.lovesinnerarmor.com 

 

 

OUR STORY

 

Love’s Inner Armor Inc. is a start-up social enterprise registered as a Canadian Corporation and gives 20% of profit from sales to global causes and community organizations.  How do you know we'll do this? We will be verified at the end of the year by the BCorp organization. 

When we found out the kind of difference as little as $1,000 can make in poor and developing countries especially in communities– it was clear that so much can be done with access to cash. But cash is so hard to come by for these communities – there are promises and  advice to fill out grant applications and sometimes donations of clothing – but no capital. As a result - no flexibility.

In Timor-Leste and Indonesia I have met women that can and have made change happen with their dedication, leadership, action and a little bit of money. These changes are extraordinary - real and local and where communities are receiving the least help.

When I thought about how to help - an idea came to me in the middle of the night (don't you love that?) about wearing armor - like Athena - but more modern. Something that I could have with me when I went into a big business meeting or could give my kids when they were going to school to let them know they were Strong, Extraordinary and Loved beyond measure. That they (or I) could do anything. 

Love and protection in the form of a T-Shirt was born. A T-Shirt with a message on the IN-side - a message just for you - or between you and the person who gave it to you.  We are all about messages - projected on to others. But sometimes we need to hear that we are remarkable beyond measure - we need to tell ourselves that we are loved.  

We are now a proud BCorp pending organization. See below for more info but essentially a third-party qualification that looks at governance, employee relations, community involvement, environmental record and other areas that make businesses good corporate citizens. This is a growing global movement and a number of Canadian businesses are joining the 300+ US businesses like Patagonia who are also BCorp members. To get this status - you have to put in your incorporation papers that the Board will be directed by more than the mighty dollar -  it is to consider the community, employees, the environment and other impacts as it makes decisions for the company. It is right there in the DNA of our incorporation. 

 

 

CAN YOU HELP?

column1: <li>
Share the love - spread the word about this campaign - hit one of the social sharing icons
<li>
Donate any amount - $1, $5, $10  - they all help us get off our feet
<li>
Choose a Perk or product of your choice - I'm loving the new wrist wraps
<li>
Sign up your corporation for $500 and get a link from our new Web site to your site
<li>
Buy your way into the Fashion Industry - $1000 and you get to be a featured model on our site

WHY?

Always -20% pre-tax profit to global charities

 

Local organizations help people in need at the very basic level. Many of them are small, run in community builders’ spare time and have no sustainable access to funds. Some have issues writing grant applications in English. Though some contribute to phenomenal outcomes – they are not chosen to receive funding from their State, or from funding sources like the United Nations or Global donors. Sometimes small amounts of funding for local organizations can make the difference to many people that we just don’t see and there aren’t all that many sources.

Love’s Inner Armor’s Advisory Board and eventual Board of Directors will choose funding recipients each year based on emerging issues and objectives.  Sometimes it may grant multi-year funding for specific projects when income from the business is stable.

As it grows, Love’s Inner Armor intends to use elements of user involvement to help choose where the 20% goes. This can include buying from a specialized line – for example the Help the Earth line or it could include a crowdsourcing voting option.

 

 

FOR WHOM?

 

This year – and because profits may be limited – the 20% will go to two personally vetted organizations in the poorest parts of the world - that have a record of doing wonders with very little funding. They are run by two very respected women. Both have won human rights rewards and one - Bella Galhos recently won the Dalai Lama's Unsung Heroes Award for her work in Maubisse, Timor Leste.

These two organizations  - YKBH Justitia (Indonesia)  and Leublora Green School (Timor-Leste) had the following outcomes for very little money last year. They:
<li>

Helped 35 women with no water access points to plant, irrigate harvest and sell crops. Then they created a Women's Coop to help each other continue these activities. They needed a pump, a water reservoir and seeds.
<li>
<strong><i>Funded training was held to reinforce women &amp
column2: children's human rights and teach them to advocate for them  - it also trained police officers and community officials such as schools to look for signs and understand how to help when they suspected violence.

column1: <li>
Gave street kids  a place to hang out during the day and learn valuable environmental skills

WHAT ARE THE RISKS? 

 

This business can be anything from a side-business that contributes to organizations that need infusions of cash for important projects in the poorest parts of the world – to becoming a multi-billion conscious fashion site that helps us make conscious choices about where we INVEST our clothing and household budgets.

Your backing in-and-of itself supports the organization to create it’s first line of T-shirts from the right kinds of suppliers, with fabric that won’t add to plastic pollution, with partners and stakeholders who will benefit greatly even from amounts less than $5,000.

The risk is minimal. I will definitely send you all of your perks and have a great Web site ready to launch October 12, 2017.

 

 

WHAT KIND OF INVESTMENT DO WE NEED?

 

Businesses have significant start up costs. Most don't break even until 3 or so years. If you can help  to build momentum and support our growth early on, it will maximize our ability to help others and be a conscious corporation contributing to the economy and global good. I am contributing funds to start this business that I probably won't make back for years but am also looking for backers and customers to help me get the rest of the way. Volunteers are also contributing a great amount of writing, web help, design and other super skills. It takes a village. Please become a member.

 

 

A LITTLE BIT ABOUT US

                       

I'm Angelina Munaretto, a passionate social entrepreneur and speaker. I  believe that businesses can be models for society and that we as consumers should exercise choice and buy from these businesses. I work alongside a number of fantastic volunteers who are helping shape what this business will be like.  There are some pictures on the top of the page of Alyssa Munaretto - (yes, my talented sister) and Lead Designer, Jum Welsh, Project Manager and doer of all things, Chris Gee, Photography and web writer and Stephanie Dean, web writer and so many more are lending a hand with advice and supporting the campaign. 

Here's a bit about what moved me to start this company:

I moved to Indonesia last year for my husband's work and am a former Senior Executive.

I have been a corporate-level fundraiser, a digital strategist and executive, a program manager and many other roles over the last 20 years I have been working. In operations I have managed over 60 people and many millions of dollars. I know I have what it takes to launch this business/social enterprise and will bring in volunteers *(have 8 already), temporary help and eventually full-time employees to help us reach our objectives to help others and create sustainable fashion. I am committed to slow and sustainable growth in a way that supports many objectives. If it comes fast I will be ready too.

Connect with me for a chat if you would like to learn more or get involved. I hope we will be so successful that we will be hiring soon!! -
