Though some contribute to phenomenal outcomes – they are not chosen to receive funding from their State, or from funding sources like the United Nations or Global donors. Sometimes small amounts of funding for local organizations can make the difference to many people that we just don’t see and there aren’t all that many sources.Love’s Inner Armor’s Advisory Board and eventual Board of Directors will choose funding recipients each year based on emerging issues and objectives.  Sometimes it may grant multi-year funding for specific projects when income from the business is stable.As it grows, Love’s Inner Armor intends to use elements of user involvement to help choose where the 20% goes. This can include buying from a specialized line – for example the Help the Earth line or it could include a crowdsourcing voting option.  FOR WHOM? This year – and because profits may be limited – the 20% will go to two personally vetted organizations in the poorest parts of the world - that have a record of doing wonders with very little funding. They are run by two very respected women. Both have won human rights rewards and one - Bella Galhos recently won the Dalai Lama's Unsung Heroes Award for her work in Maubisse, Timor Leste.These two organizations  - YKBH Justitia (Indonesia)  and Leublora Green School (Timor-Leste) had the following outcomes for very little money last year. They:

Helped 35 women with no water access points to plant, irrigate harvest and sell crops. Then they created a Women's Coop to help each other continue these activities. They needed a pump, a water reservoir and seeds.

Funded training was held to reinforce women & children's human rights and teach them to advocate for them  - it also trained police officers and community officials such as schools to look for signs and understand how to help when they suspected violence.
Gave street kids  a place to hang out during the day and learn valuable environmental skills

WHAT ARE THE RISKS?  This business can be anything from a side-business that contributes to organizations that need infusions of cash for important projects in the poorest parts of the world – to becoming a multi-billion conscious fashion site that helps us make conscious choices about where we INVEST our clothing and household budgets.Your backing in-and-of itself supports the organization to create it’s first line of T-shirts from the right kinds of suppliers, with fabric that won’t add to plastic pollution, with partners and stakeholders who will benefit greatly even from amounts less than $5,000.The risk is minimal. I will definitely send you all of your perks and have a great Web site ready to launch October 12, 2017.  WHAT KIND OF INVESTMENT DO WE NEED? Businesses have significant start up costs. Most don't break even until 3 or so years. If you can help  to build momentum and support our growth early on, it will maximize our ability to help others and be a conscious corporation contributing to the economy and global good. I am contributing funds to start this business that I probably won't make back for years but am also looking for backers and customers to help me get the rest of the way. Volunteers are also contributing a great amount of writing, web help, design and other super skills. It takes a village. Please become a member.  A LITTLE BIT ABOUT US                       I'm Angelina Munaretto, a passionate social entrepreneur and speaker. I  believe that businesses can be models for society and that we as consumers should exercise choice and buy from these businesses. I work alongside a number of fantastic volunteers who are helping shape what this business will be like.  There are some pictures on the top of the page of Alyssa Munaretto - (yes, my talented sister) and Lead Designer, Jum Welsh, Project Manager and doer of all things, Chris Gee, Photography and web writer and Stephanie Dean, web writer and so many more are lending a hand with advice and supporting the campaign. Here's a bit about what moved me to start this company:I moved to Indonesia last year for my husband's work and am a former Senior Executive.I have been a corporate-level fundraiser, a digital strategist and executive, a program manager and many other roles over the last 20 years I have been working. In operations I have managed over 60 people and many millions of dollars. I know I have what it takes to launch this business/social enterprise and will bring in volunteers *(have 8 already), temporary help and eventually full-time employees to help us reach our objectives to help others and create sustainable fashion. I am committed to slow and sustainable growth in a way that supports many objectives. If it comes fast I will be ready too.Connect with me for a chat if you would like to learn more or get involved. I hope we will be so successful that we will be hiring soon!! -",2.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Ottawa, Canada",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/love-s-inner-armor-phase-1/pica
0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
Bonjour,

Hervé (51 ans) est ingénieur du son, réalisateur audio-visuel, et moi, Orély (39 ans) je suis maraîchère et animatrice. Nous sommes deux passionnés par la nature et l'éco-construction car depuis longtemps engagés activement pour la réduction de notre impact sur l'environnement. Forts d’une expérience de vie en montagne pendant plus de 10 ans, nous franchissons un cap avec ce projet que nous souhaitons commun, en autonomie énergétique, en autonomie alimentaire, avec le support des ressources de la montagne et de votre contribution.
<div dir=""ltr"">
Insatisfaits des dérives du système qui se fait au détriment de la biodiversité et du bien être de l'humain, nous avons la volonté de partager avec vous notre désir profond de :
“changer maintenant vers l'autonomie éco-responsable”
en réalisant avec et dans la montagne, un lieu de ressourcement 100% écologique comprenant des habitats autonomes en énergie construits à partir des ressources locales et de matériaux naturels.
Nous croyons fermement qu'il est possible au XXI° siècle d'acquérir une autonomie énergétique et alimentaire tout en préservant le confort indispensable au bien être.

Nous aurions pu réaliser ce projet avec un financement bancaire mais nous faisons le choix courageux de vous associer à cette aventure ambitieuse. Nous souhaitons avant tout, valoriser l'éthique de votre initiative en faveur de ce projet qui verra le jour grâce a votre soutien.

Si nous souhaitons développer ensemble, un écosystème durable respectueux des hommes et de la nature, il est primordial que l'habitat et les modes de productions alimentaires et énergétiques soient cohérents avec l’impact sur l’environnement.

De plus, nous avons à coeur de rendre accessible ce mode vie à tous ceux qui souhaitent partager notre aventure. S’adressant à ceux qui ont la volonté d'apprendre les différentes techniques mises en oeuvre, par le biais de séjours de formations, ou qui veulent découvrir et expérimenter l'écologie au quotidien, au travers de séjour de détente et de ressourcement avec la forêt.
Il ne s’agit pas de nostalgie du passé, mais de pragmatisme et de modernité au XXI° siècle.
Ce mode de vie en harmonie avec la nature, qui préserve les ressources de la planète, tout en préservant le confort élémentaire et les besoins de chacun
“est a la portée de tous , avec un peu de courage “.
Nous pouvons avoir l’espoir de donner un sens à notre vie… mais, c’est seulement parce que nous agissons ensemble que nous pouvons vraiment faire la différence.
Pourquoi nous avons besoin de vous :

L'objectif de cette campagne est de compléter le financement du terrain et de démarrer les premiers aménagements qui nous permettront de construire le prototype de la maison ogivale que nous avons conçue, avec les proportions du nombre d'or, en accord avec les techniques traditionnelles.
Pour y arriver, nous avons besoin de 7000 €.
Concrètement, votre contribution nous permettra de financer par ordre de priorité  :
<ul>
• les 3000€  qui nous manquent (sur 17000€) pour l'achat du terrain (signature autour du 15 janvier chez le notaire)
• un tracteur 4x4 d'occasion  : 2300€
• le terrassement de la piste et de l'emplacement de la construction : 1000€
• 700€ d'outillage

Le terrain se situe au bout d'une piste de 700m, déjà utilisable, mais il est nécessaire de faire venir une mini pelle pour une journée afin de la réhabiliter. Il suffira de combler les ornières et de creuser quelques revers d'eau pour que le ruissellement ne l'endommage pas à nouveau et la piste deviendra confortablement praticable.

Nous devrons tout d'abord installer un camp de base, très sommaire, qui nous permettra de dormir et manger durant la durée des travaux. Une surface de 40 m2 maximum, couverte de bardeaux (que nous avons déjà), alimentée avec l'eau de la source, un petit poêle bois et des toilettes sèches.

Le tracteur permettra de transporter les matériaux sur le terrain et d'accéder aux différentes parcelles de forêt pour en tirer le bois d'oeuvre, essentiellement du châtaignier, et avec notre scierie mobile nous pourrons usiner sur place toutes les pièces nécessaires à la construction.

Et une fois que toutes les pièces du puzzle seront prêtes, la première ogive, grâce à vous, pointera son nez au coeur de la forêt dans laquelle les premières cultures commenceront à donner leurs fruits.
Nous passerons ensuite à l'alimentation énergétique de la bâtisse : hydro-électricité, biogaz et phyto-épuration.
L'impact
<ul>

• La construction de ce prototype doit servir à montrer que construire une habitation  autonome en énergie et qui soit à la fois esthétique, confortable et respectueuse de la nature doit être à la portée de tous.

• Cette première construction nous servira de modèle et d'entrainement pour construire les autres car notre objectif final est de construire 4 gîtes de forme ogivale et un studio d'enregistrement autonome en électricité.

Nous avons tous les deux des parcours qui nous ont préparés à cette aventure. Hervé a déjà conçu et construit une maison dodécagonale en bois et a vécu en montagne à 1000 m d'altitude durant de nombreuses années.
Orély a été maraîchère bio pendant plusieurs années, en montagne et en autonomie énergétique, dans une exploitation où toutes les terres, en terrasses, étaient cultivées manuellement.
Nous avons donc parfaitement conscience de l'ampleur du travail qui nous attend et nous nous savons capables d'aller jusqu'au bout de cette aventure.
Le challenge

Le terrain sur lequel nous allons nous installer est à l'abandon depuis de nombreuses années et la végétation a repris ses droits. Les difficultés viendront du fait que le terrain est assez pentu et que nous serons à 950 m d'altitude et serons tributaires des aléas météorologiques inhérents au climat de montagne.

Nous avons comme avantages que la piste se divise en 2 et permet d'accéder au terrain par en haut et par en bas, et fait en sorte que l'inconvénient de la pente se transforme en avantage car il sera toujours possible de faire descendre les charges lourdes.
L'altitude est compensée par le fait que l'exposition est plein sud et offre un ensoleillement régulier tout au long de l'année mais nous ne pourrons éviter quelques épisodes neigeux durant l'hiver.

Nous n'allons pas complètement défricher la magnifique forêt de châtaigniers qu'est devenu ce terrain, juste éclaircir un peu pour faire rentrer la lumière et installer une forêt comestible aussi appelé jardin forêt : un écosystème où on trouvera des plantes comestibles à tous les étages de végétation, du plus grand arbre jusqu'au champignon.

Les anciennes prairies qui sont aujourd'hui recouvertes de fougères seront tout d'abord coupées à ras, puis nous utiliseront le bois en décomposition dans la forêt pour installer des buttes ""permaculturelles"", sans labourer ni abîmer la terre et ses micro-organismes qui en constituent toute la richesse.
D'autres manières de contribuer
Si ce projet vous parle, et que vous n'avez pas les moyens financiers de participer, vous pouvez quand même nous aider.

Nous aurons besoin de bras pour construire ou pour défricher et si vous pensez pouvoir vous rendre utile de quelque façon que ce soit, (coups de main, prêt de matériel, conseils ...) n'hésitez surtout pas à nous contacter, votre aide sera la bienvenue.

Et il est également une façon de participer qui ne coute rien mais qui, malgré tout, peut nous aider énormément, c'est de parler de notre projet autour de vous et de le partager dans le réseau de vos connaissances et sur tous vos réseaux sociaux.
Les rétributions :

Nous réalisons nous même toutes les rétributions qui vous sont proposées : bonnets tricotés à la main,  les porte-clés et bracelets en cuir sont faits maison, le CD de Sylvain Del Campo est une production maison également. Les services audiovisuels et infographiques également.

Our website: https://www.biomimicryanalytics.org/

    ----------

    ANALYZA BIOMIMIKRY V ČESKÉ REPUBLICE – POJĎME TO ZAFINANCOVAT

    Stručné shrnutí

    1            Lidstvo spotřebovává příliš zdrojů planety země - cca 1.7x1 nad její regenerační kapacitu. Navíc většina konzumu je plýtvání a nadprodukce.                             

    2            Důsledek tohoto způsobu nadužívání je následující: vyhynulo 54 % druhu obratlovců za posledních 40 let2 a 82 % hmyzu za posledních 27 let.

    3            Proč by nás to v ČR a regionu Střední Evropy mělo zajímat? Co s tím můžeme udělat?

    Má to dopad i na nás. Např. od roku 2010 se ČR potýka se suchem, které je každý rok větší3, kumulovaně chybí čím dál více srážek. Současně se stále zhoršuje stav půdy díky příliš intenzivnímu zemědělství. Chceme vodu na příděl jako na jižní Moravě v létě 2018?""              

    4            Aktuální téma - plasty: ČR je na špici v podílu recyklace plastů v Evropě4, je ovšem vůbec potřeba jich tolik vyrábět? Pokrokové země je čím dál více omezují.    

    5            Existuje řešení jak zmírnit tento proces ničení přírody - změna procesu výroby a spotřeby: inspirace přírodou prostřednictvím biomimikry, příroda už vynalézá 3.8mld let5, má odpovědi na snad všechny naše otázky.                                                         

    6            ""Zlaté české ručičky” už dokázaly zázraky:
column2:
>Česká věda má významné místo ve světě, zároveň získávající i komerční úspěchy ve světě (technologické start-upy6 i existující stálice typu AVG, Avast i slovensko-český Eset), lék Holého na HIV používá polovina pacientů na světě7. Potenciál propojení biomimikry v české vědě a průmyslu je obrovský. Může být skutečné win-win pro přírodu i Českou republiku.                                                     

7            Biomimikry není v ČR vůbec známa, chybí systematický přístup při využívání znalostí přírody. Západní Evropa v čele s Německem využívá biomimikry v průmyslu již přes 20 let.                                              

8          Chybí povědomí o biomimikry v ČR, přesto existuje několik vlaštovek využití, např. nanovlákna v termo prádlu firmy Moira inspirované pouštní liškou. Historicky máme zajímavé výsledky vědy i medicíny, takže můžeme očekávat nové objevy. Příklady vědců: Jansky (krevní skupiny), Mendel (genetika), Wichterle (kontaktní čočky), Heyrovsky (polaroid), Holy (lék na uzdravení z HIV7) další viz poznámka č. 8.         

9            Na konci 2018 jsme založili neziskovou instituci Biomimicry Analytics, zapsaný spolek, která má cíl rozšiřovat povědomí o biomimikry v CR a střední Evropě. Chceme, aby se biomimikry začala uplaňovat v praktické rovině - aplikace v průmyslu a vědě.
column3:
typ=PLATNY"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" target=""_blank"">https://or.justice.cz/ias/ui/rejstrik-firma.vys...             

10          Máme partnery ze SRN a Nizozemí, kteří s námi chtějí spolupracovat na poli biomimikry v ČR.       http://www.biomimicrynl.org/       https://www.bionik-online.de/was-ist-bionik/   

JSME PŘESVĚDČENI, ŽE TÉMA JE NATOLIK ŠIROKÉ, ŽE NEJEFEKTIVNEJŠÍ POSTUP JE PROVÉST ANALÝZU, ABYCHOM VĚDĚLI KDE MÁ NEJVĚTŠÍ SMYSL SMĚŘOVAT DALŠÍ KONKRÉTNÍ PROJEKTY.                                                

              PROSÍM PODPOŘTE FINANČNĚ REALIZACI TÉTO ANALÝZY

O Co jde?

Existují smíšené pocity ohledně naléhavosti opatření ke zlepšení životního prostředí. Současný politický a podnikový přístup má zlepšit několik procent ročně, aby uspokojil některé aktivisty a všeobecné očekávání. Říkáme tomu ""konvenční"" přístup, bohužel vzhledem ke stavu nadměrného užívání zdrojů není čas na tento “luxus”. Proto navrhujeme krok zpět, přiblížení se k přírodě a inspirace přírodou. Tento přístup se nazývá ""biomimikry"". Proto se chceme zabývat výzkumem a zvyšováním povědomí o udržitelnějších způsobech navrhování produktu a služeb obecně.

Chceme analyzovat potenciál biomimikry v České republice na jednotlivé oblasti průmyslu a vědy.

 

Úvod - co je biomimikry:

Biomimikry je přístup k inovacím, který usiluje o udržitelné řešení lidských otázek tím, že napodobuje časem testované vzorce a strategie přírody. Základní myšlenkou je, že příroda již vyřešila většinu problémů, s nimiž se potýkáme. Zvířata, rostliny a mikroby jsou dokonalí inženýři. Po 3.8 miliard let výzkumu a vývoje nám to, co nás obklopuje - příroda - nabízí možná nejlepší odpovědi na přežití naší společnosti.

Více informací:

 https://biomimicry.org/   

příklady v přírodě a srovnání s lidským přístupem https://youtu.be/sf4oW8OtaPY  (21min, ovšem úžasných)

Jednoduché video vysvětlující v reálných příkladech Japonské vlakové inženýry a další

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iMtXqTmfta0 (7m)

 

Proč? Proč teď?

Myslíme si, že náš lidský svět byl podprůměrně navržen ve srovnání s 3,8 miliardy lety výzkumu a vývoje Země. Proč špatně navrženo: existuje mnoho problémů/škod životního prostředí způsobených lidmi a vyčerpáváme zdroje příliš rychle. „EIity“ které rozhodují a architekti procesů nemají úplný obraz a znalosti o biosféře - našeho největšího zdroje inspirace. Proč se neinspirovat více z přírody? To je to, o čem je biomimikry, a my bychom toto rádi zkoumali trochu více, abychom mohli sdílet cenné informace...

Prostřednictvím naší první analýzy jsme měli přístup k mnoha publikacím o stavu světa (biodiverzita, klima, energie, finance atd.). Zjistili jsme, že široká veřejnost nebyla dostatečně informována.

Naše studie trhu pomůže připravit budoucnost země / regionu a rozhýbat kola ""vtipného českého lokomotivního ducha"" a přispět tak k Evropské spolupráci. Níže uvedení partneři s námi chtějí spolupracovat, je třeba vytvořit základ pro to, aby se vše mohlo zrealizovat.
column2:
> 

Proč Česká republika?

Česká republika je jedna z nejvyspělejších zemí z hlediska výzkumných schopností, dlouhé tradice průmyslu včetně nových technologií a vývoje softwaru s rozvinutými znalostmi biologie... toto vše jsou klíčová odvětví doprovázená silnou akademickou infrastrukturou a centry výzkumu a vývoje. A přesto je zde malé povědomí o biomimikry. Česká republika může propojit své průmyslové dědictví s výzkumným potenciálem (12 vědců bylo jmenováno mezi globálně vysoce citovanými výzkumníky zveřejněnými společností Clarivate Analytics / Thomson Reuters, Česká reprezentace je dvojnásobná než Polská v roce 2018 a hlavní odvětví je chemie a životní prostředí.

https://vedavyzkum.cz/ze-zahranici/ze-zahranici/cechu-mezi-nejcitovanejsimi-vedci-sveta-pribyva

 

 

 

Proč my?

Jsme skupina, která hluboce věří, že toto téma má v České republice významný potenciál.

Nezisková organizace sídlící v Praze s cílem zvýšit povědomí o biomimikry v České republice a regionu střední a východní Evropy.

column4:
> 

Multidisciplinární tým tvořený ekonomickým expertem na tropické zemědělství působícím v Středoamerické a Karibské oblasti, statistika pracujícími na vývoji softwaru pro udržitelnost v rámci SAP v Praze, odborníky na IT v oblasti telemedicíny a studium udržitelnosti se sídlem v Paříži a PhD expertem ekonomie a marketingu žijícím v Barceloně.

Jiné způsoby, které můžete pomoci


Jsme rozhodně otevřeni pro jakoukoli spolupráci, ať už můžete poskytnout některé vědecké / odborné kontakty, pomoci se samotnou zprávou, nebo dokonce pomoci při řízení přímo neziskové organizace

Nejjednodušší pomocí je určitě šířit dále tuto kampaň mezi vaši přátelé a známé!

Můžete také použít nástroje pro sdílení nástroje Indiegogo!
Buďte otevření: životní prostředí je opravdu záležitostí nás všech...

VELKÉ DÍKY UŽ JEN ZA TO, ŽE NÁM  VĚNOVALI ČTENÍM SVŮJ ČAS!

column1: /English version/
ANALYSIS OF BIOMIMICRY IN THE CZECH REPUBLIC - LET'S FUND IT
Short Summary
1 Mankind consumes too much of Earth's resources - about 1.7 times[1] above its regenerative capacity. Moreover, we know most of the consumption is waste and overproduction.
2 The impact of this consumption is as massive: it has made extinct 54% of vertebrate species in the last 40 years[2] and 82% of insects in the past 27 years
3 Why shall we in the Czech Republic and CEE region care?

column2: >It also has an impact on us. E.g. since 2010, there was drought in the Czech Republic every year[3], cumulatively missing more and more rainfall and further deterioration of the water. So do we want water to be allocated on a daily quota as in South Moravia in summer 2018?

column1: 4 Plastics: Czech Republic is at the forefront of the rate of plastics recycling in Europe[4], but do we need to produce so many of them? Progressive countries are increasingly restricting the use and production of plastics.

5 There is a solution - a change in our approach to production and consumption: inspire from nature already during design. Nature has been already inventing for 3.8 billion years[5], it has answers to perhaps all of our questions. This approach is called “biomimicry”.

6 ""The golden Czech hands“ have already proven miracles. Czech science has a significant place in the World, “Czech golden hands” gaining real success in the world in the same time (technological start-ups[6] , also to the existing AVG, Avast and Slovak-Czech Eset types). The potential of the combination of possibilities of Czech science and the biomimicry industry is a huge.

7 Biomimicry is not known in the Czech Republic, there is a lack of systematic approach and without researching for answers to complicated questions within Nature. Western Europe, led by Germany, has been using biomimicry for over 20 years delivering significant advantages to the German industry.

8 Although there are few examples of biomimicry in the Czech Republic, i.e. nano-textiles in Moira's thermos-clothes are inspired by the desert fox’s ears. Historically, Czechs have interesting results of science and medicine, so we can expect new discoveries in the future. Historic researchers were e.g. Jansky (blood types), Mendel (genetics), Wichterle (contact lenses), Heyrovsky (polaroid), Holy (medicine to cure HIV[7], used by cca 50% of the patients worldwide).

9 At the end of 2018, we established a non-profit institution called Biomimicry Analytics, aiming to promote awareness of biomimicry in the Czech Republic and Central Europe. We want biomimicry to be applied in a practical level – used by industry and science.
Legal establishment of the NGO:

10 We have partners from Germany and the Netherlands who want to co-operate with us in the field of biomimicry in the Czech Republic. http://www.biomimicrynl.org/       https://www.bionik-online.de/was-ist-bionik/

BIOMIMICRY TOPIC IS SO VAST, THAT WE ARE CONVINCED THAT IN ORDER TO BE SUCCESSFUL AND EFFICIENCT, WE NEED TO EFFECTUATE AN ANALYSIS OF THE POTENTIAL IN THE COUNTRY. THIS SHALL GIVE US THE APPROPRIATE FOCUS.
PLEASE SUPPORT FINANCIALLY EXECUTION OF THIS ANALYSIS

Campaign
<ul>

<li>Why the Czech Republic - it's one of the most developed countries in terms of research capabilities, with a long industrial tradition in many sectors including biology-related sciences...  All the core sectors accompanied by strong academic infrastructure and R&amp
column2: D centers. AND yet there is little presence of biomimicry out there.

column1: <li>
Creation of the study of the potential of biomimicry in the Czech Republic with the reflection where to focus first
• Analysis of strengths, opportunities - SWOT of the Czech economy
• Key CZ institutions active / with the highest potential in biomimicry
• Conclusion: recommendations for the development of biomimicry sector in the country
<li>Appendix: graphic part of industry maturity &amp
• Methodology:  contact list of experts with a list of biomimicry questions and compile with publicly available data.
• Our partners are happy to collaborate on biomimicry in the Czech Republic and Europe wide context, we just need to have a basis where to start from.
<h3>What We Need &amp
<ul>
• Analysis: To conduct an analysis, report total est. size: 100 pages
<li>
Total amount: 5,000 USD or 100,000 CZK (65,000 for the study, up to 20,000 for graphics interface, up to 5,000 for perks to donors, up to 10,000 for fees to the platform and banks)
<li>You can choose from the following perks:<ul>
• VIP seats at the conference announcing report results
• Official sponsor/donor named in the initial Thank you page of the report
• EARLY BID: Fibonacciho formula engraved to metal/wood
• Sponsors'/donors' names entitled in the footnote of one page of the report which they sponsor
• If we do not reach the goal, we will need to raise the money elsewhere.
The Impact

There are mixed feelings about the urgency of the actions to improve the environment. The current political and corporate approach is to improve a selected range of % KPIs each year to satisfy some activist and general expectations. This is referred to as the “conventional” approach.

Unfortunately and given the state of overuse of the resources, there is not a time for this luxury (see graphs for a ""reality check""). Hence our suggestion for a step back, getting closer to Nature and get inspiration from her. This approach is called “biomimicry”.  That is why we want to research and raise awareness about more sustainable ways of designing.
We want to analyze the potential of biomimicry in the Czech republic specifying the main focus areas.
<ul>
• By supporting this project, you contribute to the progress of mankind toward a greater harmony with nature and more diverse science.

• Common sense reality: you contribute to preventing deepening of natural imbalances such as Drought in Europe of 2018, fires in California, floods in Asia, etc. Who wants to have water on quotas as in parts of southern Moravia in summer 2018?
• Think about Gandhi´s quote:  ""Earth provides enough to satisfy every man's needs, but not every man's greed.""
<li>The Leader of the Analysis worked on a similar analysis in other sectors with Frost &amp
column2: Sullivan in London. Other members of the team are statisticians and IT experts to support the leader.

column1: • Key is the large group of scientists/industrial experts which will provide detailed sector insights and potential.

column2: >Source: Examples of overuse of most precious element – water, UN Water Institute (2017)

column1: <h3>Risks &amp

There are multiple challenges: to reach a significant number of scientists/industry experts on time, to keep sufficiently strong methodology to connect the dots properly, to assure enough multidisciplinarity in the analytical team, to make the conclusion on time.
How to overcome these challenges:
<ul>
• The Leader has experience with similar reports
• Several team members are used to tight deadlines from the IT industry
• We are a diverse team of statisticians, IT experts, economists, marketing expert
• We have a large network due to our different backgrounds and also thanks to relatives being scientists/industry experts
Other Ways You Can Help
We are definitely open for any kind of cooperation, either you can provide some scientist/expert contacts, help with the report itself or even help with running the NGO directly
<ul>
• The easiest help is certainly to spread the word of this campaign among your friends and connections! You may also use the Indiegogo share tools!
• Be open-minded: environment is really a concern to all of us...
• BIG THANK YOU EVEN FOR YOUR TIME READING THIS

","[English version at the end of the Czech version]Our website: https://www.biomimicryanalytics.org/----------ANALYZA BIOMIMIKRY V ČESKÉ REPUBLICE – POJĎME TO ZAFINANCOVATStručné shrnutí1            Lidstvo spotřebovává příliš zdrojů planety země - cca 1.7x1 nad její regenerační kapacitu. Navíc většina konzumu je plýtvání a nadprodukce.                             2            Důsledek tohoto způsobu nadužívání je následující: vyhynulo 54 % druhu obratlovců za posledních 40 let2 a 82 % hmyzu za posledních 27 let.3            Proč by nás to v ČR a regionu Střední Evropy mělo zajímat? Co s tím můžeme udělat?Má to dopad i na nás. Např. od roku 2010 se ČR potýka se suchem, které je každý rok větší3, kumulovaně chybí čím dál více srážek. Současně se stále zhoršuje stav půdy díky příliš intenzivnímu zemědělství. Chceme vodu na příděl jako na jižní Moravě v létě 2018?""              4            Aktuální téma - plasty: ČR je na špici v podílu recyklace plastů v Evropě4, je ovšem vůbec potřeba jich tolik vyrábět? Pokrokové země je čím dál více omezují.    5            Existuje řešení jak zmírnit tento proces ničení přírody - změna procesu výroby a spotřeby: inspirace přírodou prostřednictvím biomimikry, příroda už vynalézá 3.8mld let5, má odpovědi na snad všechny naše otázky.                                                         6            ""Zlaté české ručičky” už dokázaly zázraky:Česká věda má významné místo ve světě, zároveň získávající i komerční úspěchy ve světě (technologické start-upy6 i existující stálice typu AVG, Avast i slovensko-český Eset), lék Holého na HIV používá polovina pacientů na světě7. Potenciál propojení biomimikry v české vědě a průmyslu je obrovský. Může být skutečné win-win pro přírodu i Českou republiku.                                                     7            Biomimikry není v ČR vůbec známa, chybí systematický přístup při využívání znalostí přírody. Západní Evropa v čele s Německem využívá biomimikry v průmyslu již přes 20 let.                                              8          Chybí povědomí o biomimikry v ČR, přesto existuje několik vlaštovek využití, např. nanovlákna v termo prádlu firmy Moira inspirované pouštní liškou. Historicky máme zajímavé výsledky vědy i medicíny, takže můžeme očekávat nové objevy. Příklady vědců: Jansky (krevní skupiny), Mendel (genetika), Wichterle (kontaktní čočky), Heyrovsky (polaroid), Holy (lék na uzdravení z HIV7) další viz poznámka č. 8.         9            Na konci 2018 jsme založili neziskovou instituci Biomimicry Analytics, zapsaný spolek, která má cíl rozšiřovat povědomí o biomimikry v CR a střední Evropě. Chceme, aby se biomimikry začala uplaňovat v praktické rovině - aplikace v průmyslu a vědě.                                       https://or.justice.cz/ias/ui/rejstrik-firma.vys...             10          Máme partnery ze SRN a Nizozemí, kteří s námi chtějí spolupracovat na poli biomimikry v ČR.       http://www.biomimicrynl.org/       https://www.bionik-online.de/was-ist-bionik/   JSME PŘESVĚDČENI, ŽE TÉMA JE NATOLIK ŠIROKÉ, ŽE NEJEFEKTIVNEJŠÍ POSTUP JE PROVÉST ANALÝZU, ABYCHOM VĚDĚLI KDE MÁ NEJVĚTŠÍ SMYSL SMĚŘOVAT DALŠÍ KONKRÉTNÍ PROJEKTY.                                                              PROSÍM PODPOŘTE FINANČNĚ REALIZACI TÉTO ANALÝZY

A přesto je zde malé povědomí o biomimikry. Česká republika může propojit své průmyslové dědictví s výzkumným potenciálem (12 vědců bylo jmenováno mezi globálně vysoce citovanými výzkumníky zveřejněnými společností Clarivate Analytics / Thomson Reuters, Česká reprezentace je dvojnásobná než Polská v roce 2018 a hlavní odvětví je chemie a životní prostředí.https://vedavyzkum.cz/ze-zahranici/ze-zahranici/cechu-mezi-nejcitovanejsimi-vedci-sveta-pribyva   Proč my?Jsme skupina, která hluboce věří, že toto téma má v České republice významný potenciál.Nezisková organizace sídlící v Praze s cílem zvýšit povědomí o biomimikry v České republice a regionu střední a východní Evropy. Webová stránka neziskové organizace:  https://biomimicryanalytics.org/ Multidisciplinární tým tvořený ekonomickým expertem na tropické zemědělství působícím v Středoamerické a Karibské oblasti, statistika pracujícími na vývoji softwaru pro udržitelnost v rámci SAP v Praze, odborníky na IT v oblasti telemedicíny a studium udržitelnosti se sídlem v Paříži a PhD expertem ekonomie a marketingu žijícím v Barceloně.Ve spolupráci s rostoucím seznamem odborníků:Biomimicry NL - http://www.biomimicrynl.org/english.html                             Jedno z německých bionic centerhttps://www.bionik-online.de/was-ist-bionik/MUDr. Veronika Svobodová, Ústav experimentální medicíny AV, odd. audiologické neurovědy:http://www.iem.cas.cz/en/research/departments/department-of-auditory-neuroscience/ Použití penězVytvoření studie potenciálu biomimikry v České republice se specifikací, na co se nejprve zaměřit1. Analýza - SWOT ekonomiky ČR2. Klíčové instituce ČR, které jsou aktivní / s nejvyšším potenciálem v oblasti biomimikry3. Závěr: doporučení pro rozvoj odvětví biomimikry v zemi4. Příloha: grafická část zralosti využití biomimikry v jednotlivých oborech a počet aktivních projektůMetodologie: kontaktovat seznam odborníků s otázkami týkajícíci se biomimikry a kombinace s veřejně dostupnými daty. Inspirativní ukázka Norské studie:http://norden.diva-portal.org/smash/get/diva2:1221701/FULLTEXT01.pdf#page29 Jiné způsoby, které můžete pomociJsme rozhodně otevřeni pro jakoukoli spolupráci, ať už můžete poskytnout některé vědecké / odborné kontakty, pomoci se samotnou zprávou, nebo dokonce pomoci při řízení přímo neziskové organizaceNejjednodušší pomocí je určitě šířit dále tuto kampaň mezi vaši přátelé a známé!Můžete také použít nástroje pro sdílení nástroje Indiegogo!Buďte otevření: životní prostředí je opravdu záležitostí nás všech...VELKÉ DÍKY UŽ JEN ZA TO, ŽE NÁM  VĚNOVALI ČTENÍM SVŮJ ČAS!
/English version/
ANALYSIS OF BIOMIMICRY IN THE CZECH REPUBLIC - LET'S FUND IT
Short Summary
1 Mankind consumes too much of Earth's resources - about 1.7 times[1] above its regenerative capacity. Moreover, we know most of the consumption is waste and overproduction.
2 The impact of this consumption is as massive: it has made extinct 54% of vertebrate species in the last 40 years[2] and 82% of insects in the past 27 years
3 Why shall we in the Czech Republic and CEE region care?

It also has an impact on us. E.g. since 2010, there was drought in the Czech Republic every year[3], cumulatively missing more and more rainfall and further deterioration of the water. So do we want water to be allocated on a daily quota as in South Moravia in summer 2018?

4 Plastics: Czech Republic is at the forefront of the rate of plastics recycling in Europe[4], but do we need to produce so many of them? Progressive countries are increasingly restricting the use and production of plastics.

5 There is a solution - a change in our approach to production and consumption: inspire from nature already during design. Nature has been already inventing for 3.8 billion years[5], it has answers to perhaps all of our questions. This approach is called “biomimicry”.

6 ""The golden Czech hands“ have already proven miracles. Czech science has a significant place in the World, “Czech golden hands” gaining real success in the world in the same time (technological start-ups[6] , also to the existing AVG, Avast and Slovak-Czech Eset types). The potential of the combination of possibilities of Czech science and the biomimicry industry is a huge.

7 Biomimicry is not known in the Czech Republic, there is a lack of systematic approach and without researching for answers to complicated questions within Nature. Western Europe, led by Germany, has been using biomimicry for over 20 years delivering significant advantages to the German industry.

8 Although there are few examples of biomimicry in the Czech Republic, i.e. nano-textiles in Moira's thermos-clothes are inspired by the desert fox’s ears. Historically, Czechs have interesting results of science and medicine, so we can expect new discoveries in the future. Historic researchers were e.g. Jansky (blood types), Mendel (genetics), Wichterle (contact lenses), Heyrovsky (polaroid), Holy (medicine to cure HIV[7], used by cca 50% of the patients worldwide).

9 At the end of 2018, we established a non-profit institution called Biomimicry Analytics, aiming to promote awareness of biomimicry in the Czech Republic and Central Europe. We want biomimicry to be applied in a practical level – used by industry and science.
Legal establishment of the NGO: https://or.justice.cz/ias/ui/rejstrik-firma.vys...

10 We have partners from Germany and the Netherlands who want to co-operate with us in the field of biomimicry in the Czech Republic. http://www.biomimicrynl.org/       https://www.bionik-online.de/was-ist-bionik/

BIOMIMICRY TOPIC IS SO VAST, THAT WE ARE CONVINCED THAT IN ORDER TO BE SUCCESSFUL AND EFFICIENCT, WE NEED TO EFFECTUATE AN ANALYSIS OF THE POTENTIAL IN THE COUNTRY. THIS SHALL GIVE US THE APPROPRIATE FOCUS.
PLEASE SUPPORT FINANCIALLY EXECUTION OF THIS ANALYSIS
Notes:
[1] https://www.overshootday.org/
[2] WWF 2018 Report: https://www.wwf.org.uk/sites/default/files/2018-10/wwfintl_livingplanet_full.pdf
[3] http://www.intersucho.cz/en/mapy/deficit-zasoby... https://archiv.ihned.cz/c1-66425000-2018-nejtep... a kniha o suchu/book about the draught http://www.intersucho.cz/userfiles/file/Sucho_v...
[4] https://www.europeandatajournalism.eu/eng/News/...
[5] www.biomimicry.org
[6] https://www.lupa.cz/aktuality/gartner-zaradil-c...
[7] https://www.idnes.cz/technet/veda/antonin-holy-leky.A120720_154839_veda_mla
Campaign

Why the Czech Republic - it's one of the most developed countries in terms of research capabilities, with a long industrial tradition in many sectors including biology-related sciences...  All the core sectors accompanied by strong academic infrastructure and R&D centers. AND yet there is little presence of biomimicry out there.
Creation of the study of the potential of biomimicry in the Czech Republic with the reflection where to focus first
Analysis of strengths, opportunities - SWOT of the Czech economy
Key CZ institutions active / with the highest potential in biomimicry
Conclusion: recommendations for the development of biomimicry sector in the country
Appendix: graphic part of industry maturity & count of active projects
Methodology:  contact list of experts with a list of biomimicry questions and compile with publicly available data.
Our partners are happy to collaborate on biomimicry in the Czech Republic and Europe wide context, we just need to have a basis where to start from.
What We Need & What You Get
Analysis: To conduct an analysis, report total est. size: 100 pages
Total amount: 5,000 USD or 100,000 CZK (65,000 for the study, up to 20,000 for graphics interface, up to 5,000 for perks to donors, up to 10,000 for fees to the platform and banks)
You can choose from the following perks:
VIP seats at the conference announcing report results
Official sponsor/donor named in the initial Thank you page of the report
EARLY BID: Fibonacciho formula engraved to metal/wood
Sponsors'/donors' names entitled in the footnote of one page of the report which they sponsor
If we do not reach the goal, we will need to raise the money elsewhere.
The Impact

There are mixed feelings about the urgency of the actions to improve the environment. The current political and corporate approach is to improve a selected range of % KPIs each year to satisfy some activist and general expectations. This is referred to as the “conventional” approach.

Unfortunately and given the state of overuse of the resources, there is not a time for this luxury (see graphs for a ""reality check""). Hence our suggestion for a step back, getting closer to Nature and get inspiration from her. This approach is called “biomimicry”.  That is why we want to research and raise awareness about more sustainable ways of designing.
We want to analyze the potential of biomimicry in the Czech republic specifying the main focus areas.
By supporting this project, you contribute to the progress of mankind toward a greater harmony with nature and more diverse science.

Common sense reality: you contribute to preventing deepening of natural imbalances such as Drought in Europe of 2018, fires in California, floods in Asia, etc. Who wants to have water on quotas as in parts of southern Moravia in summer 2018?
Think about Gandhi´s quote:  ""Earth provides enough to satisfy every man's needs, but not every man's greed.""
The Leader of the Analysis worked on a similar analysis in other sectors with Frost & Sullivan in London. Other members of the team are statisticians and IT experts to support the leader.
Key is the large group of scientists/industrial experts which will provide detailed sector insights and potential.
Source: Examples of overuse of most precious element – water, UN Water Institute (2017)
Risks & Challenges

There are multiple challenges: to reach a significant number of scientists/industry experts on time, to keep sufficiently strong methodology to connect the dots properly, to assure enough multidisciplinarity in the analytical team, to make the conclusion on time.
How to overcome these challenges:
The Leader has experience with similar reports
Several team members are used to tight deadlines from the IT industry
We are a diverse team of statisticians, IT experts, economists, marketing expert
We have a large network due to our different backgrounds and also thanks to relatives being scientists/industry experts
Other Ways You Can Help
We are definitely open for any kind of cooperation, either you can provide some scientist/expert contacts, help with the report itself or even help with running the NGO directly
The easiest help is certainly to spread the word of this campaign among your friends and connections! You may also use the Indiegogo share tools!
Be open-minded: environment is really a concern to all of us...
BIG THANK YOU EVEN FOR YOUR TIME READING THIS",1.0,0,"1 Campaign

About Csoma’s Room

The motto of the Csoma's Room Foundation is ""Explore - Understand - Cooperate"". These three words mean much more to us than a simple slogan. These three words sum up all our activities in the past 10 years, they describe what we believe in, they are the driving forces behind the development of our organisation. This is our approach to sustainable development in all our projects and initiatives, from the conservation of local built heritage through the building of passive solar houses up to education and community development. This is what connects our core team of experts who come with different professional backgrounds, but with a common approach.
<div>
<div style=""text-align: center
Explore
Exploring is meeting the unfamiliar, discovering and studying something new, gaining experience. Exploring is our starting point because we need firsthand experience to engage in a new project.

column2:
>In 2007 Olga and Balázs, the founders of Csoma's Room Foundation, arrived on bicycles to Zanskar, a remote, secluded valley in Ladakh, the Indian Himalayas. They were following the epic trail once undertaken by Alexander Csoma de Kőrös, a Hungarian scholar and explorer from the 19th century, who authored the first Tibetan-English dictionary. Csoma's footsteps led to Zangla village, lying at around 3700 meters above sea level. Here Olga and Balázs could catch a glimpse of the 16th century Palace, once the accommodation of Csoma, surrounded by numerous stupas, still magical in its then crumbling state.
This was the moment when the idea for the Csoma's Room Foundation was born, its first project being the conservation of the Zangla Palace. And through this first experience we began to explore Zanskar.

column1:
Exploration is an ongoing process. Each year new volunteers join our programme to work for and with the local community. They discover not just the awe inspiring topography of the Indian Himalayas, but also the people and the culture of Ladakh, its values and teachings.
The organisation also keeps on exploring
column2: we try to challenge ourselves and our accumulated knowledge all the time in order to adapt, improve and be able to support the local communities.

column1: Understand

Experience alone is not enough, we need to study and understand the information gained through participation and observation. We combine experience with research and analysis to get a deeper understanding of the place and the circumstances we work in.

column2:
>While working on the Palace we got to know the community of Zangla and the people of Ladakh better. We gained more and more experience and we started to see how things worked in the Zanskar Valley. We realised there was much more we could do: Modernisation is arriving with full power to the region in the shape of government road constructions, media, and throw-away consumer goods. Communities that used to live in complete isolation until about 30 years ago are now going through rapid change. And it’s not just the culture and the local economy that faces challenges. Since it is an environment at the extreme limits of human existence, the climate change along with the changing weather conditions are putting this fragile high-altitude ecosystem at serious risk.
Better understanding steered us towards new fields. We started to engage with the local community more closely via our education and community development initiatives. We also turned our focus from heritage conservation to community architecture that fuses the local traditional craft with innovations in passive solar design.

column1:
Research and the need for a better understanding provide us with the necessary tools to work responsibly for the benefit of the local communities.
Through our volunteering programme, our public presentations and publications we try to pass our knowledge to a wider audience so that more people can understand the challenges faced by wonderful places like the Zanskar Valley.
Cooperate

Working for a local community inevitably means closely cooperating with the community members. You can't achieve long-term sustainable results without involving the main actors and stakeholders. We treat them as partners and build development activities on cooperation and dialogue.

column2:
>Becoming more deeply involved in community actions made us increasingly sensitive towards the needs and dilemmas of the community. We also became aware of our role in local affairs. The Csoma’s Room Foundation aims to build a relationship where we can work together as a team with the local people, include them in the entire development process and enable its members to take the initiative.
We don't always know all the answers to the problems faced by the families in Zanskar, but in a partnership we can support them and find working solutions. We can help local carpenters make windows that make better use of the sun’s heat during cold winter days, we can work out effective teaching methods together with local families, we can assist the women to produce carpets, scarves, and other woven fabrics they can sell etc. In order to do so, we need to engage in a dialogue, build trust, constantly learn from the locals and support them by providing lacking resources, competences, and know-how.

column1: Cooperation is something that keeps transforming us as an organisation. It's our motivation and it forces us to evolve constantly. The past ten years has been a long journey from the ambitious dreams and efforts of a small group of friends to working in a team with common goals. All our volunteers are part of this bond, that's why we maintain active relations with our alumni.
We invite you to join and support us, so that we can provide more effective solutions, and better tools to this community.
Our Focus in the 2018 Season

In 2018 the organisation is piloting a new project called Community Solarisation, designed along the lines of our long-term goals while building upon our past work: the Solar School complex in Zangla, consisting of four classrooms and a teacher residence building, and the single-room Solar School in Tanpo built in 2017.

The Solarisation project takes our experiences and know-how one step further. Instead of erecting another public building, we intend to improve the quality of the village’s housing stock through tailor-made solar makeover of existing homes. The pilot phase will lay the foundations for the upcoming years. We will develop and test transferable and scalable practical solutions that we can later implement in other villages of the Zanskar region.

Apart from our thorough knowledge of sustainable passive solar building design, our familiarity with local building materials and techniques, the project will also benefit from our long-term engagement with local families and the community as a whole. During the implementation we will combine our work in sustainable architecture with the research-based knowledge of the local society to create community architecture that involves and empowers the community and its members.
Community Solarisation - Knowledge Transfer through Practice
Solarisation action plan for and with the local families

Compared with our previous solar architecture projects the solar makeover of the homes of local families appears to be smaller in scale, however, it is a much more complex intervention requiring careful preparation and execution. The process relies on a deeper relationship and a more intense cooperation with the locals. Its results will have a much more direct impact on the lives of local families.

Construction work will be prepared by assessing the needs of local families, making use of data gathered through field research in the previous years. On site, we will also survey the housing stock of the village, and choose the first pilot sites by taking into account both social indicators and architectural factors. We will contact the selected families and agree on the terms of their involvement. Our goal is to involve the families and the community as much as possible and to share tasks and responsibilities. Once we have an agreement, the makeover can begin.

Solarisation will mean finding custom solutions for each house to improve its passive solar capacities - anything from changing the south-facing windows to bigger, double-glazed panes to improving the insulation of walls and the roof. We will rely on the locals’ knowledge of traditional architecture and building techniques and induce knowledge transfer by showing how solar passive designs work in practice. After finishing a home we will start monitoring the impacts of solarisation: keeping in touch with the families and conducting follow up interviews.

We count on creating a snowball effect by training local “solar architects” through practice: the local craftsmen involved in the first solar makeovers will be able to help their neighbours by applying their knowledge and skills of passive solar design.

The results of our project will be more homes heated by the Sun, less reliance on scarce resources like wood and yak dung, and better living conditions during harsh winters when temperatures often drop to minus 30-40 degrees Celsius. Our Solarisation project will also promote using traditional skills and techniques, foster local identity against modern technology, build consciousness about ecological sustainability of buildings, and support forms of community architecture as a cooperation between locals.

Former References in the Application of the Solar Technology

 

2017 / Solar School in Tanpo

In Tanpo, a village in close proximity to Zangla, a functioning Solar School was built from scratch and completed during the 2-months summer season, partially financed by an Indiegogo campaign. All the families of the village participated in the construction, laid adobe bricks, collected stones, etc. The winter education of the community has been supported by a foreign sponsor since 2011, who finances the teacher’s salary every year, but a building suitable for winter education has been lacking till this season.
2016 / The Building of Winter Accommodation For Local Teachers
The first Trombe wall building constructed by Csoma’s Room Foundation. This passive solar building design makes the house suitable for use even after sunset and during the night.
2011-2014 / Solar School in Zangla

The school was envisioned in 2011 and completed with 4 classrooms and a separate toilet building in 2014. It has been functioning as the place for education in the harsh Ladakhi winters, as well as a community space throughout the year.
Cost Breakdown - Step by Step
$10  / the average cost of one m2 glass
$25  / the average daily cost of two local craftsmen
$50 / the average cost of a beam
$100 / the average cost of 30 sacks of straw used for insulation
$200 / the average cost of one m2 solar window
$500  / the average cost of  a solar window for a family living room
$1000 / the travel expenses of our supervisor expert

column2:
>Photo: Brigitta Kovács (2015)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

We appreciate any kind of help you can provide!

column1: Please share our project with friends who would be interested in it, and follow us on social media:
Facebook
Youtube

$200 / the average cost of one m2 solar window

Alright. I want you to imagine your ideal, regenerative farm. An agricultural operation where endangered snipes and camouflaged killdeer are safe to nest. Where tiny bird eggs are tucked securely in grass as shaggy, heritage-breed cattle graze calmly around them. Breathe in the fragrance of a healthy soil ecosystem: here, we sequester carbon. Microbes and mushrooms sing as they feed flowers rich nutrients from recycled organic matter. Can you see them? And the pollinators, thriving as they visit endangered root vegetables - sunchokes, rare potatoes, groundnuts - who in turn feed you, feed the farmers, and feed the community.
Welcome to Milkweed Tussock Tubers.

In 2016, Milkweed Tussock Tubers was a dream and a logo in a sketchbook. Now St Lawrence County, New York's only seed potato business, we operate under the umbrella of Bittersweet Farm, our small-scale, diversified, certified organic sponsor organization. A woman-run, no-till farm, Milkweed Tussock Tubers takes our role as integral players in a complex, astonishing ecosystem very seriously. We work to: restore and re-popularize unusual and endangered root crops
column2: farm in the most ecologically responsible way possible
column3: and teach others to do the same. We provide our community with 16 tablestock potato varieties and three types of seedstock, while rejuvenating regionally developed spuds. We're also re-introducing groundnuts, sunchokes, wild ginger and Solomon's Seal, returning diversity to both terra and table. Our small scale means it's possible for us to focus on a wide range of projects, making our practices holistic in nature.

column1: Alongside our efforts to bring gastronomical diversity to customers, we also freely share our extensive knowledge. Students, volunteers, customers and friends visit the farm and learn how to grow their own gardens, preserve their own food and save their own seeds, changing the world in ways both intimate and expansive.

column2: >And, most excitingly, we're becoming a cow-powered farm!

column1: MTT will be one of few farms in our area working with oxen. We are transitioning away from fossil fuels, and our beautiful heifer calves, Emma, Fern and Galadryal, are learning to pull a cultivator and dig potato trenches this year. Soon, they'll be strong enough to pull haying equipment, like a wagon, rake and mower. The EFGs are the inspiration for this fundraiser. These girls need appropriate equipment to do their jobs. Unique tools for unique workers on a unique farm. And the rest of the farm needs the same.

As a no-till operation with animals to feed, Milkweed Tussock Tubers relies on the hay we harvest with Bittersweet Farm. The 2,000 45-pound square bales we put up provide mulch hay for gardens and food and bedding for cows, sheep, pigs and poultry. Mulch builds soil organic matter, retains moisture, reduces weed pressure and prevents soil erosion. The diversity of our hay provides the animals with micronutrients and roughage, promoting healthy digestion. And our haying methods are different, as well. Unlike neighboring farms, we pay close attention to very specific creatures with whom we share the land: field birds.

Meadowlarks, bobolinks, red-winged blackbirds, savannah sparrows, killdeer and snipes are just a few of the feathered friends once common in Northern New York fields. Due to the industrialized haying methods of surrounding farms, these ground nesters are unable to successfully rear chicks. When large farms chop hay in May, eggs and baby birds are sucked up into drum mower blades and slaughtered. Repeated hayings throughout the season prevent parents from rebuilding their nests and trying again.

column2: >At Milkweed Tussock Tubers, the story is a different one.

column1: MTT and Bittersweet Farm hay after the 14th of July in order to avoid harming ground-nesters. We leave swaths of grass untouched until we're sure the fledglings have left. Our no-till practices allow certain species, like killdeer, to nest right in the gardens. And our use of small-scale haying equipment has a smaller impact on overall field health.

Well, after years of working with a second-hand mower and baler, our tools have fallen apart. We are unable to consistently cut, rake and bale our own hay. Our options include hiring someone to hay for us, with their equipment, or purchasing hay from off the farm. Unfortunately, both options put area field birds at greater risk. Hired hayers work on their own schedule, not ours or that of the birds, and purchased hay is something over which we have no control. The quality could be poor, or invasive species brought in, or genetically modified seeds might find their way here.

Tractor Tools Direct in Terre Haute, Indiana, sells the Compact Homesteader Hay Package for $12,237.00.  After scouring the hay world for appropriate tools, we've determined that this the right fit. The equipment is small, manageable and makes bales that can be handled by everyone on our team. Shipping from Indiana to MTT in Depeyster, New York is $600.00, and paying for assembly will cost about $500.00. The total needed, then, is approximately $13,337.00. With a smoothly functioning haying system, Milkweed Tussock Tubers and Bittersweet Farm will be able to provide ourselves with hay for the whole season. Galadryal, Emma and Fern will be eating high-quality, diverse roughage during the winter, and the potatoes will grow in a protective blanket of mulch.  And we will be able to teach our neighbors about bird-based haying techniques, spreading the word about the importance of ecological respect in food production.

Whether you be a farmer or a foodie, a bird-lover or a bookworm, you can support small-scale, regenerative agriculture! Help Milkweed Tussock Tubers become a leader in local ecological farming.  Our combined efforts can put delicious food in folks tummies, restore endangered species and rare crops, warm the oxen on a cold winter's day and ensure that we all keep smiling. So what are you waiting for? Let's work together and make some positive change in this crazy world.

Coral Reefs and Our Research
Coral Reefs are declining at an incredible rate, and as a citizens of
the World, we should all be concerned as our lives, even if we are
nowhere near a coral reef, depend on them. Reefs cover less than 1% of
the Earth's surface, yet they support 25% of the Ocean's marine life.
These are fish and other creatures that humans depend on for food and
livelihood. In fact, over 1 billion people in the world depend directly
upon reefs for their livelihood with reefs contributing over 30 billion
dollars to the world economy each year. Reefs help drive our weather
patterns and protect our shorelines and homes from damage. We also pull
many new medicines for combating disease from reefs. Additionally, reefs
are just as important as the rainforest in the carbon cycle of our
planet, serving as a sink and contributing greatly to the clean air that
we need to breathe. If our reefs go away, each of our lives would be
greatly affected.
<ul>
• Our work can help ensure that coral reefs to not disappear from the planet.
<li>We have already started to successfully bank some species, but we
have a long way to go as there are hundreds, if not thousands of coral
species around the world.
<li>While we originally imagined our banks as ""an insurance policy for
the future"", the need for our banked material is already here today.
Scientists in Australia and the Middle East are already looking to use
our frozen sperm samples to potentially create corals that might be more
well adapted for rising ocean temperatures.
<li>By contributing to our research, you are directly contributing to
insuring the coral reefs of our planet live on for years to come.
The Reef Recovery Initiative

We are a group of scientists, researchers, aquarists and volunteers from around the World seeking to preserve coral reefs using modern fertility techniques. Through cryopreservation, the process of freezing live cells, we are able to preserve sperm, embryonic cells and adult tissue of corals. These frozen cells can last for hundreds or even thousands of years creating an insurance policy for our coral reefs. A few hundred carefully chosen samples of a species can represent the genetic diversity that exists for that species right now. In the future, these samples can be used to reseed and regrow coral reefs around the world. Our accomplishments so far:
<ul>
• Successfully frozen and thawed live coral sperm, embryonic cells and adult tissues.
• Helped start a frozen bank for the Great Barrier Reef and have banked 11 species over the last 4 years.
• Began a frozen bank for two Caribbean corals that are on the endangered species list.
• Began a frozen bank for Hawaiian corals.
Our research is still ongoing, however. The techniques for properly freezing coral cells are still being perfected.
<div>
Our Needs

It is no secret that Science funding has been scarce over the past few years. While we have secured some funding for our salaries to keep working, we are in serious need of some essential equipment and coverage for a few other expenses.
Our goal is to raise $75,000. The specifics:

$20,000 - Setting up a fully functional long-term cryo storage facility in Hawaii. We can freeze the cells and we know they are alive and can be useful in the future, but maintaining them frozen takes a high-tech secure facility, otherwise, all our efforts are in vain.

$27,000 - Purchasing and setting up a laser warming system for thawing coral embryos and eggs. The warming process is just as crucial as the freezing! You can learn more about the process at our website: http://www.reefrecovery.org/frozen-banks

$20,000 - Repairing our Flow Cytometer, which is a great machine that let's us quickly assess the health of tens of thousands of sperm or embryonic cells at once. We have to know that the cells we put into our banks are happy and healthy.
$3000 - Paying our amazing video editor who has been working pro bono for us for several years.
$5000 - General lab supplies and expenses for our work.
Your donation gets you anywhere from a shout out on our website, to one of our scientists coming to speak at your event. Check the Perks section for more details!
<div>
Can't donate at this time? Here's what you can do:
If you can't donate, but still believe our work is important:
<ul>
• Help us promote!
• Indiegogo has great Share tools to get our campaign out to all your social media friends. Please use them!

column3:
/>

An idea born out of a passion to use art for social change, Plastic Fantastic is on a mission to change how the world views its environment by planting seeds of environmental consciousness in children and adults, while also supporting impoverished artisans and their families by selling their upcycled handcrafts that spark conversation around environmental issues.

--

Hi, I’m Ciru. During the long rains of March 2013, the local river

column1: where I live near in Ngong (a small town located on the South West outskirts of
Nairobi, Kenya), flooded and scattered plastic all over the land. I was
horrified by this sight and decided to find out what was causing the pollution.
From my research I found that local garbage collectors dump trash collected
from homes in the area into a landfill near the river. Since the landfill isn’t
managed by the local government, the trash is carried into the river whenever
it rains.
column8:
>

Looking back at my childhood, these rivers were clean! I remember

column1: fetching water and bathing in them, and in less than 15 years most of them have
turned into polluted cesspools, dumping people’s trash into the ocean – an ocean
we all share, each and every one of us! This is the story of many rivers across
the world.
column7:
/>

I knew that by doing something about this problem in my community,

column1: that I could inspire others around the world to do the same. Since our local
government wasn’t doing anything about the problem, I knew the solution would
involve changing how we relate to our waste.
column2: >Plastic Fantastic - an Idea is Born
column9:
>

In 2013, while attending the Amani Institute – a Social Innovation

column1: Management school, based in Nairobi – I was challenged to transform my initial
desire to clean up the river into a socially engaged business. I was then
joined by my co-founder and fellow Amani student, Jesah Segal, who helped me implement
the idea and turn it into where it is today
marries a strong social and environmental impact with a sustainable revenue
generating model.
column7:
>The Mission

We knew that any business worth its salt needs razor sharp clarity

column1: to keep it focused on its objective. So, we created the following mission

statement: To elevate environmental consciousness through the arts.

How it Works
<ul><li>
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
partner with local school systems and facilitate ongoing recycling campaigns.
seeds of environmental appreciation in young children.
<div style=""text-align: center
<span style=""background-color: initial
• We then gather the plastic
generated from the recycling campaigns. Plastic waste which people have thrown out, is effectively transformed into a fantastic raw material (i.e. commodity) that artisans can use.
<li>
We then co-design and
collaborate with professional artisans to upcycle the waste into cool products
that conscious consumers love! <i style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
<li>
For
organizations and artisan groups, we also provide workshops
that teach upcycling techniques and foster environmental stewardship. We then develop
relationships with artisans who show exceptional skill and commitment, and
market and sell items on their behalf.
<li>

We then generate revenue by marketing and selling these products to consumers who appreciate one-of-a-kind, handmade creations. We’ve done our market research and there’s a huge and growing segment of consumers who prefer one-of-a-kind over mass-manufactured items. Selling upcycled handcrafts serves as a vehicle which ignites conversations and sustains our social impact.

column7: >From our research, no one else in the world incorporates elements

column1: of education and product sales in such a way. Not only that, this idea is
scalable and can be implemented in any community in the world.

We are deeply grateful for the impact we have achieved over the past six months. We have:

1.  Kicked off a sustainable
and ongoing recycling campaign in partnership with Aga Khan Academy, the
largest school system in the greater Nairobi area with an enrollment

of 800+ students.

2.  Trained over 70 people in five
upcycling workshops – one workshop of which, was in partnership with Kenya Red
Cross. It’s unbelievable how thirsty people are for new knowledge and ideas!
3.  Eleven artisans (and their families) that we work with are currently benefiting from the Fair Trade principles we abide by.
4.  Through sales and workshops we have generated 66,000 KSH (that’s $724!), over the past six months.
column7:
>Fun in the Sun!

Aside from all this hard work we’ve been doing, we also have a fun side-project we’re really excited about. We hold a monthly tree growing event that engages local youth to grow trees on the side of Ngong Hills – voted by Travelzoo.com as one of the most romantic sites in the world, beating out Paris, New York, and Rome! We’ve had three tree growing events so far, and planted 54 trees. Wowza! Our goal for 2015 is to plant and grow 100 trees. You’d never guess how easy and fun it is to plant a tree in your neighborhood. It really is a walk in the park!
column9:
>

The Team

As I mentioned earlier, my name is Ciru - I’m a multi-dimensional

column1: artist, leveraging eight years of creative experience and four years of law
school to build the social enterprise, Plastic Fantastic Kenya. I’m a hopeless
optimist and often engage in long afternoon sessions of day dreaming about a
better world - much to my co-founder’s consternation, of course.
As the “Creative Orchestrator” of Plastic Fantastic Kenya, I am
responsible for artisan relationships and product design. I lead upcycling
workshops and have a deep local network which I draw upon for sales and
marketing.
Jesah, my co-founder, grew up in the unspoiled, mountainous
terrain of Montana, USA. He was appalled when I showed him the plastic waste
profusely littered along the local river in Ngong. Having come to Kenya to
chase the dream of elevating consciousness through the curation of handcrafts
made by artisans from exotic cultures around the world, Jesah immediately saw
the viability of my vision on how to change the world through Plastic Fantastic.
Jesah acts as the Business Architect directing Plastic Fantastic’s
business trajectory. With a degree in Business Administration and five years
working as a consultant in corporate America, he isn’t your average westerner
living in Kenya. As a world traveler Jesah has lived in 26 places around the
globe – Kenya being just one of them. When Jesah isn’t building Plastic
Fantastic, he’s an amateur Buddhist Monk, and Mixed Martial Arts fighter (1 win
– 1 loss).
<b style=""font-size: 30px
column6: >Learn about where Plastic Fantastic is going in 2015!

column1: <ul>

• In order to be sustainable, we need to increase our income generated from sales. We will do this by creating as many distribution points for conscious consumers as possible. So far, we have entered into wholesale relationships with a shop in the U.S., a shop in Finland, and will soon be offering our items to a number of storefronts in Nairobi, Kenya. Our goal is to have 20 vendors worldwide selling our products by the end of the year.
• We are half way through incorporating our business and should be fully registered by the end of January.
• We are actively collaborating with a local artisan to handcraft upcycled display stands for our jewelry and accessories in retail shops.
• The recycling campaign isn’t stopping with just one of Aga Khan’s schools – we hope to include four more schools into our recycling campaign before the year is out.
<li>
<span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >We need to finish developing our website – only 10% to go!

column1: <i style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5:
>

We need your help to raise funds to

column1: accomplish these goals for 2015!
<b style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)

We have “bootstrapped” by exhausting most of our available resources and now we need your help to maintain this impact.

Both of us, eat, sleep, and breathe Plastic Fantastic - it has been A TON of hard work for Jesah and me. With your help, we won’t let up anytime soon!

Check out the donation perks to the right to see which contribution tugs at your heart.
column2: >We’ve done our market research and have reached out to people in all walks of life throughout the Nairobi community. They are relieved and thrilled someone is doing something about all the plastic flying around…and yes, the plastic is literally FLYING!
column7:
schema=youtube"" width=""580"">

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone can make a monetary contribution, but that doesn't mean you can’t make a huge difference! We need your voice!

You can support us by getting word out to your friends, family and social networks about this exciting movement we are building in Kenya! Without you this isn't possible!

Like and share our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/plasticfantastickenya

Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/plasticfuntasty

If you have any questions or comments, please email us at plasticfantastickenya@gmail.com

If you want to contribute using M-Pesa, then use the following number: 0726 381 070

And last, but not least, we have to give credit where credit is due. With such a crazy and interconnected world, there are people who have touched our hearts, books we've randomly happened to come across, and life experiences we've had (both good and bad) which, without, we wouldn't have the passion to have built Plastic Fantastic to where it is today. Thank you to Amani Institute, for without it, Jesah and Ciru would never have met, and the idea for Plastic Fantastic would have stayed just that - an idea. And, finally, thank you to our supporters, the people who believe in us, because without your belief this wouldn't be possible.

Asante sana!!
