The Bioblitz itself is run by The Kingston Field Naturalists and powered by their network of professional and amateur naturalists who volunteer their time and expertise to help identify species and share their knowledge with the general public in Bioblitz related activities.
column17: > This campaign will specifically cover the costs of hosting the Bioblitz at Wintergreen. Do your part in building awareness about the diversity of living organisms on the 204 acres of Wintergreen.

column8:
What You Get

Some BioBlitz events enjoy the sponsorship of large organizations or foundations to cover costs. For example, National Geographic supports the BioBlitz movement by sponsoring BioBlitz events across the United States and by making educational materials available through their website.

Since Wintergreen doesn’t enjoy the sponsorship of National Geographic (not just yet, anyway!), this campaign was designed to help Wintergreen host this event. Your support means a lot to us—whether you are able to invest in this event financially or join us as a volunteer, your help would be most welcomed.

column1: So...
• Our goal is to raise $1,500 for hosting the BioBlitz through friends of Wintergreen, and ... well ... friends of the planet!

• The campaign will pay for the expenses associated with hosting BioBlitz 2015 at Wintergreen, including event insurance, lodge operating costs, trail preparation, mowing of fields for tenting and BBQ, and staff time.
  • There are four different perks available for those who donate!
<h3><span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)
<span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)
<div><span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)
column4:
>
A BioBlitz provides information to scientists and to the public about changes that could occur due to global warming or invasive species. You, your kids, relatives and friends can learn about local species, and at the same time, help fight global warming through education and advocacy.

We all need to participate to collect information. There are some rapid environmental changes occurring, and species need to be recorded very quickly. The BioBlitz movement helps to do this.

column1: Let's not forget that coming in direct contact
with plants and animals and other living organisms makes us more sensitive to the beauty and fragility of the natural world, making us all more likely to address urgent
environmental problems that the BioBlitz movement might identify.
<div><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<div>
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<div><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px

The purpose of a BioBlitz is to list as many plant and animal species as possible in a 24-hour period, thus giving a snapshot of the biodiversity of the site.  Both amateur and professional naturalists join forces to spot and identify species and to educate each other and the public about the diversity of the location.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute money, that's okay!

column2:
>Kingston Field Naturalists and Wintergreen can both use the help of volunteers. Come help us organize the site! Find some species! Help guide people to the various ecosystems on the land! The more people, the more species we find!



","Summary

column1: The BioBlitz is a world-wide movement in which teams of volunteer scientists, families, students, teachers, and community members work together to find and identify as many species of plants, animals, microbes, fungi, and other organisms as possible over a 24-hour period. There have been BioBlitz events all over Canada, the United States, Australia, Africa, China, and Europe— and in 2015, the Kingston Field Naturalists will hold their Bioblitz at Wintergreen for the first time! Our goal is to locate and identify at least 600 species during the Wintergreen BioBlitz, which will take place June 12 and 13, 2015. The Bioblitz itself is run by The Kingston Field Naturalists and powered by their network of professional and amateur naturalists who volunteer their time and expertise to help identify species and share their knowledge with the general public in Bioblitz related activities. This campaign will specifically cover the costs of hosting the Bioblitz at Wintergreen. Do your part in building awareness about the diversity of living organisms on the 204 acres of Wintergreen.

What We Need & What You GetSome BioBlitz events enjoy the sponsorship of large organizations or foundations to cover costs. For example, National Geographic supports the BioBlitz movement by sponsoring BioBlitz events across the United States and by making educational materials available through their website. Since Wintergreen doesn’t enjoy the sponsorship of National Geographic (not just yet, anyway!), this campaign was designed to help Wintergreen host this event. Your support means a lot to us—whether you are able to invest in this event financially or join us as a volunteer, your help would be most welcomed.
So...
Our goal is to raise $1,500 for hosting the BioBlitz through friends of Wintergreen, and ... well ... friends of the planet!

The campaign will pay for the expenses associated with hosting BioBlitz 2015 at Wintergreen, including event insurance, lodge operating costs, trail preparation, mowing of fields for tenting and BBQ, and staff time. There are four different perks available for those who donate!
The Impact

A BioBlitz provides information to scientists and to the public about changes that could occur due to global warming or invasive species. You, your kids, relatives and friends can learn about local species, and at the same time, help fight global warming through education and advocacy.We all need to participate to collect information. There are some rapid environmental changes occurring, and species need to be recorded very quickly. The BioBlitz movement helps to do this.
Let's not forget that coming in direct contact
with plants and animals and other living organisms makes us more sensitive to the beauty and fragility of the natural world, making us all more likely to address urgent
environmental problems that the BioBlitz movement might identify.
The Purpose

The purpose of a BioBlitz is to list as many plant and animal species as possible in a 24-hour period, thus giving a snapshot of the biodiversity of the site.  Both amateur and professional naturalists join forces to spot and identify species and to educate each other and the public about the diversity of the location.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute money, that's okay!

Kingston Field Naturalists and Wintergreen can both use the help of volunteers. Come help us organize the site! Find some species! Help guide people to the various ecosystems on the land! The more people, the more species we find!",1.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Kingston, Canada",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/bioblitz-2015-at-wintergreen/pica

<h1 style=""text-align: center
<span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)
column6: >Please support our marine conservation, biodiversity research and mapping of the Mergui Archipelago.

column1: <div>
<h3 style=""text-align: center
column2: >We are not asking only for your support.

column1: <h3 style=""text-align: center
<h3 style=""text-align: center
column2: >...become a real part of this project, sail with us on expeditions and together we can understand, chart, explore and preserve this pristine area for future generations.

column1: <div>
Our Focus:
<h3><b>Biodiversity
and Geographic Research
<div>
The
Myeik (Mergui) Archipelago (see maps below)  in the Andaman Sea off southern Myanmar is
one of few pristine and uncharted coastal tropical island groups left
on the planet. Bordering Thailand to the south, the islands remain
largely uninhabited and undeveloped, and are currently being considered by UNESCO as a World Heritage site. Myanmar’s political
climate has been changing rapidly, and island resource management may
be on the brink of change as well.
In 1997 EcoSwiss
received one of the first permits to operate research cruises in
then-reclusive Burma, and ever since, founder Luca Schueli has been
enabling local and foreign scientists to explore one of the last
marine wildernesses in the world. Luca prefers to call it the Moken Archipelago,
for the seafaring gypsies that used to roam the islands crossing the
border between Thai and Burmese waters.
Luca has since
conducted dozens of research trips and expeditions into this
little-documented area, providing wildlife, reef and mangrove forest
survey data that were key to the creation of Lampi National Park.
With this legacy of accomplishment, Luca, 69, is ready to retire, and
wishes to extend his experience, local knowledge and conservation
efforts to the next generation, to pursue new opportunities that will
help preserve Moken resources and culture.
William
Ruzek is a young geographer who would like to pick up the reins and
reinvigorate research operations in new and diverse ways. EcoSwiss
equipment is available, <u><b>and
free to use,
but 18 years of operations in the tropics has taken a toll - some
equipment is outdated, needs replacement, or requires an overhaul. As
boat owners know, salt water operations come at a price!
We need your help to
continue the conservation and study of one of the last uncharted
marine areas in the world. Our research, baseline surveys and data
collection could provide the catalyst for the creation of a
Trans-border Marine Protected Area! By assisting in our project you
could help us study, chart, and understand an area where only few
have ever traveled. Your contribution or participation will help this marine area
receive the attention and protection it desperately needs. <span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)

column5: >Key to the operation is our research platform,
column9: > the ""Land Rover"" of the seas...

column1: <ul>
<li><span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >A 14.5m (47') custom-built catamaran envisioned by Luca Schueli.

column1: <li><span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >Almost 7m across! SeaNOMAD  provides excellent research space, boat stability and huge deck space.

column1: <li><span style=""background-color: initial
<div>
<div>
<div>
Shallow draft for passing over coral flats and entering rivers (3’ , 90cm).
• A time-tested, hard-working boat, with a long history, complete with old sea stories.
<div>
SeaNOMAD - 2003
What We Need
<div>
SeaNOMAD
is currently undergoing major repairs – engine overhaul, new paint
and sails are already covered and planned for the coming season! She is fitted for a max of 6 volunteers and 4 crew! - Perfect for any expedition.
But
it takes more  than a working boat to survey the biodiversity and
promote conservation in the Archipelago. We need funding for permits,
port fees, visas, food and crew. To continue research operations, we
need essential equipment to collect data  and perform marine surveys,
to inform marine conservation efforts. With the right equipment,
research, exploration and conservation studies can continue for years
to come!
Most
importantly... we need you! Please join us on an expedition or support
us to explore this region! Be a part of history and discover the Moken
Archipelago.

column1: The Impact and Conservation Summary
<div>
<div><span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
Any assessment of
change requires a baseline against which to which compare. <span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
remains a largely remote, uncharted and pristine areas, no such
baseline currently exists. This project plans to assess the current
reef-health and ecological status of the southernmost group of
islands within the Mergui Archipelago. By understanding the current
conditions, future proposals, parks, and studies will be able to
compare conditions. With a mixture of different survey techniques and
approaches, this assessment will provide considerable data of the
islands terrestrial and marine species, reef-health and the
surrounding underwater features. Sites of unique biodiversity will be
noted for future research and reef-assessment, species lists will be
created to document the vast and unique wildlife that lives on and
near the islands, and bathymetric data will help to monitor the reefs
and protect future visiting vessel.
Unique new methods will be used
to combine the various data, allowing interested scientists,
researchers, and officials to see the bathymetric, reef-health, and
video footage all synced to the boats GPS coordinates. This will
allow for quick future assessment and a multi-dataset record of the
current reef's condition and health.
Local and international
experts, researchers and scientists would be encouraged to join trips
and contribute to the project or knowledge and conservation of the
region. Flexibility will allow for a variety of other smaller
projects to be conducted during this project. This project plans also
allows eco-volunteers to assist throughout the data collection and
surveying methods. Assistance in wildlife survey, both on land and
while on the boat, will play a vital role in supplementing species
lists. Participation in the reef-health map and data collection, via
Manta Tow, will allow eco-volunteers to witness and interact with the
marine life. By allowing active participation in the data collection
and conservation, we will help to raise awareness,
appreciation, and promote protection of this unique area.
With proper funding this
project could expand to the central and northern islands of the
Mergui Archipelago, allowing a complete assessment of the reefs,
underwater features, species lists, and future mooring sites. This
will play a vital role in the future of the islands. If the islands
are continually more accessible to visitor, it is crucial that
baseline data is collected, reef-health assessed and surveyed. This
will provide a basis in which to create both eco-tourist destinations
as well as marine protected areas.
By understanding the currently
conditions of these islands informed decisions in conservation and
protection can be made. One hope is to see a trans-border marine
protected area, between Thailand and Myanmar. Our assessment
of the southernmost islands can play a key role for the future of
this pristine and unique area.

We understand that sometimes you don't have the extra funds to donate.. that is ok! There are many other ways you can help us and the continued conservation of the Mergui (Moken) Archipelago.

  • Get the word out! Tell your friends, share this project, share our website, let people know about the Mergui (Moken) Archipelago and about us. If you tell just one person, you are already helping us to raise awareness!
• Donate something other than money! We are still in need of a variety of things to make SeaNOMAD ready to tackle the seas again. Contact us if you think you have something that might help.

• Join us on a trip! Actively assist in our research as an eco-volunteer or relax as a eco-tourist as you discover untouched, uncharted beaches and islands! Or come and volunteer to help refurbish the boat!

column1: We are not asking only for your support.
We want you to JOIN us!!!
...become a real part of this project, sail with us on expeditions and together we can understand, chart, explore and preserve this pristine area for future generations.
Sailing in the ""Forgotten"" Mergui Archipelago
Our Focus:
Biodiversity
and Geographic Research
The
Myeik (Mergui) Archipelago (see maps below)  in the Andaman Sea off southern Myanmar is
one of few pristine and uncharted coastal tropical island groups left
on the planet. Bordering Thailand to the south, the islands remain
largely uninhabited and undeveloped, and are currently being considered by UNESCO as a World Heritage site. Myanmar’s political
climate has been changing rapidly, and island resource management may
be on the brink of change as well.
In 1997 EcoSwiss
received one of the first permits to operate research cruises in
then-reclusive Burma, and ever since, founder Luca Schueli has been
enabling local and foreign scientists to explore one of the last
marine wildernesses in the world. Luca prefers to call it the Moken Archipelago,
for the seafaring gypsies that used to roam the islands crossing the
border between Thai and Burmese waters.
Luca has since
conducted dozens of research trips and expeditions into this
little-documented area, providing wildlife, reef and mangrove forest
survey data that were key to the creation of Lampi National Park.
With this legacy of accomplishment, Luca, 69, is ready to retire, and
wishes to extend his experience, local knowledge and conservation
efforts to the next generation, to pursue new opportunities that will
help preserve Moken resources and culture.
William
Ruzek is a young geographer who would like to pick up the reins and
reinvigorate research operations in new and diverse ways. EcoSwiss
equipment is available, and
free to use,
but 18 years of operations in the tropics has taken a toll - some
equipment is outdated, needs replacement, or requires an overhaul. As
boat owners know, salt water operations come at a price!
We need your help to
continue the conservation and study of one of the last uncharted
marine areas in the world. Our research, baseline surveys and data
collection could provide the catalyst for the creation of a
Trans-border Marine Protected Area! By assisting in our project you
could help us study, chart, and understand an area where only few
have ever traveled. Your contribution or participation will help this marine area
receive the attention and protection it desperately needs.
What We Have
Key to the operation is our research platform,  the ""Land Rover"" of the seas... SeaNOMAD:
A 14.5m (47') custom-built catamaran envisioned by Luca Schueli.
Almost 7m across! SeaNOMAD  provides excellent research space, boat stability and huge deck space.
Shallow draft for passing over coral flats and entering rivers (3’ , 90cm).
A time-tested, hard-working boat, with a long history, complete with old sea stories.
SeaNOMAD - 2003
What We Need .
SeaNOMAD - Jan 2015
SeaNOMAD
is currently undergoing major repairs – engine overhaul, new paint
and sails are already covered and planned for the coming season! She is fitted for a max of 6 volunteers and 4 crew! - Perfect for any expedition.
Current Layout of SeaNOMAD - PDF
But
it takes more  than a working boat to survey the biodiversity and
promote conservation in the Archipelago. We need funding for permits,
port fees, visas, food and crew. To continue research operations, we
need essential equipment to collect data  and perform marine surveys,
to inform marine conservation efforts. With the right equipment,
research, exploration and conservation studies can continue for years
to come!
Most
importantly... we need you! Please join us on an expedition or support
us to explore this region! Be a part of history and discover the Moken
Archipelago.
The Project needs:
Mergui Archipelago Permits
2x GoPro Cameras (For Reef Assessments)
GPS Equipment
Sonar Device (For Bathymetric Surveys)
Chart Plotter
Kayaks / Fix Dinghy to the Boat
4x Full SCUBA Sets
Small Compressor
8x Snorkel Sets
Small Desalination Machine
Solar Panel System
So why the Moken (Mergui) Archipelago? What will we do?
Besides these 3 reasons?
National Geographic Best Trips of 2015
Sea Gypsies
Burma Opens Pristine Islands

column1: <div>
So much more than just a job.

Project Get Reel is the first of its kind. It exists within Toronto’s Learning Enrichment Foundation (LEF)—a west end hub for social enrichment and community engagement. There, our employees have access to a variety of resources, such as English language training, employment services and childcare. These services can be instrumental in helping individuals break through the cycle of unemployment.
<div>

With your support, we can help community members facing barriers to employment join an enriching and rewarding environmental initiative. The impact will be huge. Having a job significantly contributes to a person's happiness and well-being. And this project will change Toronto's recycling landscape by significantly reducing the amount of recyclable material going into landfills.
<div>
Join the movement. We're counting on you.
<div>

We invite you to be our allies in tackling this unresolved environmental challenge. Support Project Get Reel for both environmental and social good. We have prepared different perks for different levels of support.

If you are as passionate about this social mission as we are, please spread the word to your friends and family! Project Get Reel has a long-term social-environmental impact and it is critical that we share its value with as many people as possible.
Thank you for taking time to read about this groundbreaking initiative. We are excited to watch it thrive!
Please stay in touch. Follow us on:
•  Facebook

column1: Yuliana, client of Learning Enrichment Foundation.
In the media:
“What you’re doing is exemplifying what we hope everybody would do.”
- Michael Charbon, Rogers TV

“Hopefully as word about the program spreads, so too will an awareness for how to properly treat VHS tapes and other disposable technologies.”

                                                                                                    -Adrian Johnson, NOW Magazine

“Once upon a time, VHS tapes ruled the world. Now we’re struggling to figure out what to do with them as the chunky boxes of plastic sit around in basements and closets, gathering dust and degrading, the information stored on their magnetic stripes slowly escaping its bonds.”
- Jordan Pearson, VICE Magazine
""More recycling means more jobs, fewer plastics being thrown away and new opportunities for non profits to see how binging business and mission together can accomplish great things.”
-Sophia Bennett, 1-800-Recycling.com
Project Partnerships:
To our backers: Stay tuned for our special tours to Get Reel workshop in May.
The Honourable Senator Art Eggleton endorses Project Get Reel.
Roger Hacala, Senior Vice President, Willis Canada support Project Get Reel.
Read more information on our April 9 launch event.
Watch CBC news on Project Get Reel.
There are two big challenges facing Ontario today. So we created one dynamic solution.

1. When was the last time you watched a movie on VHS? Probably a while ago. The medium is obsolete. Today in Ontario there are 2.26 billion VHS tapes sitting in basements, stuffed in closets and collecting dust in storage rooms.
Fact: VHS tapes are 80% recyclable but most end up in landfills.
Fact: Plastics can take up to 1,000 years to biodegrade.

Recycling VHS tapes involves a lot of manual labour. Research shows that there is no way to automate the dismantling process and the work needs to be done by hand. So most VHS tapes just get tossed in the garbage and end up in landfills. We're solving this problem...and one more.

2. What do you think perpetual unemployment does to a person's physical and psychological well-being? Sustainable employment is so important. It helps people live fulfilling lives and contributes to happy, healthy communities.

Unfortunately it is extremely difficult for many Ontarians to find jobs. New immigrants, single parents and persons struggling with mental health can face barriers to employment—which can be detrimental to a person’s well-being and sense of self-worth.
3. So, how do you tackle landfills and unemployment? Here's how:

This graphic is our triple bottom line. We created a sustainable way to recycle VHS tapes: employing individuals to dismantle them. But it doesn't end there. We will specifically employ individuals  facing barriers to employment. This strategy helps us save the environment and enrich the lives of fellow Ontarians.
Your support for Project Get Reel is crucial in making landfills less filled with recyclable materials, as well as creating futures for our target employees.
Brian McConnell, Managing Director at Wellington Consulting Group supports Project Get Reel
Who are we?

We are GenesisXD, a group of creative professionals and passionate social innovators. We are determined to resolve this massive, neglected environmental issue and create jobs for people with barriers to employment.
Our last award-winning social enterprise, KLINK Coffee, was recognized for its social impact. With Project Get Reel we are bringing that success to the next level.

The funds raised will be used to get this project off the ground. We need your support for the basics. That means funding for costs associated with initial set up and hiring.  Our $25,000 figure was carefully calculated by an experienced financial analyst who factored in the set-up costs and support necessary for this project succeed through early-stage development.
By the way, the more you support Project Get Reel the more workers we can hire.
Project backers will receive incentives that include workshop tours, a limited edition special postcard, public acknowledgment and even advertising opportunities, subject to level of contribution.
Reel on a roll.
Once we start re-purposing reclaimable VHS
material, we’re on our way to a sustainable business. We’re also committed to
giving back. When Project Get Reel becomes a profitable business, we will use 50 per cent of our net profits to invest in new social enterprise projects. That way, we
keep the social good reel going.
The nitty gritty:
Once VHS materials are broken down by Project Get Reel employees, they can be recycled. Far away from any landfills.
Alejandra, client of Learning Enrichment Foundation.
So much more than just a job.

Project Get Reel is the first of its kind. It exists within Toronto’s Learning Enrichment Foundation (LEF)—a west end hub for social enrichment and community engagement. There, our employees have access to a variety of resources, such as English language training, employment services and childcare. These services can be instrumental in helping individuals break through the cycle of unemployment.

With your support, we can help community members facing barriers to employment join an enriching and rewarding environmental initiative. The impact will be huge. Having a job significantly contributes to a person's happiness and well-being. And this project will change Toronto's recycling landscape by significantly reducing the amount of recyclable material going into landfills.
Join the movement. We're counting on you.

We invite you to be our allies in tackling this unresolved environmental challenge. Support Project Get Reel for both environmental and social good. We have prepared different perks for different levels of support.

If you are as passionate about this social mission as we are, please spread the word to your friends and family! Project Get Reel has a long-term social-environmental impact and it is critical that we share its value with as many people as possible.
Thank you for taking time to read about this groundbreaking initiative. We are excited to watch it thrive!
Please stay in touch. Follow us on:
•  Facebook
•  Twitter
• Email us at  projectgetreel@gmail.com
Yuliana, client of Learning Enrichment Foundation.

Help us Celebrate our Rivers!

Wellington Water Watchers is excited to announce that we are the new host organization of the annual 2Rivers Festival! From June 9th - 14th, the 2 Rivers Festival will be hosting free river-related events that bring together organizations across the region with community members to celebrate the Speed and Eramosa Rivers that flow through the city of Guelph.

We invite you to join us in a wide variety of free activities - everything from canoeing, kayaking, hiking and cycling, to river restoration and celebration, and a Town Hall discussion about merging with the Ontario Greenbelt. The larger objective of the 2Rivers Festival is to get citizens
column5:
>connected with our waters and to inspire a vision for our river corridors moving forward.

Please consider donating some money to Wellington Water Watchers so that we can continue to host this amazing festival that celebrates one of our most important resources!

Here are the events we have scheduled for this year's festival. You can see a full description on our website at http://www.2riversfestival.org/2015-events

*Thursday June 9th*

*Wednesday June 10th*

*Thursday June 11th*

*Friday June 12th*
column33: >Old-Growth Forest Project Bioblitz - 1:00pm to 3:00pm

*Sunday June 14th*
column47: Other River Critters - 12:00pm to 1:00pm

We hope that you can join us in celebrating our rivers in Guelph and will consider making a donation to help support the festival! You can learn more

about the 2Rivers Festival at http://www.2riversfestival.org/ and Wellington Water Watchers at http://wellingtonwaterwatchers.ca

","Help us Celebrate our Rivers!Wellington Water Watchers is excited to announce that we are the new host organization of the annual 2Rivers Festival! From June 9th - 14th, the 2 Rivers Festival will be hosting free river-related events that bring together organizations across the region with community members to celebrate the Speed and Eramosa Rivers that flow through the city of Guelph.We invite you to join us in a wide variety of free activities - everything from canoeing, kayaking, hiking and cycling, to river restoration and celebration, and a Town Hall discussion about merging with the Ontario Greenbelt. The larger objective of the 2Rivers Festival is to get citizens connected with our waters and to inspire a vision for our river corridors moving forward.Please consider donating some money to Wellington Water Watchers so that we can continue to host this amazing festival that celebrates one of our most important resources!Here are the events we have scheduled for this year's festival. You can see a full description on our website at http://www.2riversfestival.org/2015-events*Thursday June 9th*Paddle the Eramosa - 6:00pm to 8:30pm*Wednesday June 10th*Eramosa River Hike - 6:30pm to 8:30pmCreatures and Features of the Creek - 7:00pm to 8:30pm*Thursday June 11th*Growing the Greenbelt: Guelph Town Hall - 6:00pm to 9:00pm*Friday June 12th*2Rivers Celebration - 6:00pm to 11:00pm*Saturday June 13th*2Rivers Annual Cleanup - 9:00am to 12:00pmOld-Growth Forest Project Bioblitz - 1:00pm to 3:00pmRiverside Cycling & A Pint - 2:00pm to 4:00pm*Sunday June 14th*Two Rivers Hike - 9:00am to 12:30pmCatching Crayfish & Other River Critters - 12:00pm to 1:00pmSpeed River Heritage Hike - 1:00pm to 3:00pmWe hope that you can join us in celebrating our rivers in Guelph and will consider making a donation to help support the festival! You can learn moreabout the 2Rivers Festival at http://www.2riversfestival.org/ and Wellington Water Watchers at http://wellingtonwaterwatchers.ca",0.0,0,"3 Campaigns

Short Story
A farm for you to run away  from hectic life schedule to the harmonious
nature where everything progress in rhythmic sequence.  Stay with
us few days away from the haste of the present life and enjoy the countryside
lifestyle and cuisine made from naturally grown vegetables, poultry and milk
produced in our farm. Animals and birds grows free range  in a natural way.
A sustainable ecosystem with
almost zero input  where varied types of
plants, animals, birds, fish and other aquatic flora and fauna are grown together
and each process waste is made an input for another eg... leafs and stems of crops
after harvest becomes feed for cows and in turn their excreta becomes manure
for plants.
Practical training sessions to make urban population attain
sustainable living through Kitchen gardening and to reduce carbon foot print and food wastage while transporting it from far
away farm lands. Training session include basic farming steps
like potting soil preparation to latest high density planting methodologies like
vertical farming, automated drip irrigation, vermicomposting and in house preparation
of pest repellents  and growth promoters
like fish amino acid, egg amino acid etc.
I’m a web developer and a passionate kitchen gardener. Many of my friends longed to have a kitchen garden but could not make it happen due to time/ space constrains.

As a solution for their problem weekend farming initiative was started on 2013 December, where they could do farming  collectively in a plot. A spiritual organisation in Kerala provided land for cultivation. While the members did the farming activities on weekends
column2: the plants were watered and taken care of on weekdays by an employee.  The expenses and the produce were equally split amidst the members.

column1: We need your support  to establish an integrated farm in an acre land with cottages,  drip irrigation system, bio-digester, pond and animal shelters. Adjoining plots will be taken on long term lease for doing organic agriculture.

We will be thankful that you contributed to make a sustainable ecosystem where you could live closer to nature accentuating your inner senses. You will feel natures harmony, enjoy fresh air, hear the murmurings of nature, an opportunity to have cultural and social exchanges with open minded  countryside people.  You can have some local delicacies made from farm fresh organic produce of our farm.
Our farm will become a venue for community building for the locals and the tourists could experience traditional Indian lifestyle.
Take a break from your techno crippled life amidst mobiles, computers,
gadgets and what not....
On weekends and holidays toil  in countryside fields
stresses and frustrations.  Hear the mother
nature’s murmurings. Learn the basics of sustainable living. Enjoy countryside cuisine
cooked  using our farm fresh vegetables  and naturally grown chicken, eggs and fish.
<ul>
• Yield from organic cultivation might be less than conventional farming.
• More land is needed for the grazing heard and the free range poultry might destroy the yield.
Other Ways You Can Help
Join our  Weekend Farming group to get help and help
others to attain a sustainable living.
Start community farming in your
neighbourhood and make it a venue for socialising and donate the excess produce
to the needy.
Let’s do it!!

column8:
>

Perennials for Pollinators brings you a selection of plants that are the preferred flowers of Monarch Butterflies and Honey Bees. They are colorful, easy to grow, pesticide-free, and beautiful in any landscape.
column9:
>

The rapid decline in the populations of our Honey Bees and Monarch Butterflies is often in the media and the reality is devastating. Loss of habitat, pesticide use, disease and stress are contributing factors in their struggle to survive.

We all have this information and we care, but can we help? Yes! 

We can plant perennial plants for pollinators! Our plants are field grown without neonicotinoids and other pesticides. Field grown plants are strong and healthy, and require less water and fertilizer than those grown in conventional, non-recyclable plastic nursery pots. Our overall process reduces the carbon footprint typically related to the horticulture industry. Our plants are primarily sold and shipped bare-root or in 4"" bio-degradable pots. They are available online until June 1, by phone, and at the Farmer's Markets in Stillwater and Bayport MN.
column13:
/>

I'm Bonnie Stone (left), a professional gardener and the owner of Stone Style Gardens &
column14: Bouquets which is the parent company of Perennials for Pollinators. I have been in the Horticultural industry since 2003 and a self-employed designer and Professional Gardener since 2007. I'm am MNLA Certified Professional with a Landscape Specialty, a member of the Minnesota State Horticultural Society, and licensed by the Minnesota Department of Agriculture. Through my time in gardens over the past 12 years I have seen first hand the decline in our pollinators, particularly our Monarchs and our Honey Bees. I believe strongly in improving the circumstances and opportunities for our pollinators through pesticide-free locally field grown perennials necessary for their survival.

column1: <div>

My daughter Suzie (right) has loved gardening since she was old enough to walk. Her favorite flowers have always been the perennials and annuals that attract butterflies, and she now cares her own butterfly and vegetable gardens. She has had a brain injury since age 4 and has benefited from gardening in many ways. Now 17, she loves to see the honey bees in her vegie garden and the butterflies come and visit. She is excited to prepare the perennials for new homes, and to participate in the Farmer's Market! She hand packs all of our Clover Seed Bears in the ""Perks"" section of the campaign.

column5: >Our plants are FABULOUS and here's why
column6: they are started in terracotta or biodegradable coir pots. Coir is made from coconut husks. From there they are transferred to our growing field and raised pesticide-free and without chemical sprays of any kind.  Field grown perennials are strong and healthy because their roots have room to spread out. They require less water and fertilizer than those grown in nursery pots because their nutrients are drawn from the soil. This process, combined with eliminating the use of plastic non-recyclable nursery pots, significantly reduces our carbon footprint.
column18:
/>

We recognize that the chemical companies have done an excellent job convincing us that White Clover is a weed. White clover not only contributes nitrogen to our lawns and decreases the need for fertilizer, it is a primary food source for honey bees. The chemical companies also encourage eliminating stinging insects from your yard. All stinging insects are not ""bees"". Honey bees strongly prefer flowers to people, and have no interest in a picnic. Hornets and wasps on the other hand, are very aggressive and have unfortunately caused a reputation that honey bees don't deserve. We all have room in our yards for a bee friendly area, whether it's in a container or a corner of the lawn around a fence post.
column19: >Dutch White Clover
column23: >Habitat for our Monarchs has also reduced dramatically. We promote offering Asclepias in every landscape. Asclepias, commonly known as Milkweed is THE host plant for Monarch Butterflies. The butterflies lay one egg per plant and the caterpillars eat the leaves. They then visit the blooms for nourishment.
column33:
/>

In addition to these, we offer a variety of gorgeous blooming plants that are naturally disease resistant, deer resistant, and are the preferred food source of honey bees and butterflies!
column34:
>What is our investment so far?

We have done the necessary and unexciting administrative stuff including registration, licensing, insurance, and website. We have purchased plants and seeds that are sourced from non-GMO and organic growers, and organic soil for getting them started. We bring a personal touch to our plants by offering a gentle, chemical free start in terracotta or bio-degradable pots before they move to the field. The land space and terra cotta have been generously donated!
column39: >How will we spend the money we are asking for?

Field grown plants are strong and healthy, and require less water and fertilizer than those grown in conventional, non-recyclable plastic nursery pots. Our overall process reduces the carbon footprint typically related to the horticulture industry. Our plants are primarily sold and shipped bare-root or in 4"" bio-degradable pots. They are available online until June 1, by phone, and at the Farmer's Markets in Stillwater and Bayport MN.Who We Are                                               I'm Bonnie Stone (left), a professional gardener and the owner of Stone Style Gardens & Bouquets which is the parent company of Perennials for Pollinators. I have been in the Horticultural industry since 2003 and a self-employed designer and Professional Gardener since 2007. I'm am MNLA Certified Professional with a Landscape Specialty, a member of the Minnesota State Horticultural Society, and licensed by the Minnesota Department of Agriculture. Through my time in gardens over the past 12 years I have seen first hand the decline in our pollinators, particularly our Monarchs and our Honey Bees. Why We're Awesome

column2: they are started in terracotta or biodegradable coir pots. Coir is made from coconut husks. From there they are transferred to our growing field and raised pesticide-free and without chemical sprays of any kind.  Field grown perennials are strong and healthy because their roots have room to spread out. They require less water and fertilizer than those grown in nursery pots because their nutrients are drawn from the soil. This process, combined with eliminating the use of plastic non-recyclable nursery pots, significantly reduces our carbon footprint.            We recognize that the chemical companies have done an excellent job convincing us that White Clover is a weed. White clover not only contributes nitrogen to our lawns and decreases the need for fertilizer, it is a primary food source for honey bees. The chemical companies also encourage eliminating stinging insects from your yard. All stinging insects are not ""bees"". Honey bees strongly prefer flowers to people, and have no interest in a picnic. Hornets and wasps on the other hand, are very aggressive and have unfortunately caused a reputation that honey bees don't deserve. We all have room in our yards for a bee friendly area, whether it's in a container or a corner of the lawn around a fence post.Dutch White Clover                                                       Habitat for our Monarchs has also reduced dramatically. We promote offering Asclepias in every landscape. Asclepias, commonly known as Milkweed is THE host plant for Monarch Butterflies. The butterflies lay one egg per plant and the caterpillars eat the leaves. They then visit the blooms for nourishment.                                        Asclepias Tuberosa 'Butterfly Weed'                                                      In addition to these, we offer a variety of gorgeous blooming plants that are naturally disease resistant, deer resistant, and are the preferred food source of honey bees and butterflies!What is our investment so far?We have done the necessary and unexciting administrative stuff including registration, licensing, insurance, and website. We have purchased plants and seeds that are sourced from non-GMO and organic growers, and organic soil for getting them started. We bring a personal touch to our plants by offering a gentle, chemical free start in terracotta or bio-degradable pots before they move to the field. The land space and terra cotta have been generously donated!                           How will we spend the money we are asking for?

Project Outcomes -
<ul>
<li>
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
will gain a sense of security knowing that they could produce their own food,
water, and energy in any setting, rural or urban.
<li>
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
will benefit from the addition of Eco-tourism to their repertoire of
attractions.
<li><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
will benefit from nutrient-dense meals which will enhance their physical
and mental health.
<li><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
will enjoy the interaction with the host family and benefit from the security
of having a trusted tour guide.
<li><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
can appreciate ideas that bring hope in tackling issues like Peak Oil, Climate
Change, Deforestation and Population Growth.
<div>
Would you like to experience what it's like to live on a sustainable family homestead, with organic food, renewable energy, clean water, and fun, un-plugged activities?
Would you like to have hope that an abundant, happy and comfortable life is possible while enjoying amazing food and optimal health?

Rancho Relaxo Resort is one of Alberta's first eco-tourism destination resorts and will feature several renewable energy systems, organic food production, water harvest, food storage, off-grid log cabins, and a plethora of other ideas that help families move towards self-sufficiency, food security, and healthy communities.

This beautiful five-acre permaculture demonstration farm has the potential to host events, workshops, and courses, while offering affordable, comfortable, all-inclusive accommodations.  The resort creates a friendly, comfortable atmosphere that enhances social interaction, connections with the natural world, and confidence in themselves as an informed consumer.

Our working permaculture farm offers many opportunities for 'hands-on' learning, ranging from egg collection to soil building.  We encourage guests to get involved, share ideas, and get excited about new skills, all while enjoying the beautiful mountain views, forest trails, and organic gardens.

Delicious, wholesome meals will be supplied using only the highest quality ingredients available, will be cooked from scratch, and prepared fresh every day.  Healthy food is the key to healthy people.
To round out the day, who could resist a star-filled sky with guitars around the campfire?  The perfect way to unplug!
Log cabins feature passive solar design and high-efficiency insulation.
The builders of this farm are Jeff &
column2: Juli Gillies, a couple who are passionate about health, happiness, and community.  They believe that healthy food, a connection to the natural environment, and a community of like-minded people are they keys to ensuring success and happiness.  They want to share this experience with others and promote a greener way of living that can spread hope around the world.

column1: Jeff grew up on a farm in Alberta, Canada, and wanted to pursue farming as a career, but was advised to leave the agriculture industry by several of his mentors, saying it was no longer economically viable to be a farmer.  After obtaining a Soil Science degree from the University of Alberta, Jeff entered the oilfield reclamation business for the next 15 years.  He was uneasy about the volatility of the Oil &
column2: Gas industry and hated being laid off for months at a time whenever oil prices crashed.  After meeting Juli and settling down outside of Rocky Mountain House, they had children and were wondering how they could best prepare those kids for a very uncertain future.

column1: Permaculture was introduced to them by a friend, and four years later, they had created a business called Taimi Soil Projects (www.TaimiSoilProjects.ca) which specializes in helping families make the transition to a healthy, sustainable lifestyle through composting, organic food, and renewable energy.
Today Jeff &
column2: Juli are here to show how a design system like permaculture can be used to create not only healthy food and healthy people, but healthy communities as well.

column1: Help us put the finishing touches on Rancho Relaxo Resort, where we grow and produce sustainable ideas, and share them with the world.

column2: >        Solar water heating is the most efficient form of renewable energy.

column1: <div><span style=""font-weight: normal
<h3>What We Need &amp
<div>Jeff &amp
column2: Juli have already spent the last five years and their life savings to build two-thirds of the farm and need your help to complete the last legs of the project.

column1: We need to:
<div><ul>
• Add more trees to our Food Forest to demonstrate the many different types of fruit that will grow in our climate: $4,800
• Dig a pond to provide a beach area and wetland that also produces food, and stores water for the gardens and fruit trees: $4,200
• Finish construction of our solar water-heating system for the house, which demonstrates the most efficient type of solar energy collection: $21,000

• Renovate our education centre which will be used to host classes on organic farming, compost, renewable energy, water harvest and food preservation.  We will also add rooms for low-cost dorm accommodations for budget-conscious visitors, as we want these ideas to be accessible to everyone: $74,600
• Finish construction of the walk-in Hill Freezer that keeps storage food frozen year-round without fossil fuel energy inputs: $14,600
• Finish the energy-efficient Log Cabins for families to stay in: $172,000

• Add solar electric and solar water heating onto the cabins to provide electricity, heat, and shower water for guests, combined with a solar heated three-season greenhouse for organic food production: $116,000
• Complete construction of our root cellar which will provide optimal storage conditions for different types of garden foods: $7,200
• Upgrade our www.RanchoRelaxoResort.ca website to spread the ideas: $5,000
<div>
Juli showing the solar air heater made from 240 pop &amp
Perks include:
<div><ul>
• An email copy of our recipe for fertile garden soil, the Soil Building Toolbox
• A fruit tree planted in your name within our Food Forest.

• An email copy of our Rancho Relaxo Business Plan so you can start your own sustainable farm tourism destination.  The more of these businesses that exist, the greater the interest will be to switch to a sustainable lifestyle!  There's no such thing as competition when it comes to tourism ventures that benefit the land.  We can all help each other out.
<div><ul>
• A dinner party at Rancho Relaxo Resort with live music and outdoor campfire
• A free weekend stay at the farm to experience great food, like-minded people, and a connection with nature.
• Recognition of your donation on our Sponsor Appreciation Board which identifies all the people and companies that are working with us to promote change through development of sustainable ideas.
Solar electric panels with the first log cabin under construction.

The Impact

The way we live on this earth is causing problems, and unless we learn to live in balance with natural systems, we are going to continue to cause more problems.

By allowing people to 'test-drive the lifestyle' while learning about alternative food and energy systems, we are increasing their confidence in making real changes to the way they live.  This benefits individuals, families and communities by promoting health, happiness and hope.

So far we have hosted dozens of guests from all over the world over the past four years through Wwoof.ca.  Their experiences here have proven to be life-changing, and they often leave with a new positive outlook on life.  We have also given tours to hundreds of interested people who are often inspired to go home and create their own solar panels, gardens, composters, and farm projects.  The impact has already begun.

We would like to offer this experience to more families and promote change on a larger scale.  Please help us gain the capacity to accommodate more people, and offer mind-blowing experiences to them all!
Risks &

One of the challenges we face is being able to reach people who are looking for change and interested in learning about new ways of living.  Many of these people are on the other side of the Canada, or on the other side of the world.  A detailed contemporary website will help us find people who would benefit from this experience.
Other Ways You Can Help

If your situation does not allow you to contribute, it would sure help us out if you could pass on the idea to others.  Please share our campaign with your friends using Indiegogo share tools, or suggest to them that they come and stay with us at Rancho Relaxo Resort.
Beautiful sunsets are guaranteed when you're staying in our tipi.

Short Summary
Would you like to experience what it's like to live on a sustainable family homestead, with organic food, renewable energy, clean water, and fun, un-plugged activities?
Would you like to have hope that an abundant, happy and comfortable life is possible while enjoying amazing food and optimal health?

Rancho Relaxo Resort is one of Alberta's first eco-tourism destination resorts and will feature several renewable energy systems, organic food production, water harvest, food storage, off-grid log cabins, and a plethora of other ideas that help families move towards self-sufficiency, food security, and healthy communities.

This beautiful five-acre permaculture demonstration farm has the potential to host events, workshops, and courses, while offering affordable, comfortable, all-inclusive accommodations.  The resort creates a friendly, comfortable atmosphere that enhances social interaction, connections with the natural world, and confidence in themselves as an informed consumer.

Our working permaculture farm offers many opportunities for 'hands-on' learning, ranging from egg collection to soil building.  We encourage guests to get involved, share ideas, and get excited about new skills, all while enjoying the beautiful mountain views, forest trails, and organic gardens.

Delicious, wholesome meals will be supplied using only the highest quality ingredients available, will be cooked from scratch, and prepared fresh every day.  Healthy food is the key to healthy people.
To round out the day, who could resist a star-filled sky with guitars around the campfire?  The perfect way to unplug!
Log cabins feature passive solar design and high-efficiency insulation.

The builders of this farm are Jeff & Juli Gillies, a couple who are passionate about health, happiness, and community.  They believe that healthy food, a connection to the natural environment, and a community of like-minded people are they keys to ensuring success and happiness.  They want to share this experience with others and promote a greener way of living that can spread hope around the world.

Jeff grew up on a farm in Alberta, Canada, and wanted to pursue farming as a career, but was advised to leave the agriculture industry by several of his mentors, saying it was no longer economically viable to be a farmer.  After obtaining a Soil Science degree from the University of Alberta, Jeff entered the oilfield reclamation business for the next 15 years.  He was uneasy about the volatility of the Oil & Gas industry and hated being laid off for months at a time whenever oil prices crashed.  After meeting Juli and settling down outside of Rocky Mountain House, they had children and were wondering how they could best prepare those kids for a very uncertain future.

Permaculture was introduced to them by a friend, and four years later, they had created a business called Taimi Soil Projects (www.TaimiSoilProjects.ca) which specializes in helping families make the transition to a healthy, sustainable lifestyle through composting, organic food, and renewable energy.
Today Jeff & Juli are here to show how a design system like permaculture can be used to create not only healthy food and healthy people, but healthy communities as well.
Help us put the finishing touches on Rancho Relaxo Resort, where we grow and produce sustainable ideas, and share them with the world.
Solar water heating is the most efficient form of renewable energy.
What We Need & What You Get
Jeff & Juli have already spent the last five years and their life savings to build two-thirds of the farm and need your help to complete the last legs of the project.
We need to:
Add more trees to our Food Forest to demonstrate the many different types of fruit that will grow in our climate: $4,800
Dig a pond to provide a beach area and wetland that also produces food, and stores water for the gardens and fruit trees: $4,200
Finish construction of our solar water-heating system for the house, which demonstrates the most efficient type of solar energy collection: $21,000

Renovate our education centre which will be used to host classes on organic farming, compost, renewable energy, water harvest and food preservation.  We will also add rooms for low-cost dorm accommodations for budget-conscious visitors, as we want these ideas to be accessible to everyone: $74,600
Finish construction of the walk-in Hill Freezer that keeps storage food frozen year-round without fossil fuel energy inputs: $14,600
Finish the energy-efficient Log Cabins for families to stay in: $172,000

Add solar electric and solar water heating onto the cabins to provide electricity, heat, and shower water for guests, combined with a solar heated three-season greenhouse for organic food production: $116,000
Complete construction of our root cellar which will provide optimal storage conditions for different types of garden foods: $7,200
Upgrade our www.RanchoRelaxoResort.ca website to spread the ideas: $5,000
Juli showing the solar air heater made from 240 pop & beer cans.  Free heat!
Perks include:
An email copy of our recipe for fertile garden soil, the Soil Building Toolbox
A fruit tree planted in your name within our Food Forest.

An email copy of our Rancho Relaxo Business Plan so you can start your own sustainable farm tourism destination.  The more of these businesses that exist, the greater the interest will be to switch to a sustainable lifestyle!  There's no such thing as competition when it comes to tourism ventures that benefit the land.  We can all help each other out.
A dinner party at Rancho Relaxo Resort with live music and outdoor campfire
A free weekend stay at the farm to experience great food, like-minded people, and a connection with nature.
Recognition of your donation on our Sponsor Appreciation Board which identifies all the people and companies that are working with us to promote change through development of sustainable ideas.
Solar electric panels with the first log cabin under construction.
The Impact The way we live on this earth is causing problems, and unless we learn to live in balance with natural systems, we are going to continue to cause more problems.

By allowing people to 'test-drive the lifestyle' while learning about alternative food and energy systems, we are increasing their confidence in making real changes to the way they live.  This benefits individuals, families and communities by promoting health, happiness and hope.

So far we have hosted dozens of guests from all over the world over the past four years through Wwoof.ca.  Their experiences here have proven to be life-changing, and they often leave with a new positive outlook on life.  We have also given tours to hundreds of interested people who are often inspired to go home and create their own solar panels, gardens, composters, and farm projects.  The impact has already begun.

We would like to offer this experience to more families and promote change on a larger scale.  Please help us gain the capacity to accommodate more people, and offer mind-blowing experiences to them all!
Risks & Challenges

One of the challenges we face is being able to reach people who are looking for change and interested in learning about new ways of living.  Many of these people are on the other side of the Canada, or on the other side of the world.  A detailed contemporary website will help us find people who would benefit from this experience.
Other Ways You Can Help

If your situation does not allow you to contribute, it would sure help us out if you could pass on the idea to others.  Please share our campaign with your friends using Indiegogo share tools, or suggest to them that they come and stay with us at Rancho Relaxo Resort.
Beautiful sunsets are guaranteed when you're staying in our tipi.",7.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Rocky Mountain House, Canada",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/rancho-relaxo-sustainable-farm/pica

The Planned Upgrade

Moosewood Nature Center has been educating and inspiring nature enthusiasts of all ages for over a decade. Unfortunately, our building is in need of a lot of repairs. We also have some exciting upgrades that will make our center an even better place to visit! We plan to complete phase 1 of the repairs and upgrades this spring. This includes a new floor in our main room, patching and painting the walls and ceiling, replacing a damaged window,  updating some displays and installing an interactive iPad kiosk, and building an amazing new habitat for our turtles. We have skilled volunteers willing to donate all of the labor involved in these projects. All we need now is the funding to cover material costs. Below is a detailed description of the work that needs to be done.


The New Turtle Habitat

We have 7 live turtles at our center. One red-eared slider, one painted turtle, four box turtles, and a snapping turtle. Currently, each type of turtle has its own tank. The new habitat will have a 220 gallon pond (already donated) for the slider and painted turtles and a large land area around the pond for the box turtles. The snapping turtle will be kept separate in a very large aquarium. The new habitat will have live plants in the pond and on the land to make it more like their natural environment. (See the picture below for a drawing of the proposed new habitat) 

Before                                                                                                                                           After
column9:
>

Here's a top view drawing of the plan.
Yes, the driftwood basking platforms look like bacon.
We promise that no pigs will be harmed in the making of this habitat!
column11:
/>


Interactive Kiosk and Updated Displays

We are very excited to be installing an interactive IPad kiosk in our main room. It will contain information about our center, Presque Isle, local wildlife, the bog walk, our live animals, and our featured displays. This will be updated regularly with our seasonal displays. (I.e. Live monarch butterfly station) We will also be setting up new displays with our mounted animals, animal furs, skeletons, etc. As much as possible, these new displays will be hands-on. 


The New Floor

The flooring in our main room is very old commercial carpeting. It is stained and ripped and needs to be replaced. Due to the difficulty involved in keeping carpet clean in a nature center we have found a much better alternative.  It is an environmentally friendly and virtually indestructible floor that is painted right over the concrete. It is slip resistant and looks very nice when finished. (See the sample picture below) 

Sienna Sunset
column13:
/>


Patching and painting the walls and ceiling

This part of the project is pretty straightforward. We have some minor patching to do on the walls. The ceiling and walls are both in need of painting. (See the samples below for our new color scheme)

Color Scheme
column20:
/>


Replacing the broken window

One of the windows in our main room is cracked.  We will be ordering a replacement window and having it installed by a volunteer.

column1:
Show Me the Money!

Here's the breakdown of where the funds will go:

Turtle Habitat: $850
Walls and Ceiling: $600
New Floor: $700
Window: $150
Ipad kiosk and new displays: $960
Indiegogo and payment processing fees: $240
Total: $3500

Can't Donate Money But Want to Help?

Here are some other ways to make this project happen:
• Use Indiegogo's sharing options to share this campaign with your friends, family, workmates, heck, even people you don't like, via Facebook, Twitter, Email, etc.
• Help generate excitement for this campaign by talking about it.
• Volunteer to help with the work. (You don't even need a special skill) Then you can look at the finished product and say, ""I did that!"" What better perk could there be?

Future Plans

Any funding we receive will go towards the next phase of our project. This includes: Replacing the floor in the event room, painting the event room, and repairing some damage to our roof. We also have plans for our pond area this summer including an observation tower, a viewing deck and boardwalk around the pond, and planting of native trees and flowers.
We are very excited about the good things happening at Moosewood and we hope you will support us!

column9:
>Who We Are

My name is Farah Brunache and I have over ten years combined experience  in community service initiatives and I want to bring Electric Feel to your local neighborhood!

Electric Feel is using the Indie GoGo platform to raise working capital to purchase equipment to install a charging location in addition to bringing awareness to the need of charging stations for non-homeowners.

I decided to start this business a few months ago. I currently own an electric vehicle. And the first year and a half I resided in an apartment building that provided charging stations. However, outside of this it was difficult in finding charging stations. In addition, once I moved out of the building, I no longer had reliable areas to charge my vehicle – meaning I would have to get rid of my current vehicle and instead get a gasoline powered vehicle.

I realized that there are many customers like me in the DC metro who have these types of vehicles even though they are renting their homes. My customers are individuals and families who want to improve sustainability by using alternative fuel and who do not have homes where they can park and charge their vehicles.

Your contributions will directly impact the ability to open an electric vehicle charging station in the Washington DC metro area. You will also provide the opportunity for hundreds of car buyers to keep their electric vehicles and continue to make an impact on the environment.


What We Are About

In 1885, an entrepreneur named S.F. Bowser had an idea. He set up a kerosene pump outside of a grocery store in Fort Wayne, Indiana. His idea evolved into a gasoline pump, and soon there were pumps across the nation to service the growing population of car owners.

Now it’s 2015 and Farah Brunache (an honored Emerging Global Entrepreneur) has the same idea but for electric cars. She is working with property managers around the Washington DC area to set up electric car charging stations. Already more than 7,000 people own electric cars in our area, and the number grows every year.

Farah’s vision is to build 200 stations in properties around the region. She knows this infrastructure will reduce carbon pollution in area. She is one person with a vision, and she needs your contribution.

In Washington DC, there are fewer than 100 openly public charging stations - most in central downtown. There are 10 times more gas stations in the same area.

“My intention is for Electric Feel to become like gas stations for electric vehicles,” says Brunache. “It needs to be just as convenient to own an electric car, while helping people save lots of money on fuel costs.”

Donate today to help set up a car charging station and you’ll help Farah build momentum towards this new future!

What We Need &
column10:
What You’ll Get

Four our upcoming station it costs $10,000 to set up an electric car charging station. That includes purchasing the equipment, working with the utility to connect to the grid, and rent for the parking space for the first six months. Beyond that, the revenue from customers will pay for ongoing expenses.

Electric Feel stands out from other charging station providers by promising a higher level of reliability. Other types of  charging stations can be broken for weeks. Electric Feel partners with an electrician to provide quick fixes to broken stations.

When you donate, you get two weeks, one month or two months of unlimited charging. This is great news for electric vehicle owners! You can also give this benefit to a friend who owns an electric vehicle.

If you donate earlier in the campaign, you get more charging for a lower donation - so donate today!

If you don’t yet own an electric vehicle, you can show your support for the future with fewer carbon emissions. We’ll send you this bumper sticker so you can tell the world that you are looking forward to a world where owning an electric car is just as convenient as a gas guzzler.


Bumper Sticker Option #1 - Non-EV Driver Option



Bumper Sticker Option # 2 - Anyone Can Rock this Option!



Please help spread the word about our campaign and bring more electric car charging stations to our region! Share our campaign on Facebook (/electricfeelco), Twitter (@efeelchargers) and LinkedIn!

Afforestation and
development of region-specific farming practices in Nepal, production of
energy-saving solar cookers for the rural population in Eritrea, a human rights
lawyer for the victims of the nuclear industry in Russia, establishing the
first conservation reserve to protect amphibians in Guatemala: These exemplary
projects of the winners of the most important environmental awards stand for a
world worth living in. A<span>nimal rights activist,
environmental lawyer, grassroots activist, human rights activist,
scientist or journalist: The laureates are planning future designs for a livable world and put these into action. They were
honored with one or more of the major environmental awards for their innovative

and practical solutions and theiroften lifelong commitment.

some examples · Projects of the Laureates


Every spring, the environmental
award winners from more than 40 nations meet in Freiburg, Germany, for the
International Convention of Environmental Laureates"". Here they come
up with new projects, discuss current environmental issues and future
developments, motivate students and pupils in personal conversations with their
experience, inspire each other and give each other strength for their tireless
efforts.
Laureates: Idols and role models –
unfortunately, often under pressure
Actually, these people should be
global idols and role models, but despite being awarded a prestigious
international prize many of the winners work in isolation. They are often<span> subject to political pressure, threats and financial
reprisals. For these outstanding activists, the Freiburg Convention is the world's
only platform for professional and personal interdisciplinary exchange, for the
planning of joint action and the development of new ideas.
Achievements of
the Freiburg Convention – joint actions of the laureates
<span>After three years of realization, the Freiburg
Convention can manifest excellent achievements: New bilateral and multilateral
environmental protection projects have emerged worldwide, institutional funds
and support could be acquired from the industry and mutual professional,
technical and personal support could be provided. Initiated by the European
Environment Foundation, the winners already made three ""Calls for
Actions"" for solutions to urgent environmental problems. The Freiburg
Convention enabled the winners for the first time to speak as a strong group
with one voice:

- September 15, 2014: Laureates 2014 Declaration on Climate Change

-

March 15, 2013: Freiburg Call for Action to policy makers and pioneers

- March 10, 2012: The
Declaration on Rio + 20

Click here for the Calls for Actions!


Why

do the laureates need your help?
 Many of the laureates from
developing and emerging countries are not in a position to afford the travel
expenses to the Freiburg Convention
Environment Foundation – as organizer of the Convention – covers the costs for
accommodation and food. Especially for the participants from developing
countries it is important to integrate into an international network which
promotes bilateral cooperation, the multiplication of individual successes, the
solidarity spirit of the winners among themselves and thus their strength as
interest group, and which provides public attention to their valuable work. The
more international contacts and the greater the public awareness – the greater

the protection for winners under reprisal or threat.

How your donation counts:



How
your donation can make a difference
Your donation allows the winners to travel to Freiburg and thus the important
access to the international community. The European Environment Foundation
manages the donations and grants the travel allowances on a fixed scale to
those laureates whose <span>need for support is
evident. The more donations we receive from you, the more winners we can enable
to participate in the convention. If the winners from all the continents of the
world draw on one string with their energy and their good ideas, then they can
realize many more projects successfully and be role models for a new generation
of environmental pioneers around the world.
