0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><h3 style=""text-align: center
column4:
>A unique natural treasure is in danger

Colombia hosts the World’s greatest bird biodiversity and not many people know it. This country’s birds represent a remarkable gift to humanity and we want to help preserve and protect them as peace is being built in our country. We are a group of people who love birds
column5: we work for their conservation and educate new generations about their role in maintaining life on our planet.
column6:
>A collaborative project

In order to celebrate and help conserve the 1900 species of birds found in Colombia, we have created an album and sticker collection composed of photographs of Colombian birds. This is the first editorial product dedicated to educating (through the use of simple language) the public about the birds found in Colombia, the country of the birds. The collection combines technology, photography and educational tools to discover and learn about Colombia’s unique riches.

A group of 85 photographers have participated in the album, allowing us to use their most beautiful bird photographs as stickers in the collection. These will be distributed throughout Colombia and other countries, generating resources to support the work of 25 Colombian organizations dedicated to bird conservation, environmental education and the development of birding tourism. 

         

Over the last two years we have been working hard to consolidate a team of designers, scientists, ecologists, birding tourism specialists, environmental educators and audio-visual producers, who have lent their support to the development and production of the collection. The album is very nearly ready and with your support it will be enjoyed by thousands in a printed format (both in English and Spanish).
column7:
>Birds, an opportunity to build peace

Colombia is currently building peace and birds are a part of it. With the recent signing of the peace deal, Colombia is preparing to open its doors to thousands of visitors from all over the world hoping to enjoy its exceptional bird diversity. In the world of birds there are many opportunities for young people who live in biodiversity hotspots to get involved. With this album we want to help them discover the opportunities that birding tourism brings. The youngsters won’t carry guns, but photo cameras, binoculars and the dream of a better country.
column8:
>One action, many benefits

By supporting us, you will receive one of our great rewards and in turn, we will be able to print the collection and distribute half of the print run (with no cost to them) to youngsters living in bird rich regions throughout Colombia. This will be achieved through our program “Cultura de aves, cultura de paz” (Bird culture, culture of peace), which strengthens learning processes in young people interested in birds by bringing them books and equipment, and by providing workshops with birding tourism experts aimed at creating the next generation of birdwatching guides. The collection is the focal point of this capacity building program.

The resources obtained from the other half of the print run in Colombia, and bird-related events in Europe and the United States, will be donated to 25 organizations that promote education, conservation, and the development of birding tourism in different parts of the country.

With the support of these organizations, nature tourism operators, and international artists, we have created a set of irresistible reward packages for those who support our campaign. They include tours and birdwatching expeditions to unexplored regions where you will find unique birds with your expert birding guide. We also have nine fantastic and exclusive works of art in LEGO created for this campaign by the British artist Thomas Poulsom. The rewards are completed by a beautiful and unique paper sculpture of the Archaeopteryx, produced by Colombian Artist Diana Beltrán Herrera.
column9:
>If birds win, we all win

The resources gained from this campaign will be used to cover the design and printing costs of the first print run of the collection (11.000 albums + 5.000.000 stickers). This year we will focus on bringing the collection, free of charge, to young people who live in remote and biodiversity rich areas, so that they can learn about their birds while having fun contemplating the collection. The rest of the copies will be sold in cities in order to generate the funds that will allow us to keep working and supporting the 25 organizations that are part of this project.

Besides visiting places filled with birds endemic to Colombia or having the great pieces of art we offer as rewards in your home, you will also receive a complete collection (album in English or Spanish + 400 stickers).

All funds gathered with this campaign will be invested in finishing and printing the collection. If we don’t manage to reach our goal to print the eleven thousand collections (album + stickers), we will print the number possible (depending on the funds collected) and sell them at stores, shopping malls, fairs, and bird-related events. We are also looking for support from the Colombian government in order to keep implementing our program Cultura de aves, cultura de paz, in different regions of Colombian.

We will publish videos every two weeks showing the processes we support, beautiful stories of the youngsters and Colombian birds, as well as testimonies from the collection’s users.
column11:
>Everything for the birds

By helping us print this educational editorial product, you will also be giving us the first big push to develop our program Cultura de aves, cultura de paz. With this, we will shape leaders in conservation, and future birding guides who will help develop their own regions through their work. The program includes a digital communication strategy that will result in apps for the study of birds, knowledge contests in television, and invites to bird fairs in Colombia and other countries. This whole strategy will get underway when we take the collection to young people from different parts of the country and when we begin selling the collection to bird-watchers from all over the world. We want every birder who visits Colombia to have the collection!
column12:
>Dedication to overcome challenges

We decided to dedicate our lives to the conservation of birds and to help our country become a world power in birding tourism.

The biggest challenge we face is the collection’s distribution. It will only be truly successful once the eleven thousand printed copies reach the hands of birding tourists, youngsters, families, etc… enabling us to start creating a new identity and image for Colombia through its birds and allowing us to overcome the grief and suffering of our tragic past.

To accomplish this we need to do a good job distributing the collection. This is why we have formed an alliance with official institutions, nature tourism companies, ornithological associations, hotels and international bird festivals, which will help us promote and distribute the collection in Colombia and other countries.
column13:
>Sharing makes the world a better place

Help us reach more people. If you know someone who likes birds, and travelling to see them, tell them about our campaign. We also need help reaching out to donors interested in supporting the continued development of our program Cultura de aves, cultura de paz.

You can also take advantage of the tools provided by Indiegogo to easily share. You will find these on the right hand side of the campaign’s main image.
column14:

0,"

Kiakiapaks is an environmental management social enterprise focused on providing Eco-friendly and sustainable solutions that clean our environment. For over half a decade, we have been hauling dirt.  Yes, dirt.  Clearly, what we didn’t realize was the negative impact of burning of waste at the unregulated landfills which was largely plastics in each load of “dirt”.  We were disgusted, disappointed, and aware that we needed to make a change. We realized improper waste disposal and burning is affecting the health and environment of the poorest members of society who suffer adverse health effects.  We also realized that as a result of the improper disposal of waste, our oceans currently holds 150 million tons of plastic with the sad reality that in the next 34 years our oceans will hold more plastic than fish.  Time for change.

With the knowledge that everyone contributes to plastic waste generation, we set out to develop a plastic waste management system where everyone through communication and social mobilization campaigns share in the responsibility of raising awareness on safe waste handling practices
column2:
aimed at dealing with the attitudinal problems associated with plastic waste disposal as well as the development of an inclusive system that seeks to tap into the resource value of waste plastic to tackle economic, social and environmental problems that bother on job creation, poverty reduction, girl/women empowerment and climate change.

Looking at the data coming from the African retail sector, we understand that the demand for innovative packaging solutions will be on the rise going into the future
column3:
being passionate about designing sustainable solutions that clean our environment and in a bid to encourage the retail sector to be ecologically responsible by using recycled products over virgin products, we developed KIAKIAPAKS.

KIAKIAPAKS are personalised re-usable plastic packaging that promotes business brands to your doorstep
column4:
made from high quality recycled plastic waste. Our aim is to empower women to be the force to drive our objective of reducing, re-using and recycling waste plastic material while also driving the attitudinal change necessary to solving the problems associated with plastic waste disposal.

Our objective:

column1: • To run an economically viable social enterprise
• To improve plastic waste collection process and fees to empower poor women
• To drive behavioural change through communication and social mobilization
• To apply Eco-friendly solutions to retail sector packaging problems.
• To apply e-commerce and digital solutions to penetrate and gain a sizable market share.
• Focus on the (4) four key (Gabon, Botswana, Ghana and Nigeria) developing retail markets and the entire African continent.

column2:
>In the next 5 years, we see KIAKIAPAKS expanding into paper packaging made from high quality recycled waste paper materials.

We aim to:

column1: • Creatively promote business brands with emphasis on the evolving African retail market

• Drive a communication and social mobilization strategy using our success story and the transformation stories of our GREEN ANGELS that will cause the needed attitudinal change that is required to solve the plastic waste disposal problem.
• Prolong the life span of plastic materials through reducing, re-using and recycling to reduce the demand for virgin plastic
• Reduce the amount of plastic waste materials that goes into unregulated landfills or worse gets burnt.
• Stop the uncontrolled burning of plastic which is considered one of the great environmental health hazards of our time
• Reduce the amount of toxic fumes released into the atmosphere during burning
• Save natural resources such as oil which are depleting so it is crucial to save where we can. For every tonne of recycled polythene, 1.8 tonnes of oil could be saved.
• Promote a healthy environment that promotes various lifestyles
• Donate 10% of our profits towards our annual tree planting campaign
The money raised will be leveraged with additional funding from the Aspire Fund to expand the waste collection programme and establish the recycling, production and printing plant.
column2: >CHART SHEET THAT SHOWS PROJECT EXECUTION TIMELINE (VIEW PDF VERSION)
column3:
>

 

We are an environmental management social enterprise focusing upon the vast reservoir of innovative capabilities that are ready to be unleashed into our world to reinstate a global culture of environmental responsibility.

We are running this campaign to raise 45% of the start-up capital which amounts to $92,000.00(US D) the other 55% will come as project finance support from the Aspire Fund, this will enable us execute our project and commence plastic recycling in order to actively join in the efforts geared at solving the plastic waste disposal problem one city at a time while serving the blossoming African retail market.

We produce Eco-friendly personalized plastic packaging to your doorstep. Our system empowers women - inspiring them to participate in solving the plastic waste disposal problem while improving their livelihoods. We believe that women across the globe are a force whose skills and experience can be harnessed to solve environmental problems.

This project is very important to us because of the following reasons:

column1: • It gives us the opportunity to contribute in protecting our world while also providing livelihoods to the poorest women (The green angels) in the society.
• It give us an opportunity to be part of the retail market revolution that is currently sweeping across Africa
• We will have on offer the creative ideas of our team of designers to the retail market across Africa
• The project will create a lot of awareness and education on safe plastic waste disposal practices

• The project will open up opportunities to interface with governmental and non-governmental organisations, private sector and civil society for better solid waste management policy formulation and implementation.
• We will be Promoting a healthy environment that sustains various lifestyles
• We will be providing jobs and livelihoods for the men and our women (The green angels) while also improving the environment.

column2: >Your contributions will help us achieve the under listed goals:

column1: • Your contributions will help establish a sustainable plastic recycling and production social enterprise
• Your contributions will go a long way in solving the plastic waste disposal problem
• Your contributions will help in reducing the amount of plastic that goes into water bodies and drainage and their attendant health problems
• Your contributions will create an environmentally sustainable business and investment opportunity for investors looking to be part of The Africa retail market
• Your contributions will cause people to be lifted out of poverty
• Your contributions will lead to healthier and happier societies
• Your contributions over time will go to plant trees to reduce the impact of climate change

If we do not reach our entire goal, the funds raised will be used to expand our waste collection system that will enable us trade in plastic and other waste material and have more leverage going forward.

IMPACT

Our environment is our most important resource. We cannot protect the environment, but we can protect her resources. The impact of unregulated waste is manifold and well understood – from the disease associated with the blocking of drains by the ubiquitous plastic bags given out freely with even the smallest purchase, to the effect on air quality of uncontrolled burning of waste (again, largely plastic), as well as the impacts of landfill gas from uncontrolled landfills. And this is before you take into consideration the visual impacts of uncontrolled littering. This campaign will:

Reduce CO2 emissions: In our first year of operation, we will recycle 600,000kg of plastic thus preventing the production of 42.849 tons of CO2.

Reduce Unemployment among the most vulnerable: We will create 500 indirect jobs in our first year among female recyclers who will participate in our plastic waste collection scheme and an additional 300 indirect jobs annually.

Create Small Scale Agricultural Enterprises: We will enable the creation of 25 micro and small scale agricultural enterprises for our most outstanding green angels through the establishment of an agricultural co-operative and capacity building that will educate our green angels on how to save, and invest in micro and small scale agro-based enterprises.

Reduce the Impact of Climate Change: We will invest 10% of our annual profits to bring more trees to our planet and campaign to raise awareness on the impact of climate change

The success of our campaign will go a long way in changing people’s attitude towards polythene waste disposal which seems to be the actual problem. Our efforts will create awareness at all levels and get everyone involved on better ways of handling plastic waste which will drastically reduce the problems associated with disposing polythene and plastic waste material one African city at a time.
• You can help to improve the lives of countless environmental heroes living in poverty
• With your help we can prevent plastic from entering our oceans and drainages, increase global recycling rates and create dignified employment to reduce extreme poverty
• Prolong the life span of plastic materials through reducing, re-using and recycling to reduce the demand for new plastic
• Reduce the amount of polythene waste materials that goes into unregulated landfills or worse gets burnt.
• Stop the uncontrolled burning of plastic which is considered one of the great environmental health hazards of our time
• Reduce the amount of toxic fumes released into the atmosphere during burning
• Save natural resources such as oil which are depleting so it is crucial to save where we can. For every tonne of recycled plastic, 1.8 tonnes of oil could be saved.
• Promote a healthy environment that promotes various lifestyles
• Contributing to saving lives and livelihoods.

Experience has taught us that with dedication, hard work and focus we can solve huge problems if we set out to achieve results just like we did during our voluntary efforts with the Ebola Emergency Operations Centre setup to co-ordinate the Ebola virus disease response in Port Harcourt, Rivers State, Nigeria. The fact that we contributed in the effort that ensured the disease was successfully contained is a testimony to what we can achieve if we put our minds to it. Support our effort to make the world a better place while solving business problems.

Risks &
• Plastic recycling, production and printing plants are a capital intensive investment and funding will be one challenge that we will face.
<li>Having adequate power supply considering that power supply is very unstable in Nigeria
• Delays in build out such as unforeseen build out costs.
• Factory workers accommodation
<li>Maintenance and sourcing of equipment spares and parts

For the above listed risks and challenges, we have a dedicated and experienced team to support us and ensure our success all the way. From the management team of GROFIN Aspire fund that will be supporting us with additional funding as well as helping us navigate the difficult operating environment, increase market share, and grow our business to our in-house team of forward thinking members managing efficient and effective stock, inventory and procurement systems. We will also use our technical knowledge of power inverter technology to modify our equipment to function with minimal power. Project management techniques will be implemented to avoid unnecessary build out delays. Factory workers residence will be located in close proximity to the factory to eliminate unnecessary delays associated with travel and late arrival to work.

Other Ways You Can Help
• Make some noise, and share this page by word of mouth!
• Share this page on all social media platforms. The more people we can reach the greater chance we have of reaching our goal.
• Use Indiegogo share tools to spread the message!
• Share our Facebook page with your friends, the more people we can get following us, the greater chance for success we will have.
• After making a contribution and getting one of our awesome perks, you can help by inviting your friends, family and peers by sharing our campaign.
• Please back the project and tell everyone you know to help spread the word!
• Share it on Facebook
• Email it to five friends
• Tweet about it

","Kiakiapaks is an environmental management social enterprise focused on providing Eco-friendly and sustainable solutions that clean our environment. For over half a decade, we have been hauling dirt.  Yes, dirt.  Clearly, what we didn’t realize was the negative impact of burning of waste at the unregulated landfills which was largely plastics in each load of “dirt”.  We were disgusted, disappointed, and aware that we needed to make a change. We realized improper waste disposal and burning is affecting the health and environment of the poorest members of society who suffer adverse health effects.  We also realized that as a result of the improper disposal of waste, our oceans currently holds 150 million tons of plastic with the sad reality that in the next 34 years our oceans will hold more plastic than fish.  Time for change.With the knowledge that everyone contributes to plastic waste generation, we set out to develop a plastic waste management system where everyone through communication and social mobilization campaigns share in the responsibility of raising awareness on safe waste handling practices
column2: aimed at dealing with the attitudinal problems associated with plastic waste disposal as well as the development of an inclusive system that seeks to tap into the resource value of waste plastic to tackle economic, social and environmental problems that bother on job creation, poverty reduction, girl/women empowerment and climate change.Looking at the data coming from the African retail sector, we understand that the demand for innovative packaging solutions will be on the rise going into the future
column3: being passionate about designing sustainable solutions that clean our environment and in a bid to encourage the retail sector to be ecologically responsible by using recycled products over virgin products, we developed KIAKIAPAKS.KIAKIAPAKS are personalised re-usable plastic packaging that promotes business brands to your doorstep
column4: made from high quality recycled plastic waste. Our aim is to empower women to be the force to drive our objective of reducing, re-using and recycling waste plastic material while also driving the attitudinal change necessary to solving the problems associated with plastic waste disposal.Our objective:

column1: To run an economically viable social enterprise
To improve plastic waste collection process and fees to empower poor women
To drive behavioural change through communication and social mobilization
To apply Eco-friendly solutions to retail sector packaging problems.
To apply e-commerce and digital solutions to penetrate and gain a sizable market share.
Focus on the (4) four key (Gabon, Botswana, Ghana and Nigeria) developing retail markets and the entire African continent.
In the next 5 years, we see KIAKIAPAKS expanding into paper packaging made from high quality recycled waste paper materials.We aim to:
Creatively promote business brands with emphasis on the evolving African retail market

Drive a communication and social mobilization strategy using our success story and the transformation stories of our GREEN ANGELS that will cause the needed attitudinal change that is required to solve the plastic waste disposal problem.
Prolong the life span of plastic materials through reducing, re-using and recycling to reduce the demand for virgin plastic
Reduce the amount of plastic waste materials that goes into unregulated landfills or worse gets burnt.
Stop the uncontrolled burning of plastic which is considered one of the great environmental health hazards of our time
Reduce the amount of toxic fumes released into the atmosphere during burning
Save natural resources such as oil which are depleting so it is crucial to save where we can. For every tonne of recycled polythene, 1.8 tonnes of oil could be saved.
Promote a healthy environment that promotes various lifestyles
Donate 10% of our profits towards our annual tree planting campaign

The money raised will be leveraged with additional funding from the Aspire Fund to expand the waste collection programme and establish the recycling, production and printing plant. CHART SHEET THAT SHOWS PROJECT EXECUTION TIMELINE (VIEW PDF VERSION) We are an environmental management social enterprise focusing upon the vast reservoir of innovative capabilities that are ready to be unleashed into our world to reinstate a global culture of environmental responsibility.We are running this campaign to raise 45% of the start-up capital which amounts to $92,000.00(US D) the other 55% will come as project finance support from the Aspire Fund, this will enable us execute our project and commence plastic recycling in order to actively join in the efforts geared at solving the plastic waste disposal problem one city at a time while serving the blossoming African retail market.We produce Eco-friendly personalized plastic packaging to your doorstep. Our system empowers women - inspiring them to participate in solving the plastic waste disposal problem while improving their livelihoods. We believe that women across the globe are a force whose skills and experience can be harnessed to solve environmental problems.This project is very important to us because of the following reasons:
It gives us the opportunity to contribute in protecting our world while also providing livelihoods to the poorest women (The green angels) in the society.
It give us an opportunity to be part of the retail market revolution that is currently sweeping across Africa
We will have on offer the creative ideas of our team of designers to the retail market across Africa
The project will create a lot of awareness and education on safe plastic waste disposal practices

The project will open up opportunities to interface with governmental and non-governmental organisations, private sector and civil society for better solid waste management policy formulation and implementation.
We will be Promoting a healthy environment that sustains various lifestyles
We will be providing jobs and livelihoods for the men and our women (The green angels) while also improving the environment.
Your contributions will help us achieve the under listed goals:
Your contributions will help establish a sustainable plastic recycling and production social enterprise
Your contributions will go a long way in solving the plastic waste disposal problem
Your contributions will help in reducing the amount of plastic that goes into water bodies and drainage and their attendant health problems
Your contributions will create an environmentally sustainable business and investment opportunity for investors looking to be part of The Africa retail market
Your contributions will cause people to be lifted out of poverty
Your contributions will lead to healthier and happier societies
Your contributions over time will go to plant trees to reduce the impact of climate change

About us
EcoVillage Uganda is a recognized community based organization which
aims to achieve most sustainable development and eco-friendly practices in the
rural areas of Masaka in Uganda. Founded in 2010 [registration number C.D
7063], we focus on promoting an energy-conscious society through creating
effective networks amongst students, educators, business and community leaders.
Our momentarily efforts focus on energy- and forest-saving projects. This
campaign however, is getting set up by our two german interns which are
currently in masaka.
Goal: Providing an
eco-friendly, inexpensive Energy Source for Schools
The goal of our campaign is
to raise enough money to establish at least five Biogas-Plants, preferably for
schools around Masaka. We already identified three schools which would be very
glad to receive a Biogas-Plant and posses the animals to make use of it. You
can see the amazing kids who would benefit from this eco-friendly, inexpensive
energy source on the added pictures!
Why Biogas-Plants?
Since forests are cut down
to provide fuel-wood and soil for agriculture, Uganda loses about 6.000
hectares of forests every 30 days. If no action is registered by 2050, Uganda’s
per capita forest cover will be zero (NEMA, 2009). Already 28 districts have
lost their entire forest ecosystem while another 19 districts have forest cover
lower than 1% (source: WWF).
In development countries
all over the world, locally installed, small-scale Biogas-Systems have proven
themselves as a cost efficient and effective solution to reduce the use of
conventional fuels, while utilizing resources which are already in hand! They
use bacteria to break down wet, organic waste like sewage, dung or food-remains
and transform it through fermentation into a usable mixture of gases and a
semi-solid residue. Through a piping-system, the Biogas is taken to the kitchen
where it is used with a Biogas-Stove. It is estimated that only a single rural
family can save up to three tones of wood annually, utilizing this technology
(source: ARTI). So a whole school could save lots of forest by using Biogas!
Additional Benefits
<ul>
•  Saving costs for firewood/kerosene/charcoal
•  Decreased greenhouse gas emissions
<li> Providing a healthy cooking-environment
through smoke-free combustion
<li> Connected toilet greatly improves
hygiene and doesn't need to be emptied
<li> Remaining bio-slurry is an excellent
manure/ feeding supplement for animals
The Costs
The whole Biogas-System is
going to cost about 850 $ each. To maximize the benefits it is necessary to
have a connected toilet. The calculation therefore includes a 6m<sup>3</sup>
plant (mainly consisting of a combined slurry- and gas container made of
concrete and buried underground), toilets with sections for boys and girls plus
the necessary first filling of the chamber with fresh cow-dung as well as
PVC-Piping, valves and a biogas-stove for the schoolkitchen.
Our additional Efforts
Additionally to our campaign on Indiegogo we started a fundraising
project called “Buy a Mile Campaign” targeting big companies which have
branches in Masaka. For that, we will gather a multinational crowd of
volunteers, mobilized through the AIESEC exchange program and locals, which
will go on an EcoBike-Ride with several EcoCamps in towns and
communities. It will be launched 6<sup>th</sup> of June 2016 and, depending on
the sponsor´s feedback, will go on up until the 9<sup>th</sup>. During our
EcoCamps we are giving trainings on eco-friendly behavior in schools, meeting
majors to promote environmental consciousness, sell food and play music to get
in contact with the communities. In this context we offer national and
international companies and institutions the possibility to buy the miles we ride, showcasing
their advertisements. After these campaigns succesfully raised the
necessary funds, we are going to install the plants together with the involved
volunteers to cut the costs for workers.
We are convinced that
through the combination of Indiegogo- and company-fundraising we are going to
mobilise enough funds to achieve our goal: To install an environmentally
friendly, sustainable and healthy energy source.

","Casa Xitla es un espacio dedicado a la ecología, los derechos humanos, la construcción de paz, las artes y las espiritualidades. Es un proyecto sin fines de lucro en donde se reúnen personas diversas que trabajan en torno a estos intereses. Somos una asociación civil y estamos buscando desarrollar de manera alternativa y ecológica nuestro espacio e instalaciones, y así marcar un precedente importante en México. Es por eso que buscamos que personas interesadas en este tipo de esfuerzos se involucren con nosotros y quisimos invitarlos a participar en el proyecto de hacer que Casa Xitla sea más luminosa a través de la implementación de la energía solar para 25 luminarias en los jardines de este espacio. Con ello todas las personas y diferentes grupos que vienen a este lugar a desarrollar sus planes, trabajos, seminarios, talleres, presentaciones, reuniones, eventos, etc. serán beneficiados. Este plan de iluminar Casa Xitla con paneles de energía solar ayudaría a ahorrar mucha energía eléctrica, y ello es parte de nuestra iniciativa como espacio de aprovechamiento de las energías limpias, la procuración y respeto al medio ambiente, y es un esfuerzo más por desarrollar un espacio autosustentable.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

column1: Who
are we? What do we work for?

recycling in Ecuador. We are a group of neighbors in Quito that work together
to b<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
a recycling culture by creating a human bond between the waste picker and the
citizen.

<div>
We are a team of 15 people, with diverse backgrounds and one common
interest: inclusive recycling. We are committed to ReciVeci and the waste pickers with whom we have

During the last 6 months we have generated a working community with

about their reality and implementing actions to generate change at a local
level.
Some of these actions include the development of a mobile app, web site
and social networks to promote the creation of a bond between neighbors and
their neighborhood recycler and sharing advice for the correct segregation of
waste at home.
Only 38% of households nationwide segregated their waste in 2014, this
shows we have lots of work to do!
We have supported the neighbourhood’s waste pickers in
creating their formal organization, boosting their access to social and labor
benefits in Ecuador. The association is called Asociación SONREIR (Smile
Association) and is composed by 10 individuals.

VERSIÓN EN ESPAÑOL (English version above)
¿Quiénes somos y qué buscamos?

ReciVeci es una iniciativa de voluntariado ciudadano, innovadora y transparente, que promueve el reciclaje inclusivo en Ecuador.  Somos un grupo de vecinos de Quito que nos organizamos para generar una Cultura de Reciclaje por medio de un vínculo humano entre recicladores y ciudadanos.
Trabajamos en:
· Separar residuos en los hogares ecuatorianos.
·  Aumentar eficiencia y fortalecer la organización de los recicladores de base.
· Capacitar a los vecinos y vincularlos al reciclador local.
· Generar herramientas tecnológicas.
Somos 15 profesionales con un interés común: el reciclaje inclusivo. Estamos comprometidos con ReciVeci y las recicladoras con quienes hemos creado un vínculo especial.
ReciVeci tiene gran importancia en el país al surgir desde la sociedad civil, lo que lo hace innovador y transparente.
¿Por qué hacemos esto?

En Quito - Ecuador, se requiere reforzar y fortalecer el reciclaje en la fuente ya que actualmente tan sólo se recicla el 25% del material potencialmente reciclable y el resto termina en botaderos a cielo abierto y rellenos sanitarios.
En este proceso PIERDE el reciclador, pues:
x   Las jornadas de trabajo son agotadoras: más de 8 horas diarias continuas de recolección (noche y madrugada),
x   Recorren, en suma, grandes distancias,
x   Tienen alto desgaste mental (muchas son madres que nunca dejan de pensar en sus hijos que quedan solos en casa o en compañía de familiar).
x  Se exponen a riesgos sanitarios
El reciclaje tiene nombre de mujer. Más del 70% de los recicladores en Ecuador son mujeres que mantienen a sus familias con los ingresos del reciclaje.
Al ser un grupo informal, social y económicamente excluido, no pueden acceder al seguro social, créditos bancarios y en general a los beneficios de cualquier ciudadano.

Recuerda que: lo que no se recicla termina en el ambiente, ocasionando impactos negativos a nuestros recursos y nuestra salud a largo plazo. Un proceso de separación ordenado desde su fuente implicaría un ahorro urbano importante y aumentaría la calidad de vida de los/las recicladores/as.
Con la APLICACIÓN de ReciVeci el proceso de reciclaje de base será así:
En este proceso, GANA el reciclador y el ambiente, pues:
·  Los recicladores captan más material generando recursos económicos dignos
·  Se mejora la calidad de vida de estas familias,
·  Se crea el vínculo entre los vecin@s y l@s reciclador@s
·  Se visibiliza la calidad del servicio que brindan a la ciudadanía y al planeta
·  Cuentan con un centro de acopio con infraestructura adecuada para protegerse de sol y lluvia

El reciclaje NO ES “la persona que recoge la basura por la noche”. Esto estigmatiza el reciclaje y a la persona que recicla. ReciVeci promueve un servicio que hoy en día es profesional pero no se lo reconoce, es anónimo, es invisible y es femenino.
¿Cómo funciona ReciVeci?

ReciVeci está trabajando en un barrio piloto de Quito, donde los vecinos y vecinas (los ""vecis"") serán los protagonistas del proyecto ya que los resultados esperados son a escala barrial. Nuestro sueño es que, ReciVeci se convierta en un modelo replicable en otros barrios de la ciudad y del país.
En sólo 3 pasos puedes ser un ReciVeci:

1. Colabora, comparte y mantente informado dando like a nuestra página de Facebook, siguiéndonos en Twitter y compartiendo nuestros mensajes. Usa las herramientas de Indiegogo para difundir este proyecto.
2. Separa tus residuos.
3. Identifica al reciclador/a de tu barrio, arma tu funda y entrégale tus residuos reciclables.
¿Qué hemos hecho hasta el momento?

Durante 6 meses nos hemos reunido y hemos creado una comunidad de trabajo junto a las recicladoras de base de un barrio de Quito, con el fin de conocer su realidad e implementar acciones de cambio a nivel local.

Estas acciones han incluido el desarrollo de una aplicación móvil, página web y redes sociales para que los vecinos creen un vínculo con sus recicladores de base y difundir consejos para la correcta separación de residuos en los hogares.
¡Tan sólo el 38% de hogares a nivel nacional separó sus residuos en el año 2014, lo que nos ha mostrado que tenemos mucho trabajo por hacer!

En este tiempo se ha apoyado a las recicladoras de este barrio, para organizarse y asociarse formalmente, impulsando su acceso a beneficios laborales y sociales en Ecuador. La asociación está hoy en día conformada por 10 recicladoras de base y se llama Asociación SONREIR.
ReciVeci destinará tu donación para:
Nuestra meta es recaudar $15.000 (dólares de EEUU) para mejorar la situación laboral de las recicladoras del barrio donde estamos trabajando. Con este dinero invertiremos en:
1. La capacitación puerta a puerta a las personas de la zona piloto para que los ciudadanos y ciudadanas entreguen sus materiales reciclables separados directamente al reciclador/a.
2. La adecuación física del centro de acopio de las recicladoras de la Asociación Sonreír para poder clasificar el material reciclable protegidas del sol y la lluvia.

3. La adquisición de equipo de trabajo para que los/as recicladores/as y ReciVeci construyan una estadística del impacto del servicio de recolección puerta a puerta, a lo largo del año y se pueda visualizar en la app móvil.
4. El equipamiento completo a las recicladoras que incluye: mandiles, guantes, capas de lluvia, triciclos de recolección, identificaciones, big bags, etc.
5. La implementación de una App móvil, una página web y manejo de redes sociales para fortalecer el vínculo entre recicladores y ciudadanos y capacitarlos.

6. El lanzamiento masivo del proyecto ReciVeci con un público objetivo de 3.000 personas en un día. Las recicladoras recibirán a los vecinos/as que asistan al evento con sus residuos y se presentarán con ellos/as para brindarles un mejor servicio.
Es por esto que necesitamos TU APOYO. Tu contribución abre el camino para que ReciVeci revolucione el reciclaje inclusivo y cambie la vida de miles de familias, todo mientras protegemos el ambiente.
¡Conviértete en un ReciVeci, este proyecto es tuyo!

","Your contribution helps ReciVeci revolutionize inclusive recycling and will change the life of thousands of urban waste pickers and their families, all whilst protecting the environment. Your contribution, even from USD5, is important to improve the working conditions of the waste pickers (such as adequate their collection center and provision of adequate workwear), the implementation of a mobile app and door to door training of residents in our pilot area in Quito, Ecuador.

Tu contribución abre el camino para que ReciVeci revolucione el reciclaje inclusivo a través de soluciones humanas, tecnológicas  para así cambiar la vida de miles de recicladores de base y sus familias , todo mientras protegemos el ambiente. Tu donación, incluso desde $5, es importante para mejorar las condiciones de trabajo de los recicladores (por ejemplo adecuación física del centro de acopio y dotación de ropa y equipamiento de trabajo), la implementación de app móvil y la capacitación puerta a puerta de los residentes en nuestra área piloto en Quito, Ecuador.
ENGLISH VERSION (Versión en ESPAÑOL abajo):
Who
are we? What do we work for?
Reciveci is a citizen volunteership initiative that promotes inclusive
recycling in Ecuador. We are a group of neighbors in Quito that work together
to build
a recycling culture by creating a human bond between the waste picker and the
citizen.
We work in :
Increasing the percentage of recycable material segregation in
Ecuadorian homes.
Improving
the recycling efficiency of waste pickers.
Educating neighbours and linking them directly to their neighbourhood waste pickers.
Generating
tools to strengthen citizen education through: workshops, mobile apps, social
networks
Strengthening the social organization of waste pickers and boosting
their entrepreneurship potential.
We are a team of 15 people, with diverse backgrounds and one common
interest: inclusive recycling. We are committed to ReciVeci and the waste pickers with whom we have
developed a unique bond, and we will invest all our energies to make this project
a banging success.
ReciVeci
emerges from civil society, making it an innovative and transparent project of
great importance for our country.
Why do we do this?
There is a need to improve recycling at the source in
Quito-Ecuador, as only 25% of potentially recyclable material is processed, the
remaining materials ends up in landfills and dumps.
CURRENTLY, waste
picking works like this:
The recycler loses with this process because:
The work day is grueling: more than 8 hours of daily continuous material
sourcing (night and early mornings)
They
walk long distances
They experience mental strain (many are mothers who never stop thinking
about their kids who are left alone at home or in care of a family member)
They are exposed to sanitary risks
Recycling has a women’s name.
More than 70% of waste pickers in Ecuador are women, who maintain their families
with the income earned from recycling.
Being part of an informal sector that is socially and economically
excluded, they don’t have access to social security, loans and regular benefits
available for an ordinary citizen.
Remember: what is not recycled ends up in the environment, causing
negative impacts to our resources and our health. An orderly process of waste
segregation at the source would result in significant urban savings and would immensely
improve the recycler’s quality of life.
With the ReciVeci App, waste recycling would look
like this:
A win-win process for the environment and the recycler
as:
The recycler captures more material, generating higher economic
resources
The quality of life of families is significantly enhanced,
A bond is generated between neighbors and recyclers
The quality of the service provided by the informal recyclers is made
visible to the public and the planet
The recyclers will have a waste collection center with adequate infrastructure
to protect them, and the materials, from sun and rain
Recycling IS NOT “the person who picks the garbage at night”. This stigmatizes
recycling and the people that recycle. ReciVeci promotes a professional service that is not currently acknowledged
it is anonymous, invisible and feminine.
How does ReciVeci work?
ReciVeci is working in a pilot neighborhood in Quito, where neighbors
(the “vecis”) will be the project’s protagonists, as results are expected at a
neighborhood level. Our dream is that ReciVeci will become a replicable model
for other neighborhoods in the city and nationwide.
You can become a ReciVeci in only 3 easy steps:
Support, share and stay informed by giving like to our Facebook page,
following us on twitter and sharing our messages. Use Indiegogo’s tools to
promote our project.
Separate your waste.
Identify your neighborhood’s recycler, gather your recyclables
in a bag and give them to him/her.
What have we done so far?
During the last 6 months we have generated a working community with
waste pickers in a pilot neighborhood in Quito, with the objective of learning
about their reality and implementing actions to generate change at a local
level.
Some of these actions include the development of a mobile app, web site
and social networks to promote the creation of a bond between neighbors and
their neighborhood recycler and sharing advice for the correct segregation of
waste at home.
Only 38% of households nationwide segregated their waste in 2014, this
shows we have lots of work to do!
We have supported the neighbourhood’s waste pickers in
creating their formal organization, boosting their access to social and labor
benefits in Ecuador. The association is called Asociación SONREIR (Smile
Association) and is composed by 10 individuals.
ReciVeci will be using your donation for:
Our goal is to collect $15,000 to improve the working conditions of the
recyclers in our pilot neighbourhood. The money gathered will be invested in:
Door to door training of residents in our pilot area about waste segretation at home and its delivery to their neighborhood recycler.
Renovation of a 60 m2 lot in the Association’s waste collection
center to improve waste handling conditions, protecting recyclers and the
material, from sun and rain.
Buying work equipment, such as scales, so that the recyclers and
ReciVeci can generate statistics and indicators of the impact of the door-to-door
collection service, which will be visualized in our mobile app.
Purchasing of complete work apparel for the recyclers including: aprons,
gloves, rain ponchos, tricycles for waste collection, identification tags, big
bags, etc.
The implementation of a mobile app, web site and social network
management to strengthen the bond between recycler and citizen, all of which
will also work as education channels for environmental training.
Launch of the ReciVeci project with a target
audience of 3,000 people/day. The recyclers will welcome the neighbours that
attend the event bringing their recyclables, host a meet and greet, sparking
interactions to gather information on how to improve their service.
You now know our story and the reasons why we need your SUPPORT. Your
contribution will lead the way to ensure ReciVeci will revolutionize inclusive
recycling and change the livelihoods of thousands of families, all whilst
protecting the environment.
Become a Reciveci, this project
is yours!
